1.description: This place has a good selection of alcohol products, but the prices are a bit higher than most others in the area.  I wouldn't mind paying higher prices if the service justified it, but the workers here just aren't friendly, or even helpful.  I'd try other places first before I try here again.

2.description: Local party store with all your party needs. Party store meaning alcohol pantry.Good prices on bottles, sometimes you can find some unique alcohol. I needed something for a gift and the clerk suggested Barenjager.  Never seen it before, it was a big hit. Some different bottles from other countries.They also sell hookah pipes and have cold pints of Jager, if you call ahead they might throw whatever alc you need into the fridge. Cold Remy Red is great.Staff is helpful.

0.description: Alright, maybe part of the reason I love this place is the guy didn't believe I was 21.  SCORE!  I've been an on-again off-again now back on-again patron of this bottle shop for quite some time.  And I'm really quite impressed with the semi-decent wine selection.  I mean, all things considered, it kind of looks bodega-ish.  But it's not!The guys are always nice and they surprisingly have a pretty wide array of beverages for your consumption pleasure.

28.description: I went here on a FRIDAY, bought two draft beers and paid $3.50...Enough said!

1.description: Good food, good beer, decent ambiance - but it's a dive bar, so don't expect a ton. My boyfriend says they pour an excellent Guinness (see Andrew H.'s review), and they had my favorite Stiegl grapefruit radler, so I was really happy! The drinks are also a great price. We also ordered food and a few drinks. I was mostly pleased with my order -  I had a burger with onion rings, and everything was delicious...except for the patty. Maybe it was just the shape of it, but it didn't taste super fresh. The burger also fell apart a little as I ate it, but the onion rings were the best I've ever had. Waitstaff is nice and does a good job. I'll come back!

9.description: Good sandwiches and good beer make any afternoon a good one. This bar is the perfect out-of-the-way place to enjoy craft beer from all over the region. Not only is it good craft beer, it is well-priced craft beer. It's a nice enough place to kill time waiting for a bus, or to kick back after work. Sometime, I'll have to get breakfast before work, as the food I enjoy after work is quite delicious. I'm swinging by after work today.

29.description: This bar is walking distance from my house - always a great plus. Cheap strong drinks, great fries, nice new owners and Ronnie Vegas! What more an you ask for?

23.description: Look up "dive bar" and Webster's will have a pic of Rabbits. Walking through the door, A drunk guy named Chuck loudly welcomed us in. I ordered a long island which was pretty much enough to get me drunk.  A guy comes in selling hats making Rabbits a one stop shop.  I had a great time watching the NCAA tournament and socializing with the patrons. Its a friendly atmosphere with inexpensive drinks. I'll definitely return.

5.description: Good family bar. I love the food!! The owners are friendly and they know how to hire a good staff. Coming back for some specials soon :-)

31.description: Rabbits is a nice place to have a few and if needed they have excellent burgers .

25.description: Average bar, jukebox, pool table. Seems full of regulars. Really good cheap fried food which happens to be the perfect companion to good beers and good cheap drinks. I'd have a drink (or five) there anytime.

12.description: Very low key bar with a fantastic (and always updated beermenus) tap list of craft beer.  Prices can't be beat.  Tuesday night trivia (8pm) is a cool bonus.  Definitely worth stopping in if you're in the area.

21.description: Nice little dive bar with good service and reasonably priced drinks.

16.description: Such an awesome neighborhood spot. Every bartender has been phenomenal. TV's, pool tables, and drink prices are all a recipe for a good time.

17.description: The neighborhood this bar is located in is most certainly not Sauganash. It is Forest Glen. I have no idea where Yelp gets the neighborhood information from, but they are wrong way too often.Anyways, this bar is a decent  "dive" (as some people may call it), although I just look at it as a regular "old school" Chicago bar. The million dollar rehabbed theme bars have ruined the bar scene in this city. This place needs to live on.

10.description: Top notch craft beer in an unpretentious dive bar.  The owner really keeps a wide variety of good stuff and cycles through it so there's almost always something you haven't had before (or would love to have again).

11.description: This place is just perfectly "divey" and friendly, exactly what the Dr. ordered on a Friday afternoon.  I have now been here several times and each time its feels like its the same crowd that tries to buy you shots and drinks.  Its fantastic!Everyone raves about the food, so look forward to trying that soon.Thank you Rabbits for being the perfect place to stop taking yourself seriously after work...

26.description: (Lunch-time)This is a nasty little blue-collar bar with a bunch of friendly drunks. They have two huge flat screens and a BBQ burger that will make you fall to your knees. Overall, not a bad joynt.

27.description: i have recently became a regular here with the recent addition of Ketel One Vodka to there shelves. and i must say they do a great job here. the drinks are cheep and well poured. specials change often and make there already low prices even lower. the burgers are outstanding. the staff are very friendly and the other regulars are very outgoin. plus, they've have flat screens every where in this place. what more can you ask for in a neighborhood bar?

0.description: It's a neighborhood bar with decent food and a very good craft beer selection.  With over a dozen craft beers on tap (plus Miller Lite) and a 5-6 page bottle/can list, there's plenty to choose from.  It's by no means a gastropub, but the burgers are big and prepared in front of you.  Bianca was very friendly and helpful.  We'll definitely be going back.

20.description: Nice local bar. Friendly staff/patrons. Decent food.

19.description: 28 check-ins here and I still haven't written a review?  What the hell is wrong with me?!What can I say about a bar that seems to have the simple basics of drinking and bar food nailed?DRINKS:  Dozens of domestic and imports both bottled and on tap.  The rotation here is fantastic.  Sure, they have their staples, but the fact that I can walk in and try something new each & every week excites me!  The cocktails are made pretty near perfect... Enough alcohol that I can taste it in my drink but not too much that I'm makin' the stank face while sipping.FOOD:  1/2 lb burgers are to die for!!!  Typical bar apps like stix, 'shrooms, poppers & more.  Pizza oven for frozens.  They even have a salad for those who wish to keep it light & simple.  Oh and they serve breakfast Monday-Saturday... So much food for only $5!!!PRICING: Two words - FAIR & REASONABLESTAFF:  The bartenders here aren't all cookie-cutter images of each other.  In fact, they all have very distinct & unique personalities that keep their regulars (and newbies who become regulars) coming back for more.  You've got your classic wise-crackin' "bitchy" type, your extra flirty type, your down to earth friendly type, your reminds-me-of-my-sister type and there's even one with an adorable accent!  Regardless of who's serving you up a cold one, you're sure to be welcomed  warmly & served quickly.ATMOSPHERE: Dive style bar with tons of FRIENDLY regulars!  Whether it's your first time or fiftieth time, you're sure to make good conversation with the couple on your left or the group of city workers on your right.AMENITIES:  Pool table, dart boards, internet jukebox, karaoke on select Saturday nights (look for the sign on the front of the building telling you whether it's going on that weekend or not) and 4 LARGE flat screens with three smaller flat screens at each of the three tables showing whatever sports are in-season at the time!HONORABLE MENTION:  I don't about you but an ill-stocked bathroom drives me bonkers!  The bathrooms HERE are always clean and I've never walked in and not had toilet paper to wipe my ass with, soap to wash my hands with or towels to dry them with.  So... Next time your in the area, stop in before heading home!  Shit, even if you're not in the area, come by for a burger and a pint - You won't be sorry!

33.description: Ah, Rabbits, what it lacks in atmosphere, it makes up for with..atmosphere. Rough hewn beer joint with some fine Elvis impersonating going on. Not the kind of place you'll feel like a regular at with your first visit, but it beats going to bar louie.

2.description: They pour an excellent pint of Guinness!It was important to lead off with that very particular feedback because of how many places don't seem to actually know how to do this in a city with a prevalent Irish heritage.  The fact that these delicious pints are only $5 is even more reason to have more than one. This is a regular Monday night place for myself and a few friends after teaching bagpipes and drums at the Irish American Heritage Center a couple blocks away.  Whether we come hungry for any of the tasty yet inexpensive fare, or just thirsty for the excellent and nicely priced draught selection, Rabbit's never disappoints.

32.description: What do you do if you've just run through the woods for an hour and you feel sweaty, dirty, and gross?  You go to Rabbit's for some beer and deep fried foods.  Rabbit's is a nice little blue collar type bar.  There is a kick ass jukebox, a pool table, and lots of surly regulars with hearts of gold.  Even though I looked a mess, people still offered to buy me and my friend beers, cheeseburgers, and even a condo.  Thank you, Rabbit's, for a nice ending to an interesting run.

18.description: I've been here for Hawk's games after work, cause it's close and I get out pretty late/when they usually start anyway. Good vibes, good cheap drinks/beer and I don't feel like everyone's looking at me funny cause I'm not a regular. Super relaxed place, I wish I came here more often. Also stopped in today to see if they had any pop I could buy 'cause I forgot to order some with lunch order from a pizza place nearby. The owner was super awesome and gave me a 2 liter he had from a previous order himself, just threw it in with my order of a cup of pop. I love neighborhood places, good friendly people with an awesome work/service ethic.I know it looks a little weary from the outside, but the bathrooms are clean and bright, and there's a jukebox. What more could you need?

13.description: So, I can go down to Wicker Park and pay $8.50 for a beer, or I can hang out here with a couple of buddies, each of us drink as much beer as we can safely handle, and spend about $40 total. Yeah, tough decision.Seriously, this is the quintessential neighborhood bar. Pool table, darts, trivia on Tuesdays, cheap drinks, and surprisingly good burgers. The locals are occasionally a bit rambunctious but they mean well. Save your money and just come here if you are in the neighborhood already.

4.description: Nice place, but the owner ruins it. Apparently he deems it appropriate to judge his patrons by their beer choice.  Don't waste your time here. ..and don't give a guy like this your money.

24.description: I've been here for Hawk's games after work, cause it's close and I get out pretty late/when they usually start anyway. Good vibes, good cheap drinks/beer and I don't feel like everyone's looking at me funny cause I'm not a regular. Super relaxed place, I wish I came here more often. Also stopped in today to see if they had any pop I could buy 'cause I forgot to order some with lunch order from a pizza place nearby. The owner was super awesome and gave me a 2 liter he had from a previous order himself, just threw it in with my order of a cup of pop. I love neighborhood places, good friendly people with an awesome work/service ethic.I know it looks a little weary from the outside, but the bathrooms are clean and bright, and there's a jukebox. What more could you need?

6.description: Rabbits is okay. My co- workers and I order from Rabbits for lunch from time to time. I am not a fan of their burgers the patties taste frozen so I usually go for the wings. The wings do not come with celery and you do have to request it if you want it and the blue cheese dressing tastes weird. The mac and cheese bites are really good too. I've only ever had one drink at Rabbits and it was a long island. It wasn't special. All its a local watering hole that has food next door to my job so on occasion I don't mind ordering from here when I am at work and need a quick bite for lunch, other than that nah.

22.description: The place is called rabbits. What else can you want. They also have small Tv screens next to tables and to me that just rocks.

15.description: What a great place to have a beer with some very good people.  Great staff and owners and food....now onto the one of the best beer lists in the city.  The ever changing tap list will keep you on your toes waiting to see what's next.

7.description: I have been going to this place ever since I moved into the neighborhood four years ago.  Absolutely a great place to grab a good beer.  Joe and Mary who own the spot are very friendly and the bartenders are just as good.  They have great daily specials on drinks and food everyday of the week.  Where else on a Monday are you gonna get a great beef sandwich with fries for a mere five backs and the serving is substantial.  Speaking  of the food I must say the the burgers are probably one of the best I have ever had and if your in there on a Saturday night you can't go wrong with the steak sandwich special they have going on.  As far as drinks they have a great selection of craft beers and Joe always has a good selection of beers on tap. As far as service I think they have a great staff. Jay, Beeata, Carol and Erica definitely know how to serve up great food, drinks,and conversation.  Other perks include a pool table and great juke box.  Oh and how can I forget plenty of TV's to catch any Cubs, Sox, Bear, Bulls, or Blackhawks game.

8.description: This is a place where beer snobs and swill-drinkers alike can sit shoulder to shoulder and agree the prices and selection are pretty awesome for a neighborhood dive. Settle in at the bar for a Bulls game with a $3 tallboy of PBR ($2 Tuesdays) or order a DogFishHead 60, 90 or 120 (really! 120! WTH?) Fun, friendly, cheap with nice TVs, decent food and pool+darts.

30.description: I've driven past this place practically my whole adult life.  I always wondered what type of place this was & what knd of shennanigans took place inside.  I would always see people walking out of the joynt with beads around their neck, man-hugging each other, noise makersin hand...an this was on any given weekday during the year!I finally had a chance to check it out.  The place is a regular hangout for an old gradeschool friend of mine & we recently reconnected over a few beers here.  I was greeted by the warmest, friendliest, most accomodating group of regulars that I have EVER experienced as a newbie.  If glitz & glamour is your scene, don't go here.  This place is for the non- pretentious, down to earth, easy to please beer drinker.

3.description: Craft beers, cheap drinks, full bar, pool table, darts, karaoke, all around tvs, performer on weekends, and daily specials. Oh, and the soup of the day is whiskey.

14.description: Stopped in for a beer today. Had the Sam Adams double bock.  Excellent selection of beers. Didn't try the food but the prices look great. Will definitely be back.

3.description: This subway is horrible. it is so slow. i went there today for a quick stop and they had two workers. the guy was sooo slow. literally took 25 mins to make two foot long subs (i looked at my watch). The girl who seemed like she knew what she was doing, was very rude. she obviously doesn't enjoy her job and refused to help me and helped 3 other people in back of me while i waited for the guy to make my time consuming subs. I don't mind if you are new but the whole vibe threw me off. I don't recommend going here unless you want to leave in a horrible mood. The girl was so rude I would hope for at least a smile and not have someone tell me she wasn't going to take my order and that I can wait for someone else to take it. The only upside about that visit was leaving.

1.description: It's Subway. You know what you're getting when you come here.The restaurant is clean. Check!The service is on par with other Subway stores. Some employees are rude, some are spot on. The day crew is usually better than the night crew.Parking is convenient.Eat fresh.

2.description: The only reason this Subway stands out for me, is b/c it was one of the very first Subways I ever went to so many years ago(if not the first),  back when they were new to Chicagoland. In addition, my family used to often hit up this location, before driving north on the Edens to either Ravinia or the Botanic Garden. Not surprisingly, myself and everyone in my family have pretty much moved on from Subway over the years.At least when I went here last earlier this year, desperate to stop my hunger for food, the sub I had was of their typical mediocre quality. It was nothing terrible or rememberable, obviously.I did appreciate that the person who made my sub was friendly, and that they still have the same cookies as I remember them from years ago, the reason I settled on giving them 2 stars. However, I'd probably hit up somewhere else for a sandwich next time, and that's that.

0.description: I like Subway for an inexpensive healthy meal.  $6.63 feeds 2 people.  A 12" tuna sandwich on Italian herbs & cheese w/provolone, spinach, tomatoes, cucumber, pickles, red onions, green peppers, giardiniera peppers & sriracha sauce.I can be like Jared.  Uhhh maybe not.

4.description: Rude and inconsiderate employees. Food is same. 2 stars for the cleanliness. Barely.

3.description: Just had my hair done here last week and LOVED it!  My hair is long and I needed highlights.  I had some ideas, but followed the advice of the stylist, Flavia.  Not only did she do a wonderful job with my hair, she completely pampered me with a shoulder massage before the service!!!!  Her scalp massage during the shampoo was the best I've ever had.  Highly, highly, highly recommend her and the salon.  Everyone there is so friendly and talented.

1.description: Giving this place one star is a bit of a stretch. I came in to get a hair trim, which they couldn't seem to remember. They kept asking, "what are you here for?", even though I had said at least four or five times "just a trim". I asked for a quarter of an inch and then they took off 4 inches. Then they straightened my hair, even though I didn't ask for it. The ends looked horribly cut. I wish I had never gone there. I'd rather have gone to sports clips. So unless you're looking for some place to give you scarecrow end haircut, burnt ears, and a years worth of regret, do not get your hair cut here.

2.description: I have had mani and pedicures here. The facility is VERY clean which is very important to me, and the ladies are all welcoming and friendly and there is a fun atmosphere throughout, likely due to it being a family business. Glas is wonderful at helping to analyze what an appropriate color would be for the customer and she does a tremendous job at applying the polish. The preparation for my feet is so relaxing I could take a nap!  I have not had my hair done here but I am thinking about changing stylists and I always see cute cuts coming out of Belisima Dona and the stylists wear trendy styles, too. So I may be coming here for my coifs! The only drawback is lack of parking but its never been a problem.

0.description: I visited this salon first time,Flavia was working with me.My hair is very difficult,curly and have orange pigment,wich I don't like.I asked her to cut and color without trace of red .She was very professioal and patient explaining me nature of my hir and how to take care of them.I left very happy with color of my hair exactly wahat I wished.I will definately go next time and also will buy more hair product from them.Highly satisfied.L.Z.

3.description: Julie created a breathtaking centerpiece for my engagement party. It really made our sweetheart table stand out, and my fiance and I received so many compliments on it throughout the night. I'm definitely going to go back to Julie for my wedding flowers!

1.description: I phoned in an order to Sauganash Flowers to deliver a "just because" bouquet to my wife. The person taking my order asked how much I wished to spend, and I replied $50. My wife received a beautiful bouquet that was larger than I expected. I didn't think much of it until I looked at my credit card statement and saw that I was billed $150, not $50. Based upon the size of the bouquet and base, it is apparent that the person taking my order misheard my request to spend $50.Here's the rub: I called Sauganash Flowers to discuss the overcharge and see if I could get a partial refund or credit toward a future order, but no one returned my call. I called again and spoke with a person (different from the one who took my order) who told me that the owner is out of town but will call me back. I never got a call back. Clearly, the fine folks at Sauganash Flowers have no desire to discuss this matter any further. Not cool. At all.The fine folks at Sauganash Flowers have received enough of my money. I will take my business elsewhere.

2.description: This is my go to place for a corsage.  Lots of daddy daughter dances and they wouldn't be the same without beautiful flowers.  They always do a good job for me.

5.description: Ordered flowers from Sauganash for a funeral.  The resulting flower arrangement was nice, but not as large as we requested (and paid extra for), and some of the flowers were wilted.  Underwhelming, for sure.  Also, I called there twice - once to order and once to confirm on the day of - and both times the person on the other line was slightly less than professional.  Not a business I would use again.

0.description: I have to commend Sauganash Flowers for providing outstanding service and beautiful arrangements. Julie (owner and florist) did a wonderful job with the bouquet arrangements we ordered. We could not have asked for a better arrangement of flowers that she provided us. From the beginning, she was such a delight to work with and I will definitely be coming back to her for her services in the future. She provides outstanding customer service and it is readily noticeable in how she treats her customers. I felt that she really cared about our needs and saw to it that she provide the best experience possible.  Her arrangements are reasonably priced and look absolutely beautiful. Relatives and friends were blown away by the color and flower selection in her arrangements. I recommend Sauganash Flowers to all my friends and family. Out of the slew of florists in the Chicagoland area that I have had chance to work with, this florist is far and away the best of them. Do yourself a favor and give Sauganash Flowers a call!

4.description: Outstanding service, Outstanding customer service. I ordered funeral flowers for my Mom. Julie was extremely helpful, I called from out of town she took her time to go over what I would need and even referred me to other sites to see arrangements I was seeking.  The flowers were beautiful, the arrangements were larger than expected. The flowers were fresh and vibrant. Would definitely recommend Sauganash and I am highly particular

1.description: Liz is great! She is so friendly and makes you feel at home in her beautiful peaceful spa. I had this small vein burst on my face for years and never imagined it would be easy to remove/treat. But after one appointment with Liz, it was gone!Since then I have been back for her wonderful facial treatments that are relaxing and always have me glowing for weeks. Her prices are fair- I pay $90 for a 45-60 minute facial treatment. The best part is that she customizes the treatment every time, depending on my skin issues. I just show up and talk with her for a few minutes while enjoying snacks and then I can relax the rest of the time while she works her magic. She is enthusiastic and knowledgeable in her equipment and products. Great find!

2.description: Jeanie has been taking care of my skin for over a year and a half now and it's never looked or felt better. I've struggled with acne my whole life, up until now. I've been to many a dermatologists who throw me on some medication that makes my skin even worse plus side effects. I've also used many different skin care lines from Proactiv to Clinique to Pevonia to Aveda. The skin care she recommends has been the best I've ever used. Her gentle and fluid touch shows her expertise.  I've never met an esthetician with more passion for skincare and I'm a hair stylist who's worked at 2 high-end day spas.  She checks on me after my service to see how I'm feeling after a few days. I've NEVER had anyone care that much. I love her so much I've sent my Aunt to her and my own clients. They all love her and how improved their skin is. Jeanine is truly a master!

0.description: My skin has never looked better! Highly recommend Salon Ifko!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Kids' Hair

12.description: Lana is a ROCK STAR...I had a very bad experience with another permanent makeup person. Lana was actually recommended by another professional who told me that Lana is the very best! She's a true professional and will make certain that you are happy with the results. I would recommend her to anyone & everyone.... And, on top of it all, she's a registered nurse which made my comfort level even greater.Lana is definitely THE BEST!

3.description: I recently had my eyebrows tattooed by Lana. It is a two-step process, the two appointments are about one month apart. I am due for my second appointment this weekend at which time I plan to also get the eyeliner done. Lana is extremely professional - both with her communication via telephone/email while setting up the appointment, the office is clean and relaxing, and she wore a gown, mask, googles, and gloves during the entire procedure. She cleaned my entire face with alcohol before starting the procedure and I was impressed at how immaculate the whole set-up was. She even let me take videos while she was tattooing -- my friends were so curious how it's done, I wanted to have something to show them. Before even starting the tattoo process, Lana spent over two hours mixing pigments to find the perfect shade for my face. She was never rushed and often mixed and remixed, shaped then reshaped until she was satisfied we found the perfect color and shape for my face. I thought this was really nice, I appreciated that she took her time during the planning phase. Lana was conscious of the pain and made sure to numb the eyebrow area really well before diving into the bulk of the tattoo. She had two different types of numbing agents - one was a cream, the other was a spray. After she applied the cream, she waited a good 20-30 minutes until it kicked it fully. Then, she would work a little bit then spray the other numbing agent until I was totally numb. And I will say, after a couple applications of the cream and spray, I was totally numb and didn't feel anything. It was nice to not feel the tattoo on your face!My tattoos were tattooed in the past by another artist about 10 years ago so it was faded and misshapen. Lana evened them out to one another and corrected the color as well. I am really happy with the finished product, and am excited to see how they look after the second appointment. I would totally recommend Lana for your permanent makeup - she is wonderful! Professional, clean, thorough, and very considerate... what more could you want from a cosmetic tattoo artist?

1.description: As I mentioned in my previous review, I left the country and was living in a remote area for a month. Lana's work held up perfectly. Applying makeup was impractical during this retreat, and yet I felt I looked great every day. The results are so natural that when I told a couple of the ladies about it, they couldn't believe I had permanent makeup. I am so happy with her work, and knowing I can go back for touch ups when I need to is a great relief. Thank God and Goddess for Lana!

2.description: I had a consultation appointment to see Lana tonight about having my eyebrows done. My appointment time was only for an hour but it went way beyond that. She was very thorough in explaining everything about the process. She showed me many, many of her clients before and after pictures. I was very comfortable and at ease talking with her but that was helped by the fact that I did my homework beforehand and she was very knowledgeable in answering any questions that I had. She did some penciling on my eyebrows to show me what they could look like, and in just that quick amount of time, I saw a nice transformation in my face. I ended up booking my appointment to have the procedure done, without any pressure from Lana. She is very focused on making sure you are comfortable with your decision. I can't wait to add to my review or write another one once the procedure is done.

9.description: I am a blonde with dark blonde eyebrows. my eyebrows have not grown in since i over plucked them at age 13. I was always skeptical about getting my eyebrows done with the fear of having a screwed up face but I am more than happy and words cannot describe how pleased i am with Lana's work. She let me create my own shape and they came out exactly how I imagined!!! The room is immaculately clean and all her utensils are brand new(which is something else that I had to be sure of) She is also very polite and alot of fun to chat with.  She explained the process every step of the way and it surprising did not hurt with the technique that she uses. Thank you so much Lana!!! I will definitely be back for eyeliner soon!

10.description: Lana is a total professional and did an awesome job on my eyebrows! She takes her time to make sure you get the right color and shape and listens to your opinion as well. I HIGHLY recommend her and wouldn't recommend anyone else- I've seen people with terrible permanent eye make-up jobs. I want to tell them to see her to get their faces fixed!!

4.description: Lana is very professional and my eyebrows look amazing. It does take all day, so be prepared.  She is very precise with color and shape and works until everything is perfect.  I'm very picky and notice detail- she is professional, honest and does a great job.

6.description: So can I only give 5 stars. Not enough. This woman is amazing. I got my eyebrows tattooed by Lana today and I have to say,I haven't looked in a mirror and been this pleased in years. My eyebrows are phenomenal. She took 10 years off my face. My eyes are no longer droopy. My nose even looks smaller. And she corrected my facial asymmetry. I look in the mirror and cannot believe the face looking back is mine. Going in my eyebrows were beyond unfortunate. Sparse and bald are the only words to describe. Getting up at buttcrack of dawn to powder them in. Oh boy. Years and years of powder. and then miraculously my coworker told me about cosmetic tattooing. I ran across several places in or around the city offering this procedure. Called a few. Didn't feel comfortable. Got offered 1 price for all,good and cheap,2 hour services from all. All that is except Lana. Just looking at her website I knew she was the one. She took the time to explain EVERYTHING! From start to finish,what to expect,not a detail was spared. Was it cheap? No. But this is my face we are talking about. Was it worth every penny? Absolutely. Her office is immaculate. She's even ambidextrous so she was able to draw brows with symmetry. My consultation with lana took longer than most places take to do brows from start to finish. Look at the before and afters on Lana website and see the amazing artwork she creates with her cosmetics. If you have less than stellar eyebrows, trust me there's someone out there that takes pride and can fix them for you. Just a warning,she is very much in demand and summer is coming,book asap she only can do 1 person per day. Remember you have to show your face to the world. And Lana if you read this Thankyou,and Godbless !

15.description: Before I discovered Chicago Permanent Makeup, I spent nearly 2 months researching on permanent cosmetics and who is highly recommended in Chicago. I spent time reading women's reviews (just like you do now) and concluded that if I will trust anyone with my face that will be Lana. I am glad I did. The scariest part was not knowing what to expect and second scariest was making a permanent mistake on your face! Before I came, I spoke to Lana via e-mail and phone, making sure we covered all my questions. She took time to answer all of my questions and to address my concerns. When I came to her office, I felt comfortable and more at ease, again, her professionalism gave me confidence that I am in good hands. If you haven't seen her before and after pictures, please do, her work speaks for itself! After our consultation and final decision on how I will get my eyebrows done, she put-on her special glasses and got to work. I could tell she is a perfectionist just by the time and effort she took to complete her work. After she finished, she gave me aftercare instructions, again I knew what to expect. In the end, my eyebrows look fantastic, my face simply transformed and all thank to Lana's help. I want to emphasize on the fact that I rarely leave reviews, but I simply had to share this with those who are not sure where to start looking for a good permanent makeup artist. She is simply the best in Chicago. Period.

0.description: I have nothing but amazing things to say about Lana! I had my eyebrows done by a number of different people before I found Lana. I am now finally 100% happy with the way they look. Lana corrected them to perfection, When I first went to see her, they were a little too low and not dark enough. Lana listened exactly to what I wanted, and she exceeded my expectations by far! She's very passionate about her profession and takes her time. Plus, it's a bonus that she has a nursing background. I would definitely recommend Lana for any permanent makeup needs!!! Thank you Lana :)   P.S. I moved out of state but because I love Lana's work so much, I will travel far for any touch-ups and new work!

5.description: If you have ever thought about getting permanent makeup, look no further! Lana has changed my life! I originally had my eyebrows tattooed by another artist using the hair stroke technique. I loved the results, however within 6-8 months, the color started coming out. After a year, I was left with no eyebrows again! Thankfully, I was lucky enough to find Lana soon after. Not only did she do a beautiful job on my eyebrows, but 2 years later the results still look fresh. The color is matched perfectly to my hair and skin tone, and the shape really brings out my eyes. I get compliments on my eyebrows almost daily and usually people are shocked to find out they are tattooed. They look completely natural and soft. Lana is a true professional, her studio is immaculate, and she puts as much care into the final product as if it were on her own face. She is not satisfied until she has created perfection. Getting my eyebrows done by Lana has saved me at least 30 minutes a day in my makeup routine. For the first time in my life I feel beautiful with or without makeup on and it is all thanks to Lana! I cannot say enough positive things about her and my experience. 100 stars for Lana!

13.description: My review on Lana is way.... over due...I was there on August 2013. There are no regrets on my end. She is absolutely amazing. I went in to consult with her and get my eyebrows tattooed. She took her time with me to make sure what direction I wanted to go with my tattoo. Lana is a professional. I highly recommend her to anyone that wants to get a procedure done. Two thumbs up!

11.description: Lana is absolutely amazing.  She took plenty of time to consult with me on shape and color for my eyebrows.  I am Asian, so she showed me her other Asian clients she worked on.  She educated me on how colors will turn out later, fading process make the brows look more textured and natural looking.  What I didn't expect was that she changed the overall appearance of my face.  My eyes are uneven in shape and size, and also, my nose set slightly in angle.  Somehow she created new eyebrows and now my unevenness is a lot less obvious.  That was very pleasantly surprising.  Before making an appointment, her responses were quick and precise.  She also pre-educated me thoroughly so I was able to visit her office with confidence.

8.description: 5 stars- Lana is great! She's a very patient practitioner with a very mellow and kind bedside manner.  She is very accurate and took her time every once in a while to check in on me because I am a wimp.  She gave me some advice for what to do for the touch-ups and has stayed in contact with me since my first visit with her.  I love the results and I get compliments all the time.  She is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  Feel free to contact me with questions.

14.description: My experience with Lana was an excellent one.  I felt totally confident in her ability.  She really knows what she's doing.  She's an artist and a perfectionist.  She takes her time (several hours) to make sure everything is perfect.  Her office is immaculate and sterile.  I did my research and found her to be the "real deal."  I would not hesitate to recommend Lana!

7.description: I recently  had my eyeliner  done by Lana and I can say with extreme  confidence  that she is the best at what she does. At no point did I feel rushed or pressured. Even before the appointment began she showed me numerous  pictures of her work. These pictures were up close, unedited and flawless. The procedure  was also painless and she took great care into making sure I was ok. I also got some glances at her work on eyebrows and I was so impressed that I'm in the process of setting up a procedure to also have my eyebrows tattooed.  If you're considering  this procedure please go to Lana. She is highly skilled and meticulous. This kind of work is something  you want to take seriously. A mistake on your face is practically  irreversible. I literally travel two hours on the bus and train to get to her when I can easily go to somewhere closer but I choose to go to the best. Thanks for the work Lana and thanks to those who read this

58.description: The food is fantastic. Great prices for chicken that is big and flavorful, the sides were also good.  The service and people are great  I highly recommend mothers cluckers

56.description: Great food and service. This is a small place, so seating is limited. Was pretty back when we got there, however most people were getting to go and/or leaving so our timing was good.Ribs and chicken were on point. Great flavoring. Service is one of the best things about this place. They make it personable and they in any place will keep customers coming back.Will def come back again.

29.description: Really friendly folks, great neighborhood spot worth a trip if you're not in the area. Chicken and waffles were amazing, as was the bread pudding. Definitely going to be a regular spot for us.

42.description: If I could give this place more stars, I would!. The food is awesome, the staff is very friendly (the owner, Tim, makes it a point to introduce himself and remembers return customers) and the place is adorable. This is a welcome addition to an area that lacks good restaurants. Their menu has a great selection of southern delights and their broasted chicken and fish tacos are fantastic!

23.description: Tasterful! 2nd time visiting after months of anticipation. I would read the reviews, look at the menu and constantly remind myself to visit.  Well when I did I was blown away. So far we've had the Shrimp PO Boy, 2 - Piece, Chicken Tenders, Coleslaw, Fries, Baked Beans, Collared Greens, Corn on the Cob, Hush Puppies... and I'm impressed. The combination of flavors is amazing. REALLY excited to have this flavor in the neighborhood - Chicago wins for reasons such as this. Nom, nom and nom! Lolololol PS: The music is always "feel good". Eat in and enjoy.

47.description: Chicken is wonderful.  I've been on a quest for good southern style chicken, Cluckers is reaaaaal close to my memories of Grandmas Sunday chicken dinners. Food is cooked to order so it takes a while to get your order. The staff is helpful and attentive. The sides are tasty, I really liked the hush puppies. Give Mother Cluckers a try- you won't regret it.

8.description: fast casual chicken and ribs place.   love the value and the concept. with fried chicken the rage across the entire city, I'm glad mother cluckers exists.   a conveniently located parking lot is a bonus especially when the weather is nasty in the winter.  all the menu items are on the video boards.  order then choose a table of your choice.  I arrived on  Sunday evening around 6pm which was apparently fine time for seating.  Ordered the four piece with collard greens and mashed potatoes.   My daughter had the kids meal with Mac n cheese.  Chicken came out fairly quickly, if there's inventory, otherwise you'd wait about 10mins.  Chicken nicely seasoned and was definitely return quality.  There are regulars that came in and ordered the chicken for their catering event.  So others agree that it's good.   Mashed potatoes were very tasty, flavored with probably some of their delicious chicken.  Collards were standard, definitely good with hot sauce.  Mac n cheese was nice and creamy.   BBQ sauce was at the tables which went well with the chicken.   I definitely need to get my hands on ribs and po boyz next time around.   I need myself another stomach!

31.description: In the mood for some breakfast one weekday while driving up Elston Ave,  I stopped at Mother Clucker's.    A sign posted on Elston Ave side  said  "Now Serving Breakfast".  WRONG.  What the sign doesn't tell you is that breakfast is only served on Saturday & Sunday from 7am-12pm.  Physically, the interior is casual.  Place your order at the counter, pay, and they sling it over to you when its ready.  Didn't smell like "smoke", so I'm assuming pulled pork and spare ribs are oven baked.  It did smell like "deep fry", and numerous Yelpers have attested to their frying prowess.  I will need to come back when I'm in the mood for grease ( which is a passion I need to keep in check)

34.description: BEST CHICKEN EVER!!! The hush puppies are DELICIOUS!!! The crab cake po boy is good too.  it here!

16.description: Really friendly folks, great neighborhood spot worth a trip if you're not in the area. Chicken and waffles were amazing, as was the bread pudding. Definitely going to be a regular spot for us.

13.description: The broasted chicken was very good here.  We ordered their 8 piece meal for lunch, and had for their full sized sides:  hush puppies, mac n cheese, and corn.  It was an over-sized lunch meal for us and we had plenty of take-home.  The chicken is the draw, and was crispy skinned, piping hot, and succulent on the inside.   The hush puppies were fresh and tasty,  but rest of sides were of average taste.  They've been in business for just 11 months and the chicken is definitely worth a try.  You can also do BYOB here if you wish.  The owner is a gregarious guy and fosters a friendly operation as well.

11.description: I recently ate at Mother Cluckers Kitchen, located at the northwest corner of Elston and Foster.  Their specialty is "broasted" chicken, which is sort of a slightly less fattening take on fried chicken.  I ordered the 2-piece chicken meal.  For my two sides I chose collard greens and mac & cheese, and I chose hush puppies over the biscuit.  The chicken is pretty good with a crackling skin, but I'm not sure if it is crave-worthy as some fried chicken I have consumed elsewhere.  The two sides I had were OK but I would probably try other sides next time.  The hush puppies also have a crackling crunch to them similar to the pieces of chicken.  There are some other interesting food selections and specials, so I would not mind another meal here sometime.The service here is prompt and friendly.  The food was brought to my table just minutes after ordering, and I did not have to ask for a free pop refill while I was stuffing my face.  There is a parking lot behind the restaurant if you are driving.

39.description: Tonight two wonderful girlfriends and I decided to celebrate a belated birthday, and I had read great things about this place on Yelp and on Nextdoor Neighbor Edgebrook.  All of the reviews were so true.  We brought our own celebratory bubbly, and MCK provided wine glasses for us.  One girl ordered the chicken and dumplings soup. She enjoyed it so much, another girl took her order home for her husband to enjoy.  We had the chicken and ribs dinner, chicken and shrimp dinner and a chicken dinner with a crabcake accompaniment.  Our sides (between the three dinners) included baked beans, fries, hush puppies and broasted potatoes.  All were super outstanding.  The chicken was (as it should be in its own kitchen) was mouth-watering good, and my shrimp were above and beyond super good.  As were the hush puppies.  A huge five stars to the young lady working there - such great attention and service.  I wish I caught her name.  Some young kids were in, and she made sure that they could see and hear the fun elf singing toys on a shelf in the back.  It was really a fun evening, but the excellent food really made it for us.  The son of the owner was there as well - working very hard (like everyone else there) and making sure everyone was happy - we sure were, and thanks!

37.description: Never heard of this place until a month or so ago when I came in for an interview and got hired at this little gold mine. The food is amazing, all homemade recipes. A lot of people will say that about restaurants they work at but it really is the truth!! Crab cake po boy is my all time favorite on the menu, biscuits and gravy are phenomenal, I would eat the sausage gravy on everything. Love the atmosphere here; Rich, Penny and Tim are great people, its a great place to work! They make their employees and customers feel very much appreciated. If you are ever near elston and foster stop in check it out try the food and I promise you will keep coming back!! Hard to find a place with great food and amazing customer service on top of that!! Thanks Rich, Penny and Tim for the chance to work here and for making me a part of the team.

0.description: First, let me start off by saying I eat here every Monday for lunch and it's not because it's the closest place to where I work. I'm here quite often and it's because the food is EXCELLENT!!! It's even better because I live less than 5 minutes away! Lol Seriously though, the food, the atmosphere and the crew is definitely top notch!  This place has definitely put Jefferson Park on the map and for obvious reasons. If you're traveling to the northwest side and are looking for a great chicken joint that's B.Y.O.B., LOOK NO FURTHER THAN MOTHER CLUCKERS!!!!P.S. They serve breakfast on Saturdays and Sundays from 7AM to 12PM that is out of this world!!!!!! COME HUNGRY!

38.description: The food is really good and quick which is convenient for when I need an easy, quick, and good meal. I highly recommend it for a quick and delicious BBQ meal.

51.description: This place is legit. My new go to spot for lunch. Everything has a ton of flavor. You can tell that they don't just go through the motions pumping out food. Every time I've ordered grub from here, it tastes as if the cook was thinking "I'm going to make this guy the best sandwich that I've ever made in my life". Free refills are a huge plus.

27.description: We've found a good new place for chicken carry-out, and we'll plan to eat in sometime soon, too.We tried the chicken (very good) with a couple sides (pretty good), and biscuits and hush puppies (just okay -- the pups were sweeter than I like, and my daughter said the biscuit was a bit dense).While I was picking up our order, I saw a plate on the counter that looked delicious.  I asked what it was and was told Smothered Chicken.  I'll definitely be back to try that -- It looked great!

32.description: My wife and I each had the two piece broasted chicken dinners, white meat. It was very good.  It was crispy and very meaty. The cole slaw was like eating a mini salad, very good. The baked beans were spicy, also very good.  We had the bread pudding, it was sweet and moist.  The sweet potato pie, which is almost impossible to find on the North side, was creamy and had a nice flavor.  The restaurant is attractive, the staff was very friendly.

54.description: Me and my daughters came for breakfast, everything was awesome. Customer service is outstanding, and big portions of food. My daughters had pancakes (huge) one with sausage other with bacon. My bacon baby loved her bacon nice a crispy just as she loves it. I had an omelette with sausage, onion, and tomato. I was stuffed. I will be back for more, my Saturday morning breakfast spot. Did I mention my bill was under $25..... yes a wonderful deal..... great food, great service, great prices.

48.description: Soo glad they made this little corner place into a gem! They really did a nice job on the outside and in. Great staff and service. Love their shrimp tacos, pulled pork and their crab cakes. Pretty decent coleslaw too. Kids love the corn dogs. Ribs are decent, as told by my husband who is a picky guy .

44.description: Mother Cluckers is an unsuspecting, cute little greasy spoon in the middle of Sauganash. Blink too fast and you'll miss both driving through! I went with the popular food item, the shrimp po' boy, side of fries, and a Pepsi. It was all way too expensive at $14. They could at least include the beverage, sold separately, in their combos. Even if the drink was included, I'd still complain about the price I paid for just the fries and sandwich.It's really nothing to write home about. I will say this place nails it in the quality of the tomatoes they use on their sandwiches. They are a deep, dark red and I am not afraid to eat them. You know what I mean. You go to some places and the tomatoes are so stiff and barely pink, you wonder if they were even grown in the ground! My shrimp po' boy could have used more shrimp for what I paid. I suspected the sandwich wouldn't have enough shrimp before I even walked into the place. Not so much from the photos -- you can't tell. The sandwich is like all Po' Boys, a top-heavy food item, loaded with too much iceberg lettuce in such a way that wherever you take your first bite, everything falls out of the other end. Otherwise the sandwich tasted fine. They even give you extra sauce for your sandwich, which I just used for the fries.Speaking of french fries, they could do better. They weren't gooey enough on the inside, nor crispy enough on the outside. Even the sauce wasn't fatty enough to mask the dryness of the fries. I think yelpers on here go for the mac 'n cheese. Since I was taking my order to go, I didn't want the mac 'n cheese because it gets cold too fast and I like it super fresh. For such a small space, the restaurant is so cute, and it's clean. It almost looks like a diner and it's BYOB. They even serve coffee. I think the charm in Mother Cluckers is more about sitting down to eat in this cozy setting, than it is about the food. I noticed on all of their tables, that they make their own sauce for some of the foods they sell. I might come back to try other items on the menu, but for now I think I'm good.

24.description: Place is awesome! The chicken nearly falls off the bone... So good! I was so excited to try this place and it definitely did not let me down. I will be returning to mother cluckers !!

7.description: In the mood for some breakfast one weekday while driving up Elston Ave,  I stopped at Mother Clucker's.    A sign posted on Elston Ave side  said  "Now Serving Breakfast".  WRONG.  What the sign doesn't tell you is that breakfast is only served on Saturday & Sunday from 7am-12pm.  Physically, the interior is casual.  Place your order at the counter, pay, and they sling it over to you when its ready.  Didn't smell like "smoke", so I'm assuming pulled pork and spare ribs are oven baked.  It did smell like "deep fry", and numerous Yelpers have attested to their frying prowess.  I will need to come back when I'm in the mood for grease ( which is a passion I need to keep in check)

49.description: Looked up new spots on here, in my old stomping ground and came across this gem. I remember the prior restaurants here that just never made it. Not these guys..they got what it takes: good service, prompt service and fanfrickintastic food. My girlfriend's got the po boy  and chicken sammy. I got the 2 piece dark  meat chicken meal with hush puppies,  fries and mac n cheese. That chicken was sooo good!! Not a lot of fat, crispy and flavorful skin  and juicy meat. Now, those hush puppies??? We all were impressed..Seriously the best I've ever had. Mac n cheese was good..and the fries were great..dipped them in the sweet bbq mother cluckers sauce :-D. The service was prompt..we even got asked for refills on our water. We then decided to order bread pudding to share...well, the girl brought it to another table and they gladly took it-- I think they thought it was on the house. Nope, thats ours...so my girlfriend told the gentleman that was serving us and he apologized and they made us one pronto. That bread pudding was ridiculous good. So basically,  if you like friendly, fast service, amazing affordable food that includes some kick a $$ chicken (hush puppies too)...go here....asap.

40.description: A spot on my list of well run great tasting independent restaurants. Really good food, really nice people you really have to try this joint. Smothered chicken today, sausage gravy off the hook over the breast and also the Parmesan mashed potatoes - get he heck outta here good! Sides always great, consistency great - you and your taste buds will be charmed!

53.description: This chicken was so juicy and had the right amount of spices. The mashed potatoes....amazing. Wish the Mac and cheese was better, it was disappointing. Oh well, I will be back to try the rest of the menu!! The super friendly and accommodating staff made this a 5 star review!

30.description: The BBQ pulled chicken sandwich really hits the spot and the mashed potatoes are good. Mac n cheese is nothing special and the only veggie I saw on the menu was corn. I would like to see a rib sandwich and other veggie sides. I will definitely be returning to try the ribs, and will be buying their chicken for my next family gathering.

46.description: Heard about this place cause my guy wouldn't stop raving about it. Finally came in one night and now I see what he's talking about! Amazing food and even better service. Everyone is so friendly and attentive without being too much. They make you feel comfortable right away and can answer any question you have. I got the chicken sandwich, mashed potatoes and also tried some Mac and cheese from my guys plate. Amazing comfort food, absolutely no complaints. Just get off your butt and go get some chicken!

1.description: Holly crap! How have I lived 7 minutes from here and drove by 100 times and not eaten here?! The food is fantastic! I order have the menu and my friends and I enjoyed everything. I'll definitely be coming here again soon!

55.description: Great Food.  Owner is engaged with the customers.  I had some disappointment with their fries being too soggy but after talking to the owner about it, they get it right every single time now.  A bit pricey to go everyday but overall, great good.

9.description: Dined in Mother Clucker's several times.  Some of the tastiest comfort food that you'll ever find.  Great chicken and sides.  Even better I tried the smothered chicken tonight with mash potatoes.  The chicken patty was prepared perfectly, light crispy breading ladeled with some of the best homemade gravy I've ever had.  The consistency of the mash potatoes was slightly chunky, with bacon and cheese under the spectacular gravy.   Service was excellent and refills plentiful.  I'll keep coming back.

26.description: This place was really good.  When we walked in we were immediately greeted and asked if we wanted anything to drink.  We hadn't looked at the menu so we were told to feel free to grab a menu and take a seat to review it.  We decided on the full slab of ribs and they were delicious. They literally came off the bone and were very juicy and flavorful.  We also ordered the mashed potatoes and broasted potatoes for sides and those were good too.  We were stuffed but managed to find some room for a desert and picked the bread pudding which was really good and smelled fantastic.The service is top notch.  The staff was very friendly and I felt had that southern hospitality.  You could tell that they really take pride in their food and want their customers to be happy.  We will definitely come back to try some of the other items on the menu like the chicken and po'boys.  Thanks for the great meal!

25.description: I recently got the pleasure of finding this little gem, I tried the fried chicken (to die for, blows Popeyes out of the water) hush puppies, Mac and cheese (so creamy and full of cheese, Cole slaw (which normally I don't eat, but I loved their Cole slaw), and their homemade mashed potatoes which leaves you wanting more!! This is now forever going to be my southern comfort food!! The staff is amazingly sweet, kind and attentive and made made sure my order was correct.... Made me feel right at home..... I will definitely go out of my way just to have this food!! Thank you everyone at Mother Cluckers!

12.description: My husband I and enjoyed our lunch date at mother cluckers. The food and portions was great, nice friendly ambience at a reasonable price. I would recommend the restaurant for lunch will have to come back at dinner for 2nd review.

59.description: The broasted chicken was very good here.  We ordered their 8 piece meal for lunch, and had for their full sized sides:  hush puppies, mac n cheese, and corn.  It was an over-sized lunch meal for us and we had plenty of take-home.  The chicken is the draw, and was crispy skinned, piping hot, and succulent on the inside.   The hush puppies were fresh and tasty,  but rest of sides were of average taste.  They've been in business for just 11 months and the chicken is definitely worth a try.  You can also do BYOB here if you wish.  The owner is a gregarious guy and fosters a friendly operation as well.

21.description: We've been looking for a great breakfast in the area and found it this weekend at Mother Clucker's! As other reviewers noted,  it's a small spot and can be easy to miss.  The location is great,  though,  and the parking lot in the back is super convenient. The layout of the restaurant is also really clever- instead of cramming a whole bunch of tables in the middle,  they follow the shape of the lot,  creating a V-formation and allowing for a roomy feel in a small space.  We came in about 9:30 and were greeted by the owners and seated immediately.  They're super friendly and overall the atmosphere is just great.  Now for the food,  'cause let's be honest,  that's what everyone cares about!  We both got the build your own omelette, and they were made perfectly.  Great proportions for the ingredients we selected and cooked nicely.  The potatoes served with them were delicious,  too.  And. Nothing was greasy and everything was very fresh.  We can't wait to try the lunch and dinner options, and will definitely be back for breakfast soon!

17.description: I recently went there for breakfast with my father and husband. We loved it! Glad to see something so good in this location finally. Great addition to the neighborhood. I highly recommend the breakfast tacos. They're not spicy, which I like, but come with salsa if you need some heat. Great chorizo!Can't wait to go back to try the chicken and waffles.......as well as the dinner menu!

10.description: My neighborhood restaurant in Forest Glen on the corner of Foster & Elston Ave.  This is the 4th restaurant since I moved here 12-13 years ago & by far the best.  You start to think because of the location & the shape of the site and building there isn't much that can be done.  The rest have come and gone, but I hope this place is a keeper.  It's the real deal!!! There's not much you can do with the outside of the restaurant as it is a triangular site, still they did jazz up the outside with new canopies and signage to let you know there is a new sheriff in town.  The interior What a huge difference.  Once again the exterior enclosure is a given in terms of area, but what they did on the interior is like night & day. The kitchen is still in the same location, but the rest of the inside was gutted and redone in rustic finishes w/faux wood panel look decorated with a bunch of really cool knick knacks like an old rusted Route 66 sign, over sized fishing lures Texaco, Standard, Sinclair Quaker State Oil signs & a whole slew of interesting wall arts to keep you occupied while waiting for your food.  Oh yeah the reason for coming here.  The food.  Mother Cluckers (ahh a little play on words?).  They have a huge assortment of different dishes from sandwiches, panini sandwiches, dinners, dinner combos and BROASTED CHICKEN. This is what I ended up ordering.  The Broasted chicken was absolutely incredible.  This is Broasted not fried chicken 1/3 less fat, and it is seasoned and cooked to perfection.  There is no breading, just the seasoning and so succulent and juicy.  ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!  The meal came with 2 sides.  I chose the Mac & cheese and the baked beans (awesome beans). The beans are cooked with a combination of baked beans, black beans with small pieces of meat, diced peppers & onions (delicious).  The beans also had brown sugar and a hint of hot sauce). Perfect blend.  I only ordered the 2 piece meal w/2 sides as I wanted to leave room for the breaded pudding.  The breaded pudding was very good served hot with syrup & icing.  I will be back again and if you enjoy great food you should check it out.

5.description: Oh EM GEE! This place was amazing. So I ordered the two piece with white meat only. It came with a wing and a breast. Yummy yummy. The chicken was very moist and delicious. I also tried it with the BBQ sauce at the table. Good choice-the sauce was fantastic. I was really impressed. I also loved my sides-mashed potatoes and corn. Yum yum. I ordered the biscuit, but my husband ordered the hush puppies. I wish I had the wisdom to also order the hush puppies. Because woah, they were sooo good. I didn't think I liked hush puppies, but as it turns out, I do!! I hadn't had good ones before-the ones I've had in the past were bland and just meh. But these-oh my-so good!! So much flavor. Also-recommend you dip them in the BBQ sauce. If you are on the fence about trying this place-get off it! Get there ASAP! You won't be disappointed. Can't wait to return soon. :)

3.description: Mother Cluckers is an unsuspecting, cute little greasy spoon in the middle of Sauganash. Blink too fast and you'll miss both driving through! I went with the popular food item, the shrimp po' boy, side of fries, and a Pepsi. It was all way too expensive at $14. They could at least include the beverage, sold separately, in their combos. Even if the drink was included, I'd still complain about the price I paid for just the fries and sandwich.It's really nothing to write home about. I will say this place nails it in the quality of the tomatoes they use on their sandwiches. They are a deep, dark red and I am not afraid to eat them. You know what I mean. You go to some places and the tomatoes are so stiff and barely pink, you wonder if they were even grown in the ground! My shrimp po' boy could have used more shrimp for what I paid. I suspected the sandwich wouldn't have enough shrimp before I even walked into the place. Not so much from the photos -- you can't tell. The sandwich is like all Po' Boys, a top-heavy food item, loaded with too much iceberg lettuce in such a way that wherever you take your first bite, everything falls out of the other end. Otherwise the sandwich tasted fine. They even give you extra sauce for your sandwich, which I just used for the fries.Speaking of french fries, they could do better. They weren't gooey enough on the inside, nor crispy enough on the outside. Even the sauce wasn't fatty enough to mask the dryness of the fries. I think yelpers on here go for the mac 'n cheese. Since I was taking my order to go, I didn't want the mac 'n cheese because it gets cold too fast and I like it super fresh. For such a small space, the restaurant is so cute, and it's clean. It almost looks like a diner and it's BYOB. They even serve coffee. I think the charm in Mother Cluckers is more about sitting down to eat in this cozy setting, than it is about the food. I noticed on all of their tables, that they make their own sauce for some of the foods they sell. I might come back to try other items on the menu, but for now I think I'm good.

35.description: The place is small and cozy. The staff is very attentive and nice. Prices are reasonable and portions large. The chicken was very good, as were the ribs. Went Saturday night and were the only ones there, hope more people see this and go, nice people, good food.

19.description: Passed this spot up numerous times on the way to Marianos. We finally decided to stop in with the family. We had the chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. The entire family loved it. I have never seen my kids eat so much at a restaurant. My son couldn't get enough mac and cheese and my daughter loved the chicken. The BBQ sauce at the table is great as well. The staff was very friendly and even gave us a free dessert. Very family friendly location and we look forward to dining there again.

28.description: Mother cluckers is a personal favorite of mine, I've grown partial to the shrimp poboy with a side of collard greens but another 2 favs is the smothered chicken with a gravy that could probably feed you alone, also the chicken and waffles is delicious. The staff is great and welcoming as they constantly check up on you as well as shoot the shit if it's not too busy.  Did I mention they play the blues over the speakers, definitely a plus.

45.description: Great chicken;excellent shrimp; amazing sides,family run by great people and fair prices for the quality. I don't eat red meat so I can't attest to the ribs and meats, but friends have told me they're great.

33.description: Phenomenal phenomenal ribs! The owner and workers are super friendly and nice too. When you walk in they can tell if you have not been there before since they are fairly new(about a year or so old)They tell you to grab a menu and have a seat and when you're ready to place the order. I already felt at ease because sometimes you feel pressured to make a decision while standing there looking up at the menu board completely clueless. So we took our time and the owner even tried to help with suggestions-super nice and outgoing guy. We ended up having the broasted chicken with ribs special and the broasted chicken with shrimp. You get a choice of two sides and the option between a biscuit or hush puppies. The biscuit was okay, super fluffy but hardly any flavor. The hush puppies were the truth and definite must have! The ribs were sensational fall off the bone succulent tender juicy and perfectly tangy. The fries were perfectly crunchy and salty and the chicken was super crunchy too. So so good. The Mac and cheese was okay not too much flavor but super creamy if you're into that. Overall, holler at the ribs, chicken and hush puppies without a doubt. Between the ribs, chicken and their service def worth a 5 star. It's also BYOB-can't go wrong with that!

43.description: Good food (broasted chicken and sides) and excellent value

2.description: Stopped here Friday around 5:30 - had to be in the area on other business, and we were looking for somewhere to eat that would be on the quick side, but not fast food. Saw all the great reviews for this spot, and decided to give it a try. Very glad we did. The chicken was absolutely delicious - extremely fresh (fried up while we were there). We both thought the hush puppies and biscuits were very good, but I think they need to put some honey on the table along with the jams and jellies. The coleslaw was excellent - freshly made, crunchy, light - not your typical. The Mac and cheese was made with jalapeños cheese, I think. Not my favorite, but my husband likes.It appeared they had more take out orders than eat-in at the time we were there, but they have a nice little dining area, and we were very comfortable and content on a cold February evening! Prices were very reasonable and they actually threw in some extra hush puppies and a small bread pudding! I don't think they serve any alcohol, beer or wine. That might be nice for the future. Best of all was the extraordinarily welcoming attention we (and all the other customers we observed) received. It was clear they had some long time regulars! I think I'd come back here for the food, even if the service wasn't the greatest, but it was the greatest! We've already recommended Mother Cluckers Kitchen to more than one friend. Thanks for a surprisingly great experience! (We were actually headed somewhere else, and changed our mind at the spur of the moment! So glad we did!)

18.description: Never heard of this place until a month or so ago when I came in for an interview and got hired at this little gold mine. The food is amazing, all homemade recipes. A lot of people will say that about restaurants they work at but it really is the truth!! Crab cake po boy is my all time favorite on the menu, biscuits and gravy are phenomenal, I would eat the sausage gravy on everything. Love the atmosphere here; Rich, Penny and Tim are great people, its a great place to work! They make their employees and customers feel very much appreciated. If you are ever near elston and foster stop in check it out try the food and I promise you will keep coming back!! Hard to find a place with great food and amazing customer service on top of that!! Thanks Rich, Penny and Tim for the chance to work here and for making me a part of the team.

41.description: This place is a gem. I predict it's going to get a great TV review and then it will be standing room only. I was not excited about eating in the area; I was leaning more towards a "hipper" area. Luckily my husband doesn't care about the scene, because I never would have tried this place. I was complaining until I walked in the front door, but it is decorated very tastefully and the staff has that southern hospitality that Chicago could use more of. It has a southern theme, and plays great Motown and soul music, so I gave it the benefit of the doubt. It has some if the best fried chicken in the city and the sandwiches were very well prepared. Even my 4 year old daughter kept saying how good everything was. The cole slaw was even made fresh from what I could tell. The bread pudding was amazing. There are quite a few items on the menu I can't wait to try next time. Did I mention it is BYOB? Very worth it if you're in the area!

52.description: I never really like to eat fried chicken....but after coming here, I do like it indeed.  The chicken was very tasty and moist.  It did not have the greasy taste at all.  It was a very small place but the service was excellent.  They are very friendly and on top of things.  The best deal was the 4 piece chicken with 2 sides and a biscuit....it was very filling.  The sides were really good too but the bread pudding was to die for......I would go back.

50.description: So glad to have this place in the neighborhood. They've done a great job is the rehab. The place has never looked so good. Staff is nice. Food is really good comfort food.

4.description: Tasterful! 2nd time visiting after months of anticipation. I would read the reviews, look at the menu and constantly remind myself to visit.  Well when I did I was blown away. So far we've had the Shrimp PO Boy, 2 - Piece, Chicken Tenders, Coleslaw, Fries, Baked Beans, Collared Greens, Corn on the Cob, Hush Puppies... and I'm impressed. The combination of flavors is amazing. REALLY excited to have this flavor in the neighborhood - Chicago wins for reasons such as this. Nom, nom and nom! Lolololol PS: The music is always "feel good". Eat in and enjoy.

6.description: Saw this place many times and never went in. My wife finally said he's lets get some broasted chicken, We went asked for recommendations. The owner, I assumed, was very helpful and friendly. He explained it to us and gave us recommendations. The chicken was amazing, my wife loves corn bread and it was also extremely good. Overall great experience!

22.description: My wife and I ate here the other night after reading all of the great reviews on Yelp. It did not disappoint! I had the chicken and ribs combo and she had the shrimp tacos. The ribs were phenomenal and cooked perfectly. The portions for the shrimp tacos was huge for the price. The staff could not have been any nicer or more attentive. We will definitely be coming back!

15.description: Phenomenal phenomenal ribs! The owner and workers are super friendly and nice too. When you walk in they can tell if you have not been there before since they are fairly new(about a year or so old)They tell you to grab a menu and have a seat and when you're ready to place the order. I already felt at ease because sometimes you feel pressured to make a decision while standing there looking up at the menu board completely clueless. So we took our time and the owner even tried to help with suggestions-super nice and outgoing guy. We ended up having the broasted chicken with ribs special and the broasted chicken with shrimp. You get a choice of two sides and the option between a biscuit or hush puppies. The biscuit was okay, super fluffy but hardly any flavor. The hush puppies were the truth and definite must have! The ribs were sensational fall off the bone succulent tender juicy and perfectly tangy. The fries were perfectly crunchy and salty and the chicken was super crunchy too. So so good. The Mac and cheese was okay not too much flavor but super creamy if you're into that. Overall, holler at the ribs, chicken and hush puppies without a doubt. Between the ribs, chicken and their service def worth a 5 star. It's also BYOB-can't go wrong with that!

57.description: Had the half slab 2 piece chicken combo. Ribs? Meh. Fall off the bone while I like ribs with chew to them. 3 stars. The chicken? 5 stars! It has been a long time since I've had good chicken. When I return, I'll only get the chicken. Side dishes: fries, beans, cole slaw, biscuits and the mac and cheese. Fries were soft and undercooked when well-done was specifically ordered. We usually finish our fries, they were barely touched. Beans: beans were good! BBQ style. very nice. Cole slaw: different, with a whole bunch of ingredients, but I didn't really like it that much. I didn't hate it, either. Biscuits not housemade, that is for sure, but better than getting kicked in the shin.Mac and cheese: pretty good. Both kids liked it, I thought it was a bit bland. Overall? I will be going back for the chicken no doubt!

20.description: Don't believe the hype. The chicken is just ok. The sides were unremarkable. I didn't care for the slaw and the greens weren't doing it either. Hush puppies were ok. The pulled pork that I got reminded me of the "Market Day" frozen pulled pork my mom would get. Flavorless. Didn't really care for it and haven't been back since. The other reviews people love this place. It's because if you don't like it and say so they take down your review.

36.description: fast casual chicken and ribs place.   love the value and the concept. with fried chicken the rage across the entire city, I'm glad mother cluckers exists.   a conveniently located parking lot is a bonus especially when the weather is nasty in the winter.  all the menu items are on the video boards.  order then choose a table of your choice.  I arrived on  Sunday evening around 6pm which was apparently fine time for seating.  Ordered the four piece with collard greens and mashed potatoes.   My daughter had the kids meal with Mac n cheese.  Chicken came out fairly quickly, if there's inventory, otherwise you'd wait about 10mins.  Chicken nicely seasoned and was definitely return quality.  There are regulars that came in and ordered the chicken for their catering event.  So others agree that it's good.   Mashed potatoes were very tasty, flavored with probably some of their delicious chicken.  Collards were standard, definitely good with hot sauce.  Mac n cheese was nice and creamy.   BBQ sauce was at the tables which went well with the chicken.   I definitely need to get my hands on ribs and po boyz next time around.   I need myself another stomach!

14.description: We've found a good new place for chicken carry-out, and we'll plan to eat in sometime soon, too.We tried the chicken (very good) with a couple sides (pretty good), and biscuits and hush puppies (just okay -- the pups were sweeter than I like, and my daughter said the biscuit was a bit dense).While I was picking up our order, I saw a plate on the counter that looked delicious.  I asked what it was and was told Smothered Chicken.  I'll definitely be back to try that -- It looked great!

1.description: Try to write a review about this little liquor store and it takes so much to find the correct directory listing. Why does the name on the sign have to be different from the directory listing, are you hiding? Want business right? Make the two the same. Sign says Eden's Food & Liquor. Little store open late night, they say you can call them and tell them what you are looking for and they'll keep it ready. Except it's hard to get anyone to answer the phone, they have voice mail. This works well when you're looking to have some Remy red or other alc beverage chilled before your arrival. Prices aren't fantastic or terribly high, it's average and they rarely have anything on special unless (I would guess) it's old stock.

2.description: Uhm.... so this liquor store has a little variety, it's got like 5 fridges stocked with cold beer... but the selection here I feel like hardly allows it to be considered a liquor store.... Jewel has a better selection and that's REAL TALK....

0.description: Friendly new owners. Store is getting fuller by the week. Good selection of beer.
