56.description: Sushi and Thai cuisine.I've been here a few times for their lunch menu.  Approx $5.95- $7.95 & $9 for sushi.  Lunch portions are satisfying, you get the entree with choice of meat / veg (tofu) and choice of appetizer(Egg, Spring, or California roll or Crab rangoon).  Crab rangoons are not sweet, just plain, served with a light sweet and sour sauce.I've had the Pad See Ewe and Crispy Chicken.  I'd say skip the Crispy Chicken, there's nothing to the entree, its chicken battered, deep fried and chopped to smaller bite size pieces.  Also served with tangy chili sweet and sour sauce.Cool interior, well, cool enough for Sauganash.  Few tables, mostly seating 4-6 people, those seating two are cramped.  If dining alone, you can also sit at the bar.  Service is quick and takes requests.  Located near the off/on ramps for I-94.  Ample street parking.  Once Whole Foods, opens on the corner,  Chai AB, will surely become more popular. I'm not the biggest fan of Thai food, I really don't have a clue about the food and I stick to those dishes I know.  What I've had was good and filling. I would/do come back with friends for food and drinks, before starting my weekend evenings.

29.description: Small place.  Modern decoration.  Good pad thai but I have had better.  A little pricy.  Skip on the egg rolls...not that amazing.

42.description: There are maybe 3 - 4  Asian restaurants in the Sauganash neighborhood/area, and Thai is definitely in the top three.  :)  I had the pad thai many times and it is very similar to the pad thai at Cozy Noodles in Evanston - spot on texture of noodles, great blend of tamarind and fish sauciness, AND orangish yellow color.  I dont know why but I am very attracted to the the orange/yellow colored pad thai, eventhough it's probably just tumeric powder (which is arguably flavorless).  I am glad that there is atleast one decent dish I can get on the run in my parents neighbhorhood.  For those familiar with the area, it is nice not having to drive that far for good asian food. For those not familiar, the neighborhood is on the outskirts of the city, bordering Skokie, Niles and Lincolnwood; Anything remotely good is atleast a 10-15 minute drive.

23.description: I have a feeling that all the 5-star reviewers of this place are Sauganash locals who have never ventured south of Foster and east of Pulaski.. There ARE better Thai places out there in Chicago (see Bucktown, Lincoln Park, Old Irving, etc.). That being said, the food here is NOT bad. I ordered the Beef Pad Thai and Chicken Rice Soup, and I thought they were pretty decent. However, I'm giving this place 2 stars mainly for the customer service. When I went here with a party of eight tonight, all of our dishes were brought out at different times. The last person received his dish when the first person who received it was well done with half of it. THAT can ruin friendships. Also, I saw the server on two occasions have his thumb/fingers touching the food when he brought out the dishes. That is not very... sanitary. The stubborn owner (I'm guessing the mother of this mom and pops business) gave us the biggest attitude when we were trying to pay for our bill (there were eight of us so we were all trying to pay for ourselves with cards/cash..). She didn't even try to hide her frustration. I understand that it's more cumbersome for the restaurant to swipe five credit cards, but AT LEAST change your face from a :( a :3. All in all, okay food (a bit pricy in my opinion), bad customer service.Am I being a little too harsh? Maybe. Are you a hater? Yes. (jk). Happy yelping!

47.description: Honestly, I have never "dined in" but I pick up sushi from Chai Asian Bistro at least twice a month. I'm not a big fan of their noodles, but have been happy with all of the sushi rolls that I have tried. They also have an affordable lunch special.

8.description: Crispy chicken was insanely dry.  Miso soup was okay but was almost all broth. Hardly had any seaweed or tofu in it. Egg rolls were okay but nothing special. Those three items were not worth the $25. The only nice thing was the food arrived much sooner than expected.

31.description: I have been to many many Thai restuarants that are great for certain dishes and warned to stay away from other dishes.  At Chai's so far I've tried 5 entress and 4 of their sushi plates and all were beyond my expectations.  I had just gotten back from Bangkok and I really missed the smell of the food,  I found my go to place now!Must try dishes are the Pad See Ew, combo fried rice, crab rangoons, and spider rolls.  Chai's Asian Bistro is not your hole in the wall establishment where food is prepared quickly and tastelessly.  They use quality authentic ingredients and great cuts of meat and I'm willing to pay a little more to have that.  See for yourself y'all.  I'm just glad I live so close to them.

34.description: This is a hidden treasure! It is a small and unassuming storefront, but don't be fooled by the look. The food is delicious and is authentic thai. The sushi menu is small, but what they do have they do great! The Thai food is authentic and fresh, I have never been disappointed.Give it a try, it's worth every penny!

16.description: I don't know about other dishes, but their beef boat noodle soup is outstanding authentic & taste just like home!  I definitely a big fan!

13.description: I rarely stop at this place, despite the fact that it's the closest Thai restaurant to me. However, a few nights ago I was hungry, it was a little later in the evening and I knew that Chai's Asian bistro didn't close until after 9 p.m. So, I ordered some chicken pad Thai - pretty simple - picked it up (from the absolutely deserted restaurant) and took it home. Now, I'm a Thai junkie and I'm not ashamed to admit that I'm a girl with a good appetite, but I couldn't even take down half of my meal. The chicken was dry and everything else was terribly bland; I would even say it was a little bitter. It was so not worth the $11 I paid for it and I ended up throwing half of it away anyway. I was so disappointed with this place and I will surely not be returning, no matter how close they are or how late their open. I would suggest to whoever's reading this that you just drive the extra few minutes over to The Elephant Thai Cuisine in Edgebrook for a far better meal.

11.description: This review is strictly about their take out service which is spotty at best. Sometimes I call and they say 15 minutes and it's ready when I arrive. But sometimes they tell you the pick up time and you still have a long wait. Tonight was one of those times. I arrived at 6:30, the time I was told my food was going to be ready and when I arrived they told me 5 minutes. 30 minutes later they brought my food out. There were two tables in the restaurant, one that already had their food and another that ordered their food after I arrived. Their food was delivered to their table 10 minutes later as I waited 20 more for my food. They were not busy. They did not offer to compensate me for my wait. While the food is fresh and good, this may be our last time to order from this restaurant. A shame since options in Sauganash are limited.

39.description: Fabulous Thai food!!!  Always fresh! Perfectly made to order!  And they have great Sushi too!  It doesn't get any better....a little Sushi appetizer with Pad Thai.......or full Sushi meal!  It's the best Thai I've ever had and the Sushi is top of the line too!

37.description: Yum! Yellow curry with sweet potatoes, sooo tasty! Great texture, really rich flavor. Tasted the delectably moist and not-at-all greasy chicken teriyaki too. Lunch specials come with a side or crab rangoon, egg roll, or soup. They only deliver within a 1 mile radius, and I'm just out of that range, but will definitely be back. There is a parking lot in the back too...

0.description: Only ever had delivery from this place so I don't know what the restaurant itself is like, but the food is solid, and delivery is always prompt. I especially like the garlic chicken.

38.description: Another disappointment.  Had their panang chicken, and it was CALIENTE.  I like my Thai food with some heat, but I purposely chose this type of curry, thinking it would be on the milder side.  Not so...I think too much heat takes away from the flavoring of the rest of the dish.  Bummer.  Guess I will have to try another dish.  Why am I so adamant of finding my favorite dish at this place?  Three's a try, I guess.

51.description: As you know from my other reviews, I am big on owner presence.  This is a great thai place that rivals the best downtown has to offer.  Their spicy beef is a great low carb dish that will knock your socks off.  Pad Si Eiw is the best I have tasted.  Fine selection of sushi.  I have never had a bad dish at this place.  Be a little adventurous-try something off your usual list.The owner is present almost every hour they are open.  And while it is a small place, I have never had to wait long for a seat.  It seems like those who really like Thai have discovered it but not many others.  With the quality and service the owner puts out, it won't be long before word gets out.

27.description: Simple is sometimes the best way to go. They are good at creating thai food that people enjoy eating. They don't need to broaden their menu because what they have works. Simple setting, Great food, always a destination to go.

32.description: This is a great place to have a fun dinner with friends. As other reviewers have mentioned, this place can be a little slow, so if you want a quick meal, this isn't the place for you. I usually head to Chai with friends I haven't seen in a while, and we always have a great time. And with BYOB with no corking fee, how could we not?The spring roll is good - usually 3 of us share it and we all get a few pieces. Their pad see ewe is really good, as is their sushi.One of the biggest cheers for this place comes from Chai being so very accomodating to food allergies. One of my friends has many severe allergies, and Chai takes extra care to prepare the meal she wants in a way that she can have it. Looking forward to heading here again soon.

54.description: Sauganash is not known for its variety of restaurants, so Chai Bistro is probably the best restaurant in the area.  It's a very cozy family run place with delicious Thai/Japanese cuisine.

48.description: Being a huge sushi & Thai fan I was extremely pleased to see that one had opened up a few blocks from me. I love that it is BYOB and there are many places close enough to walk to buy a bottle of wine before stopping in to get our fill of pad woon sen or volcano rolls. Both of which i highly recommend. It is a small location, but never too crowded, service is a little slow, but mainly because the staff is small. But, that just leaves room for conversation in the comfy atmosphere of friends and wine. Plus a bonus is delivery and pickup. Which I have taken advantage of as well!

44.description: After reading some of the other reviews, I have to share my own opinion/experience...My advice to those of you who posted good reviews:  Get out of the neighborhood and try something better cause this family owned establishment sucked!!!This place is terrible! Sushi is nothing to write home (for those of you who think its good "get out and try something else") There is more to Saugaunash/Chicago than this crap! For the price we were unimpressed to say the least! In addition, we have ordered from them a couple of times (due to the fact that they're little to no other alternatives in the area for Thai/Sushi) and have never once had a memorable experience. In addition to dining in, we ordered delivery from them which was cold, we were charged for food we didn't receive, and when we called and complained the employee gave us attitude. That said, when they finally understood their mistake (especially on a $100 delivery order) the owner called back and apologized for the misunderstanding and brought us an extra chicken dinner (and the food forgotten) back to our house...At that point I could of cared less, and in all actuality felt as though they spit in our food because of how nasty I got with them over the phone...More importantly, when I am charged for something I didn't receive and am told I did it just gets stupid...I prefer the consumer is always right attitude especially when it comes to something forgotten, but billed nonetheless. We have not ordered from them since and have passed on our negative experience to others..

24.description: Great food. Love this place an the owners are nice and friendly. I love the rice and soups. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Mr. Chai is nice guy and wife is great cook.

7.description: Stopped in for lunch a couple of times and also for dinner.  Food has always been really good, never really had bad service, and the place is always immaculate.I knocked off a star because it seems like their lunch portions have gotten really small.  I picked the pot-sitcker appetizer and basil chicken off of the lunch menu and was disappointed to only get 2 pot stickers and a really small portion of basil chicken.  My husband received the same portion size on his lunch order.  We both left hungry!We will most likely skip this place for lunch going forward but will still return for dinner.

49.description: I've had Thai food all over Chicago and I think that this is one of the best restaurants to get it.  The food is extremely well prepared, authentic and you have a lot of choices.  Besides the Pad Thai(which is one of my favorite dishes on the menu), I really enjoy the:1. Pad Woon Sen2. Basil Chicen3. Thai Fried RiceI've also had their Sushi rolls and think the quality is top notch.In addition, the service has always been terrific for me and they will make good suggestions depending on what you are in the mood for.  Lastly, I think the prices are very reasonable at about $8-$12 per plate for dinner.  Its BYOB which works out nicely because there is a Whole Foods right across the street and you can have your pick of any beverage you want from around the world.  I usually go here with 2-3 friends and we always have a great time without breaking the bank.

40.description: While it may not be the best Thai food in the city of Chicago, it is outstanding for a neighborhood restaurant.  The food here is very fresh and quite tasty.  I love all the Thai noodle dishes and the sushi is always good.  The wait staff is always very cordial and the owner is very friendly.  The only downside is the fact that the dishes are brought out in a random fashion with one coming out when its done and five minutes later another coming out.  Its a bit pricey, but a good, intimate neighborhood restaurant.

53.description: This place has more ambiance than most other Thai places (trendy and modern but small) and BYOB.  I come here if I am in the area and am too lazy to venture to Lincoln Square (it is right off the highway and right next to Whole Foods!)  That said I like the pad thai and curries from here.  Trust me and skip the sushi completely.    Portions - adequate, Parking - fairly easy (Cicero or Peterson), Service - good (family owned)

30.description: I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. Combo of Thai and Sushi both are great.  Service can be a little slow, but all around very pleasant. Try the Spicy Basil.

46.description: Amazing Thai food!  I came with a group of 4 on a Saturday night.  This place hit the spot.  It's BYOB, but there's a Whole Foods across the street with anything you could want.We had appetizers, sushi, pad thai and dessert.  This was the best and most authentic Thai food I've had in Chicago.

1.description: I have been going to this place for the last 4 years. Food has been consistent and Customer service hasn't changed at all. My only wish is if they can play music otherwise its way too quiet.

55.description: I work in Skokie and have been on the prowl for a Thai restaurant with a good lunch special for a while now---and I think this might be the place.For $7-$8 you get your choice of an appetizer (Crab Rangoon, Egg Roll, California Roll, or Spring Roll) and a decent sized entre. The food was good--I had the Crab Rangoon that (shockingly?) appeared to have actual CRAB MEAT in them and the Ginger Chicken, which  was great. The service wasn't too hot (one server for the whole restaurant--and people at my table were being served entres before everyone had received their appetizers), but overall it was a pretty good meal.I wouldn't drive out of my way to go to this place, but it's a nice for a cheap Thai lunch if you're in the hood already...

9.description: This is my first time ordering from Chais's.  Wow!  I am really impressed.  The food arrived earlier than promised, hot and looking good.  Everything was so delicious and fresh.  The shumai was perfectly cooked and attractively arranged in the container.  I've had Pad Thai about 100 times but no one ever asked me the level of heat I wanted before.  I ordered medium and it was spicy but a great change from the sweet kind I usually have had.  The Tom Kha was also super great!  I will definitely order from them again - and soon!

26.description: So happy there's a restaurant near my new house!  I ate here for lunch one day and it was packed.  It's small, but neat and clean when dining in.  I ordered their Pad thai with Chicken and liked it a lot.  It was a little more brown than some others I've had, but I like that style.  I look forward to trying more dishes on their menu!

25.description: Had lunch here a few weeks ago. Great food, beautiful presentation. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because the noodles in my pad Thai were a tiny bit under done. Not a big deal because the flavor was perfect.

12.description: Stopped in here on a Saturday evening. The place was empty, which made me nervous. But the food and service was great! We got the crab rangoon and potstickers, which were some of the best I've had, the red chicken curry and a side of sticky rice (because I love sticky rice). I have absolutely no complaints about this restaurant and I know we'll be back. I'm excited to find a place nearby where I can get sushi and my husband can get something else that he likes, since he doesn't like sushi. Can't wait to try their carry out option when I don't want to cook.

21.description: Excellent service, sweet waitstaff and INCREDIBLE maki rolls. Sooo fresh and delicious. Highly recommended. Cute interior for the area, too:)

17.description: This is a great place to have a fun dinner with friends. As other reviewers have mentioned, this place can be a little slow, so if you want a quick meal, this isn't the place for you. I usually head to Chai with friends I haven't seen in a while, and we always have a great time. And with BYOB with no corking fee, how could we not?The spring roll is good - usually 3 of us share it and we all get a few pieces. Their pad see ewe is really good, as is their sushi.One of the biggest cheers for this place comes from Chai being so very accomodating to food allergies. One of my friends has many severe allergies, and Chai takes extra care to prepare the meal she wants in a way that she can have it. Looking forward to heading here again soon.

10.description: Just ordered and picked up my food ,  Rama curry chicken dish was with super dry  and old chicken , and it seems like every chicken dish you get is like that , brown rise was tasteless and broccoli undercooked , the only dish that is good is Tum yam soup !! Seriously you  have a restaurant don't try to fool people by giving than an old  or not good  ingridients

5.description: Best real thai food I've had ever had it was really really good!I got the basil chicken rice and my bf got pork blood soup made spicy so amazingly tasty I don't know the real name though. The only thing I will say is they didn't offer me their lunch menu that is on the take out menu so be sure to check that out if you go there before 3

3.description: The food was good, but the service was horrible. I don't know if the server has something against us Asian, but she was acting like we were begging for her food. Seriously, stop.We ordered crab rangoon, chicken satay, yellow curry, and thai roasted chicken (must-try) All the dishes were good, but I would never go back again.

35.description: Went there the other day for a normal lunch outing and the food was outstanding as usual!  Sometimes we pre-order our food before we dine in.  We are in and out fast.  Thank you Chai Bistro.  Also they are expanding their restaurant knocking out the wall to make their restaurant larger.  I highly recommend their lunch specials and have NEVER had a meal there I didn't like.  Always a lot of flavor and always leave full!

19.description: I had Thai food for the first time last week for my birthday and i have already been back since. The services was acceptable and the food was good. I specially liked the shrimp rolls, and i really don't care for shrimp all the much but these where delicious.  I am glad I chose to try this place out.

28.description: Crispy chicken is to die for!

45.description: As an avid Asian foodie, I was recommended Chai's Asian Bistro.  Initially, I was hesitant to drive from the City to Sauganash.  But, the 15 minute drive was well worth it.  The family-owned BYOB Thai restaurant definitely lived up to the "authentic" adjective that my friend used to describe Chai's.  The Thai Spring Rolls were phenomenal and the Fried Tofu was great.  Be sure to get the Sticky Rice with Mango for dessert!

33.description: Well, Chai's USED TO BE our "go-to" place for carry-out when we we're too tired to cook -- and then they started getting chincy with the portions.  The last straw was a $5 order of crab rangoon that had only 4 dumplings -- and they were small to boot.  Sorry Chai's, you had your chance.  Now my appetite and my business now go to Noodles Party on Lawrence.

43.description: I've been here before and can't believe I had forgotten to Yelp it! I was here Monday night -my friend Anna (bless her heart) took me out for a bday dinner. I really do like this place. It's very small and the food is good. My only complaint is that the service is pretty slow. My boyfriend got his dish a good 10 minutes before ours came out. So, he was being polite and ate slowly, but he probably could have finished before ours even came out. I suspect they only have one cook in the back who literally cooks the entrees one dish at a time. Other than that, I really like this place. That said, if you have time to kill and a fun group of 2-4, you can chit chat and pass the time. However, if you are in a hurry or have a large group and need things to come out at once, this might not be the best place.

2.description: I was gonna give them five stars but then when we went In nobody greeted us we have to seat ourselves and grab our menus (this was last Friday night)  .... What really did it was their food .... We ordered fried tofu (yummy!) , fried rolls( yummy again! ) , crab Rangoon  ( yum!yum!) , boat noodle (ooooohhhh!!!) and traditional beef fried rice ...

18.description: Nice place, very convenient to Edens Expressway.We met our daughter for lunch there the other day, and shared Vietnamese Roll, Spicy Beef Salad, and a Yellow Chicken Curry.  We finished it off with Sticky Rice and Mango.  Food quality was excellent, very tasty, We weren't in a huge hurry, and didn't notice any particular delays.  The hostess / server was very pleasant and fairly attentive.

41.description: Chai is a family run BYOB neighborhood restaurant.  Chai is small, clean and spare in an attractive manner.  The food is good and attractively presented.  The wait staff is pleasant, if a bit slow, and there is pleasant jazz music playing softly in the background.  I love having such a nice neighborhood restaurant.

52.description: This little BYOB place is perfect for the Saughanash hood. The service is a little slow, which is odd for such a small place, but it's tolerable. I have never been disappointed by this place and the dine in and take out crowd seem to agree.Everything from crab ragoon to pot stickers to sushi can be found on their menu. The food is always flavorful and lip-smacking. Everytime I go here, we order one of something and love it so much we have to order another. It's perfect for a low-key dinner out with any companion. The sushi is notable as well! Enough to choose from that I haven't tried all of them already but not limited to the standard rolls like california and spider.I'm pretty sure there is no corkage fee either- this place is great for a cheap night out that isn't lacking in flavor or variety!

50.description: This little strip-mall bistro is one of the best restaurants in the area.  It's small, but the atmosphere is modern without being too trendy.  It seems like a family-run place and the food is always excellent.  There's some normal 'asian restaurant' type dishes, as well as a good selection of thai dishes.  They have pretty excellent Pad Si Eiw, but my favorite dish is the Crunchy Chicken.  They also offer sushi, but i've never had it, so i'm not sure how it would be.If you're looking for a reasonable meal in this neighborhood, you can't do much better.

4.description: I've been going to this place ever since they opened because my parents live nearby. I haven't dined-in in awhile, so I can't really comment on service .Yet, I find the food just average. My family and I ordered take-out from here last night - mainly because it offers both sushi and traditional Thai dishes (we couldn't agree on cuisine). I hadn't had food from here in awhile so I had forgotten what I liked. However, I was in a sushi-mood, so I ordered the dragon roll. My mom ordered the Pad See Ewe. The dragon roll was fine, but the pad see ewe...The broccoli was not fresh, making the dish blah. As we ate, I remembered why I don't really ever crave this place. It doesn't really offer any outstanding dishes, just decent dishes to give you your Thai/sushi Fix. When I have the time, I go somewhere else to get tasty Asian food. As the Yelp rating for three stars identifies, this place is only "A-OK".

6.description: Family and I are new to town and my wife and I came to Sauganaush to look at homes.  We found this place on yelp and have to agree with the reviews.  I had the fried rice lunch special with a combo of all three meats, egg roll for appetizer.  Wife had pad Thai, chicken with spring roll appetizer.  Both meals were fresh and very flavorful and a healthy serving for a lunch special.  I would give 5 stars but service is "eh."

22.description: Excellent Food. I havent been here in awhile but went there tonight. The prices habe gone down but the quality is there. I felt that the menu could have had a few mote beef dishes. Still a hit

15.description: This was my first Thai food experience and it was wonderful! I tried the garlic chicken entree, the crispy sweet and sour chicken entree, and the pad Thai noodles. Everything was delicious. Nice atmosphere and service as well.

20.description: Amazing food!  I like to think of myself as a Thai food aficionado and this place is incredible!  The crab rangoon is the best I have ever tasted!  The salmon deluxe roll is so fresh; the rad naw krapraw is unbelievable - the magical sauce is to die for; the panang curry tastes like it was made with all fresh ingredients - not the pre-made bulk stuff you get at a lot of restaurants.  We topped off the dinner with the banana wonton dessert, which was a perfectly delicious way to end a fabulous meal.  Chai and his family are all so friendly and welcoming - we cannot wait to go back!!

36.description: I've been dining at Chai for over two years now and today the service was so horrible that I don't know if I can return.  Co-workers and I went here for our lunch today and were greeted by sub par service that took so long to get our food we ended boxing it up and leaving.  We only get so much time to take lunch here in corporate America, so when it takes almost an hour to receive my Chinese food, I am not a happy camper.  To top it off, they comped us all of 10% off our meal for the delay.  Mind you we've spend a good deal of money at Chai Bistro over the years that they could have comped at least one of our meals.  10% isn't much on a $40 tab.  I hate leaving bad tips but this time it was required.Hopefully they get their act together because the food is good here.

14.description: Service is pretty slow. And I was the only one there. Sushi is not good. Guess their specialty is Thai food only.

29.description: It seems they are getting more expensive and give less food. The menu says a dish has certain ingredients but the sever says it doesn't and it will be an extra $2 for cilantro and onions! What??!! Unheard of, this isn't Taco Bell.  The chicken was too salty again and I had to ask multiple times for no tomatoes. This use to be my favorite Mexican Restaurant...farewell El Pubelito :-(

42.description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  With the car repair shop burning down to the ground, if it wasn't for that reason I would have never found this place. For the past 3 months, my wife and I have ate here about 8x. At first services was horrible as it seemed they didn't know what there doing but the food was great. The past 4x or so I started noticing upgrades to the layout of the building and menu. On top of that, the waitress / ph order gal/ cashier or anything else you want the front lady to do, has become top notch on services all around. Seems busier as well. Taco dinner is killer with hand shaved cheese. Only complaint is the free nacho chips would be better if cut and fried within the store and some horrible store bought. Red sauce is also too saucy for my taste which I hate since I could eat all night as a side snack with dinner with no complaint if the fixed those two things.

23.description: I had been looking for a Mexican restaurant  with good al pastor.  After ordering from several other disappointing restaurants, El Pueblito is now my go to restaurant when I want great Mexican food delivered. Fast, and friendly delivery, and the food is always hot. Now that I found my Al Pastor restaurant,  I am trying their steak tacos next! Can't wait

47.description: Best horchatas in town!  This is a great place for some tacos.. it's nothing spectacular, so I can't give it more than 3 stars, but if you live in the area, it's totally worth going. It's good dependable mexican food, and they do not skimp on the meat in your tacos! I wish they used more cilantro and onions in the tacos, though.  Good salsa with your free chips, and delicious all around.  No complaints here!

8.description: Really great tacos, super flavorful guac, love the grilled shrimp. Carne Asada dinner is really great, ask for extra grilled onions!

31.description: Good place and good food. Close to where I live and they deliver.

34.description: I ordered for delivery from here twice.The first time I ordered chicken enchiladas and they did not taste good because they had no flavor, no salad on the side, and the cheese that it was topped with had no flavor. The horchata is good, though.I decided to give them another try and I ordered for delivery two ground beef tacos and a side of guacamole and chips.The ground beef in the tacos was disgusting and actually made me feel really grossed out. The guacamole I ordered was already brown. How do you send brown guacamole??? Very disgusting and the cook was too lazy to make fresh guacamole? Never ordering from here again.My stomach felt like sh*t after eating one taco and 1/3 of the guacamole.

16.description: Ordered on grubhub, didn't send complete order when i called back they said they would send it. I called back an hour later and the woman answers without a greeting and says its coming like I inconvenienced her. Shes not the one waiting for her breakfast at noon

13.description: Always used GrubHub to order from here today went in for takeout. It's not much for a sit down type place, but it's perfect for the city worker etc. they have bench seating and it's clean place. Food is hot and the horchata out of this world, I always get mine with no ice, get all the flavor not watered down too much. Chips and pico de gallo and torts on this visit, but over all everything is always good. Chicken soup is on point, and the tres leche cake mmmm best in this area.

11.description: I have to, agree. $10 for a taco plate is extreme. The rice is like a half cup serving.  There soup is ok but my opinion there are better places to order from.  I'd rather not eat here if I can manage.The last time i was here the women was so rude to me when i asked for the meat well done.

39.description: Perfect for BREAKFAST!  Or any other time of day for that matter.We have been eating from this place since moving into the neighborhood 3 years ago.  We've had everything from takeout,delivery, and dine-in, and have had breakfast, lunch, and dinner there.  Suffice to say we've consistently been impressed.  For starters, the salsas are fantastic, particularly the chile de arbol.  Perfect combination of heat and flavor (plenty of both).  Works perfectly on chips as well as burritos, eggs, etc.  But let's get to some of the other specifics:- My cousin spent over a decade in the Bay Area and has had his fill of delicious near-border taquerias.  He was staying with us and accidentally stumbled upon El Pueblito on GrubHub and ordered it without my knowledge when I wasn't home.  He raved about an excellent taqueria, reminiscent of some of the best in California, near my house and when I got home I found that it was my favorite local taqueria as well!  He loved the fresh guac and the generous tasty heapings of chihuahua cheese on everything.  - My wife is petrified of taqueria chicken.  Not from these guys.  The chicken burritos are fantastic.  They use pechuga in their fajita burritos which thankfully is not dry and full of flavor.- The guac deserves some more mention.  Well-seasoned, fresh ingredients, great taste; they give huge helpings with chips, and even leave the avocado seed in the box so it can last more than a day if you can't finish it in one sitting.  Truly impressive!  - My latest fixation with this place is the breakfast.  I went randomly one morning on my way to work and tried the breakfast burrito with eggs, cheese, peppers, onions, tomatoes, beans, etc.  with hash browns on the side.  What a magnificent decision!  I don't know why this place isn't packed for breakfast!- Today I brought my brother from NJ and we ordered chilaquiles with eggs and split the same breakfast burrito mentioned earlier.  Even he was floored!  So tasty, fresh, and all around solid.  - We have an IHOP behind our house that we can walk to in about 1.5 minutes.  It's much more worth the 7 minute drive to El Pueblito, however, for a deliciously flavorful breakfast instead!

37.description: This place is not stellar.  Nothing extraordinary.  But we love it.  Decent authentic al pastor.  Taco dinner's a good value.  Burritos are okay.  Guac is good, chips are adequate.  Whatever kind of freshly grated cheese they use is quite yum.What made my household love el pueblito is the DELIVERY.  It's fast, cheap & they deliver late.  Perfect for when we're craving a trip to a taqueria and the tot is already in bed.  Worth a try if you're nearby, or too lazy to go somewhere and eat in.

0.description: I love this place...... I always get the burritos and it's the best burrito I've had. I have never dined in but the Togo service is awesome. They never mess my order and they bring it right out to me.

38.description: Solid and consistant Mexican food...I prefer the Veggie tacos which overflow with ingrediants...try the steak tostada...very very good and fresh food.

27.description: The ladies that work here are always SUPER nice and friendly.  The place is small, but clean, and of course, the reason you are really here for is the food.Being new to the neighborhood, this is my number 1 pick of mexican restaurants nearby.  A good variety of food, large portions, great taste, not too greasy, not too costly.  Just right.Parking lot is small and awkward, so be ready to bust out with your best parking lot maneuvers.  One of the few places nearby that carries tamales, although the order I had were a little stale or dry.  I will order them again to see if it was a fluke. I recommend a little bit of everything, quesadillas, tortas, and of course the tacos.  yum!

32.description: My favorite Mexican place hands down. Steak taco dinner is amazing, you don't even need to use any sauce on the tacos they're so good. Chips and guac is always good. We usually get delivery they're always pretty quick to deliver and friendly. Have eaten there as well. Always our go to Mexican restaurant over even the most upscale Mexican restaurants.

48.description: I have been coming here since 2000. Back then it was under a different name (Taqueria El Ranchito) and it was usually after a night on the town needing some sustenance to get us through to the morning. The place hasn't changed at all over the years. They may have changed the signage but the food still tastes great. Over the years my drinking habits have changed and I no longer crave a taqueria run at 2 or 3 in the morning. Nowadays El Pueblito is good for a sober stop or if I am hankering for some el pastor tacos to satisfy the soul. I may look Asian on the surface but it is all tortillas and cilantro running through these veins. Living in Portage Park there is no shortage of taquerias in the hood but I would rather travel a bit further to frequent El Pueblito. Service with a smile the value is excellent and the horchata is superb. You will find me here at various intervals. It may be months between visits and then I'll be here 4 days in a row like this past weekend. Look at table 6. I will be wearing a hawaiian shirt with my face buried in the plate. Everything is good, but I stick with tried and true, tacos, tostadas, and tortas. Make them el pastor and you will be halfway up the stairway to heaven. Top it with an horchata and you will be on your way.

44.description: This place is fantastic for delivery. Always on time and sometimes even earlier! Food is always fresh and hot. VERY authentic Mexican cuisine. They have never let me down.

24.description: $10 for a taco platter is pretty ridiculous if you ask me. Especially since when I ordered they re-heated the steak instead of it going on the grill fresh. I will keep this as my desperate-for-tacos-and-too-hungover-to-go-anywhere-else place. Also, the food wasn't really all that great. I mean, it wasn't terrible, but for $10 I would expect something more. Meh.

7.description: Omg! Unbelievably amazing! Super excited to know I found a amazing Mexican restaurant that delivers to my house!!! Not only that; but the food is absolutely delicious!! I ordered Chilaquiles Con Carne and it is just delicious!! And I am a picky eater when it comes to this dish!! Will be ordering from here all the time!

40.description: This place has the best and most authentic tacos in our area. I love going out at night with friends and stopping here at 2:00AM for some pastor on the way home.The gorditas, sopes, and huaraches are all SUPER flame. Highly recommend not hesitating and order one of each with carne asada and another round with the pastor. Stuff your face and go home to pass out. What else could you want? Is this place clean? Clean enough, so who cares? Is this place friendly? Not really, I'm here for Mexican food, not to make friends. Prices are decent and they always have Spanish soap operas or soccer on their 19 inch tube TV in the corner.

30.description: Best Mexican food in the neighborhood. I order from here all the time. The girls that work there are pleasant and the food is yummy!! Also they always know I like my food vegetarian style...never any slip ups which is much appreciated. Fast service too!!!

46.description: I love El Pueblito!!!  They use authentic ingredients and the place is nice and clean.  Great guacamole.  Just a tad overpriced; that is my only complaint.

1.description: HORRIBLE!Called from our office to place 3 orders (all paying separately but coming to same place). The extremely rude lady that answered said that she would have to charge each of us a delivery fee.HOW DOES THAT MAKE SENSE? we are just paying separately; everything is being delivered together, ONE TIME. Therefore, one delivery fee should be charged.According to her, their computer inputs it automatically. Ok, i'm sure you can override the charge of even discount from the food if you cannot waive the charge.What customer service.We will never try to order from here again.

9.description: Love this place! My family and I have been eating at this place for 5 years now. I rather dine in. The waitress are very friendly! Plus, when we order take out it seems the amount of food they give is less. The rice and beans is not as much as when you actually dine in. All in all Ive pretty much tasted everything on the menu. My favorite is the shrimp soup, it's really good! I'm hoping they serve Pozole soon though!!!

26.description: I've only ordered delivery from this location, but it's my go-to Mexican joint in the area.  Love their chips to the point that I don't actually buy tortilla chips from the store; I just order a few extra bags when I get food.  The guacamole is always excellent (and the include sour cream with the full order!) and their carne asada is always tasty.  The staff is also very conscientious about paying attention to special requests, and the delivery woman is always polite and early.  Over all, a good solid business with tasty food that does exactly what it says on the tin.

25.description: This place if possible had just gotten worse. The food is terrible and not edible. I am so disappointed in this place the last few times we have ordered as we have been loyal customers for awhile. I will never order or eat from here again.

12.description: Just got takeout here and gotta say, I'm quite impressed.  Got the carne asada burrito, chips, and guac with a horchata to wash it down.  Guac was tasty, burrito was loaded and the meat had flavor and was perfectly .  Chips weren't biting into a salt bomb and the red salsa was perfect.Horchata was also sweet and refreshing.  Ordered to be taken out and I wasn't even able to sit down and pull out my phone to text my girlfriend before the nice lady who took my order handed me my food.  Will be coming back here again!

21.description: I have to, agree. $10 for a taco plate is extreme. The rice is like a half cup serving.  There soup is ok but my opinion there are better places to order from.  I'd rather not eat here if I can manage.The last time i was here the women was so rude to me when i asked for the meat well done.

17.description: I've been here numerous times just to pick up food. I can't really tell you guys how the service is because all I do is call in, order, go in, pay, and leave. For a small and not well known business, I'm impressed how the tacos, super nachos, and the burritos are. Haven't tried it personally, but my mother gets a slice of flan here and she loves it and she sure knows her food, so I can vouch for this piece of flan !

10.description: This is our favorite take-out Mexican food. My family and I have been coming here for years. I love their tacos and my fiancé is adamant that there is something special about the chicken quesadilla dinner (when he's not obsessing about their enchiladas verde). Their taco salad is also one of my favorites. It's simple, quick, reasonably priced and close to home!

5.description: My experience didn't deserve more than 2-Stars.  Next time I will order for delivery to my home.  Very friendly server, pretty smile, and she was efficient. Space needs a thorough cleaning and it smells greasy.  Too many dust bunnies, greasy floors and furnishings.  Cleaning looks as if it is just an occasional superficial wipe down.  The kitchen needs their hood filters changed more often.  When I got home last night I smelled like a grease trap.

3.description: Ordered for the first time:  Taco salad with ground beef and a large Horchata.  I'm really picky about Horchata, so I was pleasantly surprised!  Not the best I've ever tasted, but still very good- not chalky, doesn't taste like a powder mix.  And the large is pretty large.  Taco salad had very fresh ingredients, included fresh avocado and sour cream.  Taco shell was maybe a little overcooked, if I want to be picky.  But overall great.  Grubhub had listed it coming with rice, beans, and salad, which it did not.  It was deemed to be an error on the Grubhub website.  I'll order from here again and see what else they have to offer.

35.description: This is a good hole in the wall Taqueria. My friend and I came in on a Saturday for lunch. We both ordered a taco bowl. I ordered steak (really good) and she ordered ground beef (had chopped up potatoes in it). We both enjoyed our bowls. I hate plastic cups... and my water was never filled. Had to ask.This really ain't that kinda joint though, so I only took one star away from that. The food was good and we left happy. Oh yeah and it was super cheap!!!!! I'll def head back for another taco bowl. Probably split one with someone because it was big!!!

19.description: $10 for a taco platter is pretty ridiculous if you ask me. Especially since when I ordered they re-heated the steak instead of it going on the grill fresh. I will keep this as my desperate-for-tacos-and-too-hungover-to-go-anywhere-else place. Also, the food wasn't really all that great. I mean, it wasn't terrible, but for $10 I would expect something more. Meh.

28.description: I'm having their yummy guacamole and tasty horchata, BUT IT'S FREEZING INSIDE! It feels like the heat isn't on.  I'd give them 4 stars for price and quality of food, but how can it be enjoyed when it's so COLD?!?

45.description: Typical Mexican taqueria. That pretty much sums it up for this review.

33.description: When I was still new to the neighborhood, I had nowhere to go to pick up some late dinner. I would drive by this place all the time and wonder if they made anything palatable. Color me "suburban girl," but I see a restaurant with very little signage and I automatically think it's going to be bad food. On the other hand, my Daddy was always drawn to these places when I was little. I'd be swimming in the roomy front seat of his '79 Ford Thunderbird, and almost every time I rode along for Saturday errands, he'd have to stop some place obscure for lunch.I like Mexican food. This is a place that has clearly nailed the art of making tacos and burritos. You can even come here for a late breakfast burrito. There is also a decent Carne A La Tampequena. Mexicans own the culinary corner market when it comes to making a succulent skirt steak. My heart has been broken by some of the mean things people have had to say about the food here. This is fast food. If you want something healthy and completely devoid of fat and gristle; then go shopping at Whole Foods and make dinner by yourself! To the staff: I love you and you make excellent food and I don't know what I'd do without you! Your restaurant is also very clean. I could not be more impressed with how efficient this predominantly female staff runs the entire show. I am not going to take a star away because I love these ladies so much. However, they did manage to mess up the one time I called in a phone order. Since then I have not bothered to call. It doesn't take them much time to make the food, so it doesn't really matter anyway. If you want things added or taken off of a dish, they are very accommodating. However, there is a menu to order from, and all of your favorite Mexican dishes will be on there. You have the option of washing it all down with an old school bottle of Coke, still manufactured out of Mexico. I have also seen people bring their own beer here.  If you need a quick bite, you won't be disappointed. Stop in and grab some reasonably priced tacos to go. If you get a burrito, you will have a mess in your lap about half way through if you try to eat one in the car. Remember to make sure they give you the hot sauces with your order. My favorite, and the hottest, is the green sauce. The red is tasty too. See you there!

43.description: This place always can satisfy my cravings.... The other night I had an inkling for tamales and a quesadilla.... and bam....they had everything I could hope for.

2.description: $17 for steak Taco Dinner and Caldo De Res beef soup. The tacos were ok..meat tastes a bit funny and a few fatty pieces. The rice and beans were not good very bland. The $7 "beef soup" is water with cabbage carrots and potatoes and two big fatty chunks of beef, I guess, which I will not eat.

18.description: When I was still new to the neighborhood, I had nowhere to go to pick up some late dinner. I would drive by this place all the time and wonder if they made anything palatable. Color me "suburban girl," but I see a restaurant with very little signage and I automatically think it's going to be bad food. On the other hand, my Daddy was always drawn to these places when I was little. I'd be swimming in the roomy front seat of his '79 Ford Thunderbird, and almost every time I rode along for Saturday errands, he'd have to stop some place obscure for lunch.I like Mexican food. This is a place that has clearly nailed the art of making tacos and burritos. You can even come here for a late breakfast burrito. There is also a decent Carne A La Tampequena. Mexicans own the culinary corner market when it comes to making a succulent skirt steak. My heart has been broken by some of the mean things people have had to say about the food here. This is fast food. If you want something healthy and completely devoid of fat and gristle; then go shopping at Whole Foods and make dinner by yourself! To the staff: I love you and you make excellent food and I don't know what I'd do without you! Your restaurant is also very clean. I could not be more impressed with how efficient this predominantly female staff runs the entire show. I am not going to take a star away because I love these ladies so much. However, they did manage to mess up the one time I called in a phone order. Since then I have not bothered to call. It doesn't take them much time to make the food, so it doesn't really matter anyway. If you want things added or taken off of a dish, they are very accommodating. However, there is a menu to order from, and all of your favorite Mexican dishes will be on there. You have the option of washing it all down with an old school bottle of Coke, still manufactured out of Mexico. I have also seen people bring their own beer here.  If you need a quick bite, you won't be disappointed. Stop in and grab some reasonably priced tacos to go. If you get a burrito, you will have a mess in your lap about half way through if you try to eat one in the car. Remember to make sure they give you the hot sauces with your order. My favorite, and the hottest, is the green sauce. The red is tasty too. See you there!

41.description: Despite john h.'s dire warnings we ate lunch here today. The place looked clean, the service friendly and the food was nicely plated. We had no complaints, just a typical neighborhood taco joint. Christopher had the steak tacos and I had the combo of a taco, tostada and an enchilada. It was all fine, but not overly exciting. Christopher also ordered horchatta which he was not nuts about because it had a lot of cinnamon in it. I, on the other hand, really liked it. The only thing I really didn't care for was the guacamole. Won't repeat that one. Of course my gut kicked up a bit on the way home, but it always does after eating cheap tacos. It is the price I pay for being old and loving little corner joints like this one. It comes with (and goes with) the territory.

4.description: Great food, great speedy service, using the Yelp eat24 feature. The food came by fast and we have the super nachos and two burritos that were huge. Plenty of food for leftovers. The food only was $33 and it can definitely split for 2-meals easily.

6.description: The food was very good, Me and My Daughter had Taco's and My wife had a Torta... left feeling great about the food and what we spent, the service was awesome and fast... Would recommend to anyone.

22.description: Just got takeout here and gotta say, I'm quite impressed.  Got the carne asada burrito, chips, and guac with a horchata to wash it down.  Guac was tasty, burrito was loaded and the meat had flavor and was perfectly .  Chips weren't biting into a salt bomb and the red salsa was perfect.Horchata was also sweet and refreshing.  Ordered to be taken out and I wasn't even able to sit down and pull out my phone to text my girlfriend before the nice lady who took my order handed me my food.  Will be coming back here again!

15.description: I'm really surprised by the radically differing opinions. I have ordered delivery from this place for years. I always order the same thing, burrito supremo with chorizo. It is always excellent. The guac is always good & fresh. My husband gets the pollo soup, which he devours, so I guess he must like it! Delivery is always prompt and people nice.

20.description: I don't live very far away. While the food came very quickly-actually too quickly, everything I ordered was cold and tasteless.

36.description: I've been here twice in my life - once when the place first opened (under a different name, around 1995) and today.  I always meant to come back here to see if it was as good as it was back then, and I got that chance today.  I ordered the steak taco dinner.  The steak tacos were good.   Not extraordinary.  Not terrible.  Just good.  The chips were OK but they aren't served with salsa, just red and green sauce.  I would have preferred salsa.  Customer service was excellent.  The place was filled to near capacity when I walked in, that's a good sign.  To summarize El Pueblito - good food for cheap.  By far not the best I've had, but for the area it's a pretty good choice.

14.description: Got take out here...food got to me at estimated time. Mediocre steaks tacos had a hair in my beans gross...I literally had two teaspoons of rice in my taco dinner. Also had steak nachos lil bits of steak,soggy and stale chips looked like a mess had pickled carrots and onions in my nachos,not appetizing at all. I paid 8.99 for nachos that I didn't eat. I rather eat at aTaco Bell at least there consistent. Was not satisfied with what I got and paid for. Word of advise best just to avoid this place altogether.

1.description: I'm pretty surprised by some of the bad reviews, as I quite enjoyed my treatment here! My tech was Amy, and I went on a pretty quiet Monday night about two weeks ago. I needed a pedicure pretty badly, since I had been putting it off due to my many 5K events during August and early September. I did the "Deluxe Pedicure" and, I have to say, it was pretty deluxe. I would say I was there about 2 hours! However, it was the relaxing start to the week I needed. I love that there were so many steps -scrubs, lotions, liquids, a little massage. They have the standard massage chairs all facing a  TV on the opposite wall. That said, I have a few more races coming up and then I'm gonna go again and get the same treatment! My feet are still looking good, but I miss the pampering!

9.description: Got a no chip manicure, pedicure, and my eyebrows done. I was so pleased with all three services, and will definitely be going back. Exceptional service!!!!

23.description: Have a voucher for this place through DealFind.  As soon as they found that out, their next available appointment is 2 months from now.  Are you kidding?!?!?!  Why do the vouchers if you're not willing to service the clients?  This place is a joke.  Go to Lee Nails in Edgebrook.  It's cheaper.

12.description: The only reason I went here because I got a deal from dealfind.com for a 45 minute no chip manicure and a 45 min spa pedicure for $19, but let me tell you now that I will NEVER go back again!  My friend and I walked in and the people that worked there just stared at us until I said something; "we have an appointment."  They then just continued to look at us; didn't even tell us to have a seat.When it was our turn we sat in the spa chair in which they two ladies started working on us.  My friend and I sat there, the massage chair NOT turned on, the "spa" part of the water not running... i'm sorry i thought this was called a SPA pedicure? What was the point of sitting in massage chairs if you don't turn them on and the "whirlpool" for our feet isn't on either?!Then the lady doing my pedicure CUT me! I was bleeding for quite a bit and she couldn't make it stop, by then I was already in out of my head! She finished my toes and then started my manicure in which she cut me AGAIN! That's right she cut my finger also and that bled for a few minutes for non stop. The only reason this place even got one star was because the 2nd lady who did my manicure after the first one cut me was nice and did a good job on my nails.Like I said, I will NEVER come back to this place again!

21.description: Used a groupon. The manicure was the best I have ever had it stayed on for a week. The pedicure was nothing special, and I took away a star for the underarm wax because overall it was a bad job and left my underarms burnt. I took away another star because of the lack of customer service skills. Two people came in and walked out frustrated and they only accept cash for tips. I would recommend an appointment although it is not necessary.

17.description: I heard about this place from a friend who had bought a Dealfind here, and since I was up north fulfilling my craving for authentic Indian food, I decided to pay it a visit, or two rather.  My first time here I got the OPI Axxium no-chip mani - that one only lasted about 1.5 weeks before it started to bubble off my nail bed.  The second time I went here I mentioned that to the no-chip nail tech, and she was quick to recommend the Gelish no-chip brand.  I decided to go with that, and 4 weeks later my no-chip mani STILL looks fabulous!  The only thing is my nails have grown out, and if I don't want to be snubbed by Chicago's manicure snobs, I better get it removed soon.  If it weren't so far north, I'd be back here for more no-chip manicures.

10.description: Used a groupon. The manicure was the best I have ever had it stayed on for a week. The pedicure was nothing special, and I took away a star for the underarm wax because overall it was a bad job and left my underarms burnt. I took away another star because of the lack of customer service skills. Two people came in and walked out frustrated and they only accept cash for tips. I would recommend an appointment although it is not necessary.

5.description: I've been coming here for a while now because its close to home and they do a good job on my nails. Plenty of colors to chose from, good products, friendly techs the ladies are always very nice and they do a good job. Its inexpensive and they've had good deals. I've even had cool designs on some nails before. Def. My go-to nail salon.

11.description: The girl working on my toes cut me twice. She was very nice, but it was still painful. She did do a paraffin treatment on my heels, which is more than I normally receive with a standard pedicure so I was happy with that. The people in charge were not overly friendly, but it wasn't so bad that I would refuse to go back.

0.description: So I tried this place on a whim but I'm glad I did... The name has changed...I thought the salon was clean and the staff was very nice.  I got a no chip mani and a pedi.  Price was right and I was happy with it.  Will definitely go back!

20.description: I heard about this place from a friend who had bought a Dealfind here, and since I was up north fulfilling my craving for authentic Indian food, I decided to pay it a visit, or two rather.  My first time here I got the OPI Axxium no-chip mani - that one only lasted about 1.5 weeks before it started to bubble off my nail bed.  The second time I went here I mentioned that to the no-chip nail tech, and she was quick to recommend the Gelish no-chip brand.  I decided to go with that, and 4 weeks later my no-chip mani STILL looks fabulous!  The only thing is my nails have grown out, and if I don't want to be snubbed by Chicago's manicure snobs, I better get it removed soon.  If it weren't so far north, I'd be back here for more no-chip manicures.

19.description: Great manicure, clean, cute and they have really great nail colors.  My manicure has lasted more than a week already.

2.description: I had a groupon for this place a while back. It was for a mani and pedi. The pedicure took 45 minutes. It was ridiculous. I had a groupon for a gel IBD. It started to chip the next day. The lady working there seemed upset that I was even using a groupon. What's the point of using groupon if you're going to be rude to customers? Granted, they are paying half the price as a normal customer, but because of your attitude, you just lost a could-be customer and gained a bad review on top of it.

18.description: It took them 4 (YES, FOUR!) hours from when I arrived to do a mani & pedi!!!

13.description: NEVER AGAIN!  After my experience today, I was going to warn others about this place anyway--now I am especially glad I did reading that several customer had the same experience. I was CUT during my service here. The implements were dull and the technician stabbed me. If I don't get an infection it will be a miracle. Then they had the gall to charge me?  Heed my warning and read the other reviews.

4.description: I've been going to CND for years now.  My favorite place for pedicures.  The cost is reasonable and the pedicures are better than most nail salons (includes paraffin treatment for your heels which usually costs extra).  I have never made an appointment, just walked in.  They've always been able to get me in within 30 minutes.  Definitely recommend this place!

24.description: This place is great. It just changed owners about a month ago, but still carries on the same service as the old one. The reason I did not give it 5 stars is because it is a little more expensive than most manicure places I have been too and it gets really crowded. I would recommend making an appointment and/or going early in the morning on the weekends. 2PM seems to be prime time. While it is a little more expensive, I don't mind paying because it is convenient to my house and they provide extra service. If you get a pedicure done right now, they give you complimentary pedicure socks (there are no toes) since it is cold. Also, when you are done with your manicure or pedicure, they give you a mini neck/shoulder massage. They also check back after you have been drying for a little bit and put some quick dry on. Then they always help you with your coat and make sure you have your keys. The new owner, Anne Marie, is so sweet too!

6.description: I have been going to CnD Nails & Spa since the change of ownership in June 2013.  Nancy the owner as well as the other nails techs are amazing at what they do.  Very polite, and the shop is very clean.  I love getting my no chip mani and pedi.  They do offer other services.  It's a perfect place to relax and get pampered.

15.description: Under new management for a couple weeks I think now and oh boy you can tell the difference.The old owner ( male) did such a fantastic job. always took his time and did such a great job! he helped pick out colors and offered suggestions and he took his time and did a great job! new people RUSH thru the process!! my nails look better when I do it at home! I'm sorry, I'm not paying $50 if it doesnt look nice and professional!! OMG, i'm so mad! my nails look streaky with air bubbles and the edges run into my cuticles! i'm soo sad old owner is gone! not coming back here EVER AGAIN!

7.description: I bought two of the deal find coupons for this place. The first time i went was the day of my friends wedding that i was in. Appt was at 9:30 AM. when they opened and didn't get out of there till noon. I was very upset about that plus the nail tech who did my no chip mani nicked my nail bed and i starting bleeding. She didn't apologize, she continued to stop working on me to answer the phone to take other appts. I understand its a business but it was others there who could have helped out with the phones. My pedi was done with quality but they don't turn on the spa part of the chair or the massage part. Basically your feet just in the water. I used my second coupon in July i was going to Ohio. my pedi was good once again. I got the same nail tech that made me nervous because i didn't want to get nicked again and start bleeding. this time i picked out the color for my no chip and before she applied the polish i had changed my mind and picked another color. She says " I thought you wanted this color" and i told her i changed my mind i want this instead. She made me feel like i didn't have the option to change my mind and i 100% do. My suggestion make an appt, don't go to this place if you looking for a quick in and out because they are kinda slow but the quality is good. Another thing i wanted to tip and signs all over the shop says cash tips only. So i had to go the gas station across the street, pay the ATM a fee, purchase something to get change and walk back to tip. inconvenience.....

8.description: I used to come to this nail salon a couple of years ago and was not overly impressed, so decided to use another salon. Recently, I was in the area and needed a manicure, so what the heck, gave it another try...it was fabulous! I was so impressed with the service, pricing and attention to detail. Turns out, ownership has changed once again (within a few months) and I really, really like this place now and thrilled I gave it another chance! Fyi, The new owner was doing my no chip and I expressed how I used to come in, but hadn't in a while, he was really excited to get new clients and try and keep them. Good start! :)

3.description: No chip mani lasted two weeks, one week was in IrelandRegular mani is quick and thorough Friendly peopleClean Bring cash for tips, it's just common curtesy

14.description: I've been getting my nails done by Nancy for over a year now. She recently changed nail shops and I went with her. It takes me 30 minutes to get to CND nails but no one makes a no chip last as long as Nancy does. I had countless peeling nail fiascos before I found her. My hands are constantly in water for work and my nails are always perfect. I went to Italy for a month last summer and not a chip or dent in them.

1.description: Girlfriend had a laser treatment here recently and they did an excellent job.  Service was perfect, treatment was perfect, have no complaints and just wanted to give thanks via Yelp.

0.description: Natural Health clinic is very pleasant place. When i visit them, i always feel special! They have very affective lasers and professional stuff, that's what basically  i need (for example i did 3 times Laser hair removal, and i have around 30% of hair left, what i can't say about other lasers), very happy that i found this place! Highly recommended!

12.description: Valbona and her staff could not be a happier environment..Been a loyal customer for 6 years...I've got at least a dozen or more of my friends to go there as well...The prices are UNBEATABLE!!!..don't ever want to change...your $200.00 highlights are long gone..save your money for other things..like clothing/purses, belts..They also thread and do waxing....don't miss this opportunity..you'll save save save

3.description: I will travel 50 miles when I move to the western suburbs to get my hair and beard done by Valbona.  My wife started coming here as well at my suggestion.  She won't go anywhere else now.  She colors hair and it is perfect.  I told her how I want my hair and beard trimmed.  She remembered from day one.  At first when I would get one of her girls she would tell them how I wanted it cut. After observing this for several times and seeing her working and relating to her customers I asked if I could have her do mine when I came. Sure no problem she replied.Thus I sit here today without an appointment waiting for her,  and I am happy to wait!!

1.description: Valbona did my hair for a wedding. I had it recently cut and was not sure if it was long enough for one of the styles I had chosen (a side chignon) so I had a bunch of photos on my phone to show her what I was thinking. She was so gracious and styled my hair beautifully. Since it was a simple style she did it quickly and it stayed in place the whole night through loads of dancing, jumping, and shakin' it baby.She is such a lovely and genuine person. I really enjoyed going to her and recommend her to everyone.

2.description: A friend of mine recommend this salon to me and I am so grateful! Valbona is the sweetest person and makes getting your hair done a pleasant experience instead of a chore. She does wonderful work while, simultaneously,  being quick and efficient. Her amazing memory for recognizing, seemingly, each and every customer always makes you feel like an old friend. Not to mention, her prices are great! Make Valbona's your new salon. You won't be sorry!

9.description: i love this place the whole team makes you feel as you are part of the family.Great gob always on my horse hair. The highlights and color are always perfect an beautiful. Thank you..thank you. Thank you o needed this

10.description: Good, inexpensive place to get your hair done. Waits aren't usually long, but you can call ahead if you like. The staff members appreciate being paid in cash.Edited to add: They have stopped accepting credit cards here.

13.description: Valbona is a pro and runs a great shop. She has a natural and intuitive way of knowing what you want even when you don't know how to describe it to well. She is very precise and attentive to detail. And I always walk out feeling like I got a really top notch cut. I can't recommend her salon enough.

16.description: Love this place! Great salon with very reasonable prices. You are made to feel at home in this little salon and they do a wonderful job at making you look wonderful. A hidden treasure on the northwest side of Chicago.

6.description: Are you able to see something like this without being on Facebook?facebook.com/media/set/?…

15.description: So my mom goes Valbona for her hair cut and colored. I never really had my own person to go to. So I tryed her as well. Awsome job she does. She is very sweet and great at what she does. The 2 times I have gone I have got my hair color red with black highlights. Nice job. !

0.description: Same as some others, a friend took me here. She's been going for 6 years and now I will be too! The store is unassuming, but the staff is fantastic! They listen and work with you and do GREAT work.

5.description: Thanks Valbona..you made me a happy woman today when you took away they gray. As usual I walked out of the shop looking and feeling 100%.

11.description: I was looking for a new place in my neighborhood after I had a bad hair cut experience with my previous beauty salon. I saw this place on yelp and was a little hesitant since there were only 3 reviews. I've gone there twice so far and both times I've been very satisfied with my hair cut. $15 for long hair and $10 for a short hair cut. Once Valbona cut my hair and once it was Ina. It was consistent and exactly how I like my hair cuts both times. They even offered a discount both times, but I paid full price since I was so happy with the cuts. Also, Valbona knew the names of all her regular customers that came in while I was waiting. I think little things like that go a long way. I will be returning and I've also suggested this place to my sister. The place takes credit cards but prefers cash.

8.description: A friend referred me here and they are GREAT.  Have had Valbona herself plus others in her shop.  Have gotten a great cut each time, plus have just walked in each time.  Sometimes wait a short bit on the weekends, but at most, 10 min or so.  And get this - $12 for adult (short hair, I think maybe $14 for longer hair) and $8 for kids, I think?  Have only gotten cuts for me & my family at this point, but have some amazing color (highlights / lowlights) walking out of there as well.  I'll be booking that soon!

4.description: I found this salon on Yelp while looking for a quick haircut on a Friday.  When you first drive by, the place looks a little old school and I wasn't sure what I was in for.  I have got some really bad haircuts throughout the years while trying to "get a quick cut".    My hair is tricky because it is really short, and I like it spunky-trendy-- without looking like a boy or a 85 year old woman.  They did a superb job on my haircut and I was so pleased I ended up getting a color job too.  Getting your hair done here is a fun experience in itself with lots of regulars coming in and out, chatting, even passing out cookies :)  I really felt comfortable here like I was hanging out with some friends and getting a darn good haircut in the process.  I will definitely be back.  This is 100% the best hidden secret salon on the North side of Chicago,  you get a $60 haircut for just about nothing and good company to go along with it.

14.description: I have a friend who gets her hair cut and colored here.  So with the referral, I got a full head highlight for only $50.  I love it,  Valbona did a great job.  I will be back and thanks!!

7.description: Great place! Valbona and her girls are so sweet & down to earth. The salon is no frills but believe me the quality is better than those overprice trendy salons. Cash is preferred. I called ahead she quoted me a price and then when done she should behind her word. Valbona is honest & has great neighborhood salon.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Great neighborhood pharmacy.  I just like the smaller more personal feel.

1.description: Tarpeys is my neighborhood pharmacy, I love them . Pat knows me by name and keeps my life uncomplicated  my welfare depends on him and I love the convenience !

2.description: Great neighborhood business.  I highly recommend this place.  You won't get this kind of personal service at the big retail stores, that is for sure!

5.description: I moved into Sauganash about three years ago and found out about Tarpey from my neighbors.  I don't get many prescriptions filled so they would easily have an excuse not to remember me but guess what?  They recognize me and treat me like someone who has been a customer for years.  Great personal service and I feel good about patronizing a business that is not a greedy, faceless corporation.

6.description: Owner was very rude to us and we'll avoid them at all costs. I had thought it was nice to support small businesses but no more. Walgreens here I come!!!

7.description: I thought Tarpey's would be more expensive without the buying leverage of  Walgreen's or CVS.  I was amazed at how much money I saved at Tarpey's on two separate prescriptions.  That's where I will be going from now on!

8.description: This place has been taking care of my familys Pharmaceutical needs for as long as I can remember. Its nice having a local place like this in the neighborhood. They know they're customers, they're super friendly, and always willing to strike up a quick conversation which is something you just dont get at a Walgreens or CVS. This place keeps that neighborhood charm that you just dont see anymore. Wish they didnt move across the street, that extra 100 ft is just killer, but I love dig this place none the less!

0.description: Pat and his team at this family owned pharmacy has taken care of us for many years. Perfect, personal, one on one service and care. You're not just an unknown number here. In most cases, your meds are ready for pick up the same day you stop in or call. 5 Five Stars all the way for Tarpey's Pharmacy.       Cicero/Peterson

4.description: So cute. They have cool toys for the kids. Nice old time feel, I am hooked. It's like a well kept secret tucked away. Must be a old family biz and I wish this kinda place existed all over. I recommend this place highly. Go Tarpeys!

58.description: Solid Indian food delivery to Lincoln Square via GrubHub. Unlike most other Indian restaurants that charge a $6+ delivery charge, Himshikar only charges $4 - afforable laziness is my friend.A normal order usually involves garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, some sort of spinach dish (the spinach and mushroom one is lovely), and veggie samosas. Everything is delicious, and I especially like how you have the option to get extra sauce, meat, and rice with the chicken tikka masala, so no one has to fight over it at home. Definitely my go-to when I am looking for some Indian delivery.

56.description: The food here is not bad, but if you order delivery, plan on waiting 90 minutes or more.  They are on GrubHub and Eat24 so ordering is convenient. They are also open on Mondays.

29.description: The taste is great! The portions were a little bit small for the price we paid I thought.  The rice serving was almost a little over palm full... Nonetheless, the food was great! We had the food delivered and it was fresh.  You can tell that it was just made. Yes, we will know if the food was made yesterday and just reheated.  In our case, that was not!  As much disappointment we received from the size of the serving, we were also quite surprised at how filling it was.  I was able to get 2 servings from my tikka masala and my fiance was only able to get 1 but he had to force it in as he did not want any leftovers.  I would have given them 4 stars because of the price, but seeing how it was compensated with the fact that I was able to get 2 meals out of it (just had to buy naan from a grocery store and made my own rice) - I give them 5!!!!!!!

42.description: I love this place!! The food is fantastic and I am somewhat of a continuer of Indian food.  Everything is fresh and delicious and they spice everything perfectly. The samosas are made fresh in house. I know because they're always slightly different but excellent!! And the garlic nan is outstanding. I love spicy food and I order medium spicy I can't imagine how hot very spicy is.  That being said, enjoy! This place is epic!!

23.description: One of the best deals I've come across in years.My daughter and I got out of the place for $32.00. We had two appetizers, two entrees and a basket of naan. The place isn't much to look at, but who cares? Does anyone go to Himalayan restaurants for the décor?Check out the tikka chicken masala and the lamb samosas, and lamb vindaloo. All were outstanding.Be warned about the heat in the food. Anything beyond "medium hot" is self abuse.

47.description: This place made great food! It's an average looking restaurant although the flavor of the food is amazing. Made with great care! This family owned restaurant puts and great deal of effort in their savory snacks and meals! Enjoyed it all!

8.description: My review is for takeout. We ordered three entrees: two vegetarian and one lamb, plus naan, samosas and dessert. Everything was spot on, in fact the best Indian food I've had outside India. Highly recommend!
