31.description: I regularly get food delivered from here but I've never been to their physical location. I love their Mattar Paneer and Garlic Naan. I don't know what it is, but the Indian-Nepalese fusion is just terrific.

34.description: Good. Wife got the Chicken Tikka Masala. It's good, slightly different than typical Indian version. It's Himilayian; slightly more Asian flavors. She got it spicy and it was wonderfully infused in the chicken breast.I got the Ghosht Pasanda. Mild in heat, comforting cream sauce. I would definately get it spicier next time. Which there definitely be a next time.One of the previous comments stated that Naan was a little thicker. It was, but the wonderful chewiness was great. It definitely is not a frozen version that they did in the microwave. I think if I ate there, it would have been a good combo of chewy and crunchy spots.Prices are reasonable. Definitely give it a try.

16.description: Great food. The Korma is awesome.

13.description: Here is a place that is both unusual and familiar. It's pretty rare to find a Himalayan/Nepalese restaurant; I've seen maybe three or four in my life. But then again, it's not SO DIFFERENT from a Mom and Pop Indian restaurant, so there's nothing to really worry about -- you'll find a lot of the standard favorites. However... don't stop there. It's really worth exploring the menu. I'd start with their dumplings called Momos. They have a vegetarian version too and they're delicious; a little bit spicy; and a perfect way to start the meal. Also there are multiple types of bread, including Him's Bread which is far from commonly found as it contains raisins. I order that and Garlic Naan and usually take about half of each order home with me as it reheats well.This place doesn't skimp on quality. They use mahi mahi for the fish and don't even bother saying that on the menu. It's this kind of attitude of honesty and integrity that makes it always a pleasure to meet the people who run this restaurant. They are so kind. Perhaps some Americans are not accustomed to the quiet reserve of their demeanor. They are genuine and helpful, always ready to make the customer happy. I've been here many times and it seems the patrons are hardly ever new customers; but when I bring new people with me, they always remark about how much they like it. Another thing I like about this place is that even if you order the "standard Indian food" you may be surprised that it's spiced a little mellower, or with slightly different touches, due to the different geography/ethnicity. It's "their" version of that dish. So the variation is like hearing a live version of a song you already know the regular recording. It's almost the same, but different, and that makes you appreciate both.It's BYOB so there's savings there. They have excellent chai tea and an array of cans of soft drinks. Don't expect some vast variety of foreign soda pop.Sure this place could be fancier. But that's not what they're all about. I think they have been in business a couple years now and seem to be getting better and better with handling customer demands. It's one of those places where you know they are building the American dream. And that feels good to be a part of it.

11.description: Nice place in area where u least expect. whole foods is just across the street. we wanted to have some indian style snacks so tried this option.Nice masala tea with lot of cream :). We tried momos vegetarian option and it was good. Diping sauce was different but nice. Samosa platter was missing salt spicei it.Overall nice experience for the stuff I was looking for.Next time if i get chance i will try some curries also.

39.description: A great place for Indian. They always deliver pretty quickly, and have never gotten our order wrong. The samosas are always flakey and delicious, as are the dipping sauces. The naan is also amazing. The butter chicken is my go to order. It is so heavenly and spicy. A generous portion of rice comes with the butter chicken, which is very much appreciated. I hate when some Indian places make you pay extra for rice. My boyfriend and I dined in recently, and were a little taken aback. It was much smaller than we anticipated, and they never turned on the lights in the restaurant, which was kind of strange. The service (and food) was very attentive though.

37.description: The food was excellent and delivered on-time and hot. A touch more expensive than others, but well worth it. I will order from them again.

0.description: So far I've been here twice with friends. They only offer a few Himalayan dishes; most of the items on the menu are of Indian origin. We had tandoori chicken (moist and tasty), lamb biryani (tender and flavorful) chicken korma in a delicious creamy sauce and chicken Momo appetizers (like Chinese dumplings but better). The baigan bartha was the best I've ever eaten; I loved the taste of the smoked eggplant. We asked for our food to be mildly spiced; my friends thought some of them were a little on the bland side so I suggest asking for your dishes to be spiced medium or hot to get more flavor. The service was somewhat disorganized both times I was there. Even though they weren't crowded It was hard to get the attention of the waiter. My friends didn't like it as much as I did. They felt the food in the Indian restaurants on Devon Avenue in Chicago is better. It may be that Himalayan food is not as heavily spiced as Indian food. I will definitely come back. I thought the prices were reasonable. Street parking is plentiful, they deliver and they are open until 10:00 p,m. which is pretty late in this neck of the woods. I will just come with different friends next time.

38.description: This place was pretty solid. I got the chicken tandoori and thought it was cooked well and tasted good, pretty flavorful. The nan was great, really loved it. My gf liked her chicken skewers even though they weren't traditional skewers. The gulab juman dessert was also pretty tasty. The only issue we had was no side or complimentary food like rice or anything coming with the meal. Especially for the price, we figured there'd be a little something to go with the chicken. Not a bad place to check out though.

51.description: omg there food is yummy!! mango lassi is so delicious and refreshing. tandoori chicken is really good. everything Iv tried so far is good. naan & lamb curry really delicious.iv gotten delivery on a weekly basis..only thing i can complain about is small portion size

27.description: Himshikar please don't change a thing. You are perfect in every way. Your curries are spicy, samosas are flavorful, pakoras are crunchy, and naan are perfect. Your food fills my soul. Thank you! Also, must try their chai tea, perfect

32.description: Leave plenty of time for delivery.  They are super nice and the food is damn good.  The mango sauced app is outstanding - a must get.

54.description: Chicken Tikka Masala was really good, I asked for it spicy and it was.....perfectly spiced. The Garlic Naan was also really good. We have been going to pick up Indian further east on Devon Ave, but this place is so much closer and just as good!Looking forward to trying the chicken MoMo next time we order.

48.description: Fantastic!The food is just delicious. Every time we've visited, each dish has been simply delicious. The soups are super tasty. The raita is fresh flavorful. As for the entrees, the tikka masala is by far the best, but try the korma and any of the veggie dishes are also worth it.The staff are super friendly, and more than happy to explain a dish. The atmosphere isn't fancy, but it kinda adds to the experience.So if you're looking for some Indian food, or want to try some Nepalese, this is the place to visit

44.description: loved the samosas...otherwise the rest of the food had way too much creme in it...not enough substance. Will come back for samosas though.

24.description: I clearly mentioned to send plates and spoons, and when the order came, there was none of these. I called the restaurant to inform them, instead of acknowledging it, they said I should explicitly mention the plates and spoons. When I told them I did, all i was asked was...Do you want to return the food? No apologies or a sight of better service.In addition, the food was not worth the money

7.description: I clearly mentioned to send plates and spoons, and when the order came, there was none of these. I called the restaurant to inform them, instead of acknowledging it, they said I should explicitly mention the plates and spoons. When I told them I did, all i was asked was...Do you want to return the food? No apologies or a sight of better service.In addition, the food was not worth the money

49.description: They messed up my order and got me one type of paneer instead of the one I wanted, but after calling them the next day, they credited the money to my account and I was happy. It was an honest, simple mistake, but a drag because I really wanted Palak Paneer. General thoughts: The food I received was good, but the portions were a little small for the price in MY opinion. I hope this helps.

40.description: Just ate here for the first time today even though I have passed it several times as it is in my vicinity.  I am so sad it took me so long to go here!! All of our food was absolutely fantastic!  The paneer and chicken makhani was the best I have tasted so far (and I am not new to Indian food.) It was smooth, buttery, warm and so tasty.  I also had the chicken tikka masala, which again, was delectable.  We had a bowl of tomato soup, which I generally do not like but I loved here.  The staff was attentive and sweet, definitely made us feel very welcome.  We will be back (as well as ordering in!)

53.description: I've ordered delivery over the internet from Himshikar 6 times in the last 2 months.  I really enjoy the Matar Aloo Samosa and Tandoori Chicken.Today the delivery driver calls to tell me he is downstairs and would like for me to come to his car.  There is plenty of parking, so I'm confused and ask him if the call box is broken.  He tells me that he doesn't know, so I encourage him to try it.  He asks me what the number is next to my name, I explain that I don't know but my name is definitely there.  The driver then starts to chide me for not knowing the number.  The driver then stuffs his phone into his pocket without ending the call or saying anything.  I buzz him in and he waited by the entrance for me.  He hands me the bag and 2 things are obvious: 1 My food is cold.  2. A sauce has broken open and spilled in the bag.As I call the restaurant I notice the lack of citrus in the Tandoori Chicken.I attempt to speak to the manager, but unfortunately they don't understand me.  They've asked me to call back tomorrow.

30.description: I should be ashamed by how often I order from here. Let's be honest, how many momos does one need to eat in one sitting? In my case,  A LOT! Ever since friends introduced my husband and I to this jewel a year ago, we have not gotten Nepalese or Indian food from any other restaurant in Chicago- that's how good Himshikar is!If you've never had Himalayan/ Nepalese food before, it is similar to Indian food with many curries, vegetarian, and spicy dishes (don't worry, you can request to adjust the spice level to your taste), but there are differences that make the cuisine uniquely Himalayan. I highly recommend the veggie momos. They are similar to pot stickers, but a bit thicker and tastier. I adore all of their spinach dishes and haven't had a curry dish I didn't like yet. The tikka masala is phenomenal- I could practically drink the sauce by itself. Garlic naan is the way to go, but the traditional naan is fantastic, too.  Portion sizes are perfect, ample to share with a friend, but also good for dining solo and having leftovers for later. The restaurant itself is not a looker, but who cares when the food is so good?! In my travels,  the most humble- looking restaurants have served some of my most memorable meals. What the restaurant lacks in decor is made up  by the excellent service. The owner himself is often our waiter and is always quick to refill our tea and see how we're doing.  Delivery service is speedy in my neighborhood (near Albany Park). I typically receive my food well within an hour and it's always piping hot. Unlike other reviews, I've never experienced any issues with freshness or upset stomachs and I've eaten here almost monthly for the past year. I am lactose-intolerant, so I just pop a Lactaid (as I do any time I eat dairy-filled dishes) before indulging  and am totally fine. Also, I wonder if the other reviewers were expecting Indian food. This is a Nepalese restaurant, so while the cuisines are similar, there are differences, which is part of what makes Himshikar so special. Overall, Himshikar is worth every bit of 5 stars. The food is delicious, the service is personal, and the variety is ample. You won't be disappointed!

46.description: I have ordered delivery 3 times and every time, the food arrives early and still hot!  The naan is warm, fluffy, and delicious! I always order the momo, masala, and samoas. I'm sure all of the food is good, but these are so fantastic, I can't bring myself to try anything else.  If you like spicy, the "hot" is exceptional!  If you're in the mood for really good food, this is your stop!

1.description: Disappointed this place doesn't turn out delicious food.  We really wanted a close place to grab Indian, but we will never come back here. Food = greasy & not good flavor.  I got a vegetarian dish, my husband had chicken & both were grossAmbiance = none.  Which is fine if you're getting takeout but I seriously question the cleanliness after watching & waiting for our food. Being close enough to Devon, there's no reason to compromise.  Don't waste your money.

55.description: This is one of those humble, family run places with excellent food. It warms your tummy and your heart!

9.description: Everything we had was good -  the  only improvement I would suggest is more flavor in the veggie samosas.  We had the chicken tikka masala, veggie samosas, naan, and jhaney ko dal.  I know people complain about the serving sizes - I didn't have a problem with the sizes- they are comparable to other Indian restaurants in the area.

26.description: They deliver far! Which is good bc it's better than any Indian restaurant on Devon except Udupi Palace. They make all the classics but we feel the food is fresher and more home cooked tasting than most Indian restaurants...even thought this is a Nepali resto.

25.description: Hinshikar's food is excellent as was their delivery. It was prompt and the hot food was hot and the cold items were kept cold by being packed in ice. I love the flavors of Indian food but the super spice not so much. They provided everything in mild form and every bite delicious. The Mango Lassi and Pistachios Kulfi were particularly nice.Here's a heads up though - be precise in your order as some dishes serve two purposes as appetizer and entree.  I wasn't specific and ended up with more food than I needed and a check larger than expected.I waited 48 hours to be sure I didn't experience the digestive problems that were brought up in a couple of negative reviews.  I am fine!

12.description: While looking for something slightly different, but with an Indian flare to it still, I stumbled upon Himshikar Restaurant. Oh was this a great discovery. The shrimp til tinka reminded me of Japanese yakitori: plump shrimp skewered on wooden sticks. The aloo makhani is addictive. And having ordered it spicy, it was outstanding.The restaurant was relatively empty since I went just as the doors opened for business. I got to chat with the owners and since both were photographers, there was a kindred spirit that made the visit even more worthwhile. Great food and fantastic service make for a great combination and a reason for repeat visits.

59.description: Huge fan of this restaurant! What a pleasant surprise to find excellent Indian/Nepalese food in the area, and an even more pleasant surprise to find that they deliver (warning -- it did take over an hour to arrive).I don't know if it was a jedi mind trick from intense hunger after the long wait or what, but the shrimp til tinka just about killed me with deliciousness.Highlights were the chicken jalfrezi and the lamb vindaloo. Spice level was right on, flavor was fantastic! We could have used some more rice, but that's ok. Garlic na'an was to die for -- the night of and with leftovers the next day. The only miss was the chicken makhani, and that wasn't even so much a miss as it just wasn't as amazingly delicious as the other dishes.I can't wait to order again. And again.

21.description: This is a hidden gem and if you enjoy authentic Indian food, then this is great little place out of the way. We have always done takeout and noticed the restaurant is BYOB and very basic inside (no frills). The food itself is fantastic and authentic with clay oven Naan breads and when ordering online you can choose your spice level (hot means hot here) - Love it!!

17.description: Food is good (I always order butter chicken, & chicken biryani)  & Im glad it's close to home & they deliver. I've done delivery & carryout. Delivery is adequate, but waiting 35-40 min for carryout???? I might as well have done delivery.... At the moment, I'm preggers & factored in my lack of patience.... So, at least the food I ordered tastes good.

10.description: Delivered on time, driver was friendly.Ordered chicken tikka masala and chicken dumplings. Very delicious and flavorful.But the portion is very very small. Rice and chicken for 10.99$. I expected a little bit more.....maybe I'm too spoiled by other restaurants generous portion

5.description: So disappointed.  I've never seen such small portions. We got delivery, Chicken Biryani, Chicken Masala, Momo app, Paratha.  $44 for barely enough food for 2 people, and no leftovers.  The containers were 1 cup of rice and 1.5 cups of the main dish. Typical "chinese take out" containers are 2 cups each, which is why most people have leftovers from their 4-cup entree.  So $10.99 for an entree that is nearly half the size of the average restaurant, is more than disappointing, I feel like I got swindled.

3.description: Solid 2.5 for serving tasty food in a grimy place.Momo?  More like No NO!   A message I wouldn't yet transcribe, well until about:  (Note:  The following review was written solely from atop of a toilet, in the early morning hours of night.  This is what transpired some hours after eating dinner at Himshikar resturant)1:55 a.m When the notion to drop potions from my rectum was received.  The yearning woke me up out of sleep!2:14 a.m. And it still hurt...  Doesn't matter how many games of Bubble Witch 2 I play..  The worst part was, 1) I ran out of turns aaaAarGh!  And 2) that my lady happened to stop by (Himshikar) whilst I was there randomly grabbing takeout.  In the moment I figured.. Ok,  why not break her into Indian food this way.. (Never "break" anyone into a cuisine with unknown parameters) I feared that decision, hoping her stomach had faired better.  (And it did, she only sampled an appetizer and some bread, THANK GOODNESS)2:17 a.m.  Eyes were heavy and my small butt hurt from sitting there so long.  Contemplated whether a padded seat would be nice to have for my throne.  Thinking a soft blue, nude or taupe could do? But soft seats IMO are kind of tacky. Which reminds me of that Reddit posting from a dude talking about, never knowing that Men could use the toilet seat. (WHAT?!?) I know right? You're like What-TF is Jacob talking about? Yeah, this dude had an online posting about this.. He used to sit on the toilet rim and has been doing that his his whole life!  And he's American!  The shit (hehe) is mind boggling.  Who raised this guy & how'd they forget that important detail?  I know what some of you "dirties" are thinking... Weren't there big splashes!  You can Google for the thread.. Others wondered the same.  LoL.2:23 a.m.  The pain had subsided, time to mosey on back to bed,  but should I take some Immodium? Or wing it?Well, since I was writing this review from the can you'll find out in real time,  what exactly happened.  So hold on Bat fans...  2:40 a.m.. Sleep had left me.  Pooper scooper..  Time to pretend I'm sleeping or read? Never again would I venture for Nepalese, unless I'm visiting Nepal!2:47 a.m....  Why does it still hurt???The restaurant could be cleaner and from my point of view, many of the visible areas of the restaurant were unclean.  (Including and not limited to, their attire)  I wondered how clean the kitchen and their cooking practices could be.  The appetizers were soiled in oil.  And although the entrees; some kind of butter chicken and a lamb dish were tasty, later on that same night I was sick as a dog.All I hoped for was a decent Indian meal at a place off Devon ave.  I'm too afraid to try again.  Diarrhea with the sweats are the worst!

35.description: Here is a place that is both unusual and familiar. It's pretty rare to find a Himalayan/Nepalese restaurant; I've seen maybe three or four in my life. But then again, it's not SO DIFFERENT from a Mom and Pop Indian restaurant, so there's nothing to really worry about -- you'll find a lot of the standard favorites. However... don't stop there. It's really worth exploring the menu. I'd start with their dumplings called Momos. They have a vegetarian version too and they're delicious; a little bit spicy; and a perfect way to start the meal. Also there are multiple types of bread, including Him's Bread which is far from commonly found as it contains raisins. I order that and Garlic Naan and usually take about half of each order home with me as it reheats well.This place doesn't skimp on quality. They use mahi mahi for the fish and don't even bother saying that on the menu. It's this kind of attitude of honesty and integrity that makes it always a pleasure to meet the people who run this restaurant. They are so kind. Perhaps some Americans are not accustomed to the quiet reserve of their demeanor. They are genuine and helpful, always ready to make the customer happy. I've been here many times and it seems the patrons are hardly ever new customers; but when I bring new people with me, they always remark about how much they like it. Another thing I like about this place is that even if you order the "standard Indian food" you may be surprised that it's spiced a little mellower, or with slightly different touches, due to the different geography/ethnicity. It's "their" version of that dish. So the variation is like hearing a live version of a song you already know the regular recording. It's almost the same, but different, and that makes you appreciate both.It's BYOB so there's savings there. They have excellent chai tea and an array of cans of soft drinks. Don't expect some vast variety of foreign soda pop.Sure this place could be fancier. But that's not what they're all about. I think they have been in business a couple years now and seem to be getting better and better with handling customer demands. It's one of those places where you know they are building the American dream. And that feels good to be a part of it.

19.description: Delivery was quick. Curries were ok and the chicken pakora was rubbery. Portions were tiny for the price.

28.description: I always over order, and attempt to eat everything I get from this place...because their food is AWESOME. Vegetarians and meat eaters alike have tons of choices to choose from. Also when if you like spice but not a lot of it, they have always gotten my order at the exact spicyness (or lack of spice) that I have asked for.

45.description: Ordered pickup from here twice.  Both times the meal was more than lacking.  I order butter chicken and there were small bones in it, plus the sauce was not good at all.  My wife got a veggie dish and there were still stickers on the veggies, so you know they do not wash them.  I tried my wife's meal in our second attempt to eat at this place, it was the worst Indian food I have ever eaten.  Finally, both time I picked up from this place it took like 20 minutes to complete the transaction.  First, nobody was out in front for me to pay, even though my food was in the restaurant area and not in back.  Second the guy had real trouble running the credit card machine.  We really wanted to like this place because we have no other Indian restaurants in the area, but we would rather make the hike east on Devon and pick up better food.

33.description: Forget it!Food was not made from good quality fresh ingredients. And some dishes tasted like yesterday's food reheated & somewhat like  cafeteria quality. We ate a few fork fulls of asst dishes and gave up. It was THAT bad.I honestly don't understand the number of people who thought this place to be "good".There is a reason why this place isn't written up or recommended in any reliable dining publication(Yelp doesn't count).Take yourself to Devon Ave.Better yet, and If distance isn't a factor, try; India House on Grand. Or Indian Garden on Ontario.There is also Mt Everest in Evanston.

43.description: Very good Indian food for the neighborhood.  We love Indian food and this place passed the test.  Delivery is pretty quick and the food fresh. It won't disappoint you.

2.description: Food was great! We had chicken and lamb. The atmosphere and service is a bit strange. Portions are on the smaller side for the price.

18.description: Unlike some other reviewers, I thought portion size was reasonable for the price - e.g. $10 for a standard sized butter chicken - and the taste was as good as higher priced venues in the loop.  The only complaint might be that the staff hangs out in the kitchen leaving the front unattended for long stretches.

41.description: Great little Indian-Nepalese restaurant I found on Cicero...Quick delivery and the food as good as any Indian place I have tried....

52.description: I order delivery (via GrubHub) from this place every couple of months. While the food is excellent (the best chicken tikka masala I've ever tasted!), I took a star off for the delivery. I've come to expect it to be very very late because it always is. There's only so many times that the driver can get pulled over/get lost.Also, they're a bit skimpy on the rice, so if you're like me and like a lot of rice with your entree and/or are sharing with another person, order an extra side of it.

50.description: As of writing this review, I am having seriously upset stomach. Made several trips to restroom. NO KIDDING.I wasn't expecting so much of negligence in their food. I ordered food for a group of 10 people and what a disaster it has turned. Chicken Chili was bland and with no chillies at all. It seemed like they boiled chicken and mixed it with bell peppers only.Fried mo:mo was below average. It seems that mo:mo was frozen for weeks and they just thawed it and fried.Chhyoela was meh. I don't know if they thought that it is fair enough to prepare the food the with sub standard and deliver it to customers.We just wanted to have our guests try some nepali food and Himshikar gave a bad taste to us and our guests.If you want to try some nepali food and this is the restaurant you are planning to visit, I would suggest you to change your mind. There are many great Nepali restaurants in town but this is not the one.

4.description: Chicken biryani medium spicy and Palak Mushroom with Bharatuta and Nana with Matar paneer for winter time is the best.

6.description: Ordered from grubhub took about an hour. the reviews looked great so we gave it a shot. Keema Samosa, Chicken Samosa, Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Keema Curry, Tandoori Chicken. I was pleasantly surprised. Everything was amazingly fresh! High quality ingredients. Delicious. I can't think of one negative thing to say. Tasted like its a higher end restaurant, I'm looking forward to eating at the restaurant next time.

22.description: Nice place in area where u least expect. whole foods is just across the street. we wanted to have some indian style snacks so tried this option.Nice masala tea with lot of cream :). We tried momos vegetarian option and it was good. Diping sauce was different but nice. Samosa platter was missing salt spicei it.Overall nice experience for the stuff I was looking for.Next time if i get chance i will try some curries also.

15.description: Very glad I finally discovered this place near my home. Very cordial service and "dee-lish" food. Had incredible naan (cut into nice serving size pieces rather than tearing up the stuff), rice and chicken tikka and shrimp tandoori. Next time I will order spicy/hot, rather than medium. Bring it! Great BYOB, easy parking, convenient location just off Peterson/Caldwell Edens exit.

57.description: What a find! Located this little gem on a Sunday afternoon on the hunt for a good lunch stop. It didn't disappoint. Despite its non-descript exterior, we were greeted by friendly owners and cheery decor. Service was impeccable - water topped constantly, and checking in to make sure we were okay. And the food!! Chicken Tikka Masala was as creamy, rich and delicious as it comes. Chicken Vindaloo also was incredible. Loved the naan bread. Also very reasonable entrees - I don't think anyone spent more than $9, though the price would have gone up slightly at dinnertime. And we noted happily for a future visit that they allow BYO for wine.Probably the best indication of the kind of place this is was at the end. We were celebrating a birthday and brought in some cupcakes - and the owner noticed, he came out to sing with our party and then came back with brought a small plate with mango ice cream scoops on it - one for each of the four of us. At no charge! I love this place!

20.description: Just received food and very dissatisfied.Naan was burnt and food lacked flavor. Simosas were dry, and chicken tikki masala was so bland. Also got baigan bharta and it was mostly all onions. Yelp(eat24) had great customer service though and was able to refund my naan with ease.

36.description: Solid 2.5 for serving tasty food in a grimy place.Momo?  More like No NO!   A message I wouldn't yet transcribe, well until about:  (Note:  The following review was written solely from atop of a toilet, in the early morning hours of night.  This is what transpired some hours after eating dinner at Himshikar resturant)1:55 a.m When the notion to drop potions from my rectum was received.  The yearning woke me up out of sleep!2:14 a.m. And it still hurt...  Doesn't matter how many games of Bubble Witch 2 I play..  The worst part was, 1) I ran out of turns aaaAarGh!  And 2) that my lady happened to stop by (Himshikar) whilst I was there randomly grabbing takeout.  In the moment I figured.. Ok,  why not break her into Indian food this way.. (Never "break" anyone into a cuisine with unknown parameters) I feared that decision, hoping her stomach had faired better.  (And it did, she only sampled an appetizer and some bread, THANK GOODNESS)2:17 a.m.  Eyes were heavy and my small butt hurt from sitting there so long.  Contemplated whether a padded seat would be nice to have for my throne.  Thinking a soft blue, nude or taupe could do? But soft seats IMO are kind of tacky. Which reminds me of that Reddit posting from a dude talking about, never knowing that Men could use the toilet seat. (WHAT?!?) I know right? You're like What-TF is Jacob talking about? Yeah, this dude had an online posting about this.. He used to sit on the toilet rim and has been doing that his his whole life!  And he's American!  The shit (hehe) is mind boggling.  Who raised this guy & how'd they forget that important detail?  I know what some of you "dirties" are thinking... Weren't there big splashes!  You can Google for the thread.. Others wondered the same.  LoL.2:23 a.m.  The pain had subsided, time to mosey on back to bed,  but should I take some Immodium? Or wing it?Well, since I was writing this review from the can you'll find out in real time,  what exactly happened.  So hold on Bat fans...  2:40 a.m.. Sleep had left me.  Pooper scooper..  Time to pretend I'm sleeping or read? Never again would I venture for Nepalese, unless I'm visiting Nepal!2:47 a.m....  Why does it still hurt???The restaurant could be cleaner and from my point of view, many of the visible areas of the restaurant were unclean.  (Including and not limited to, their attire)  I wondered how clean the kitchen and their cooking practices could be.  The appetizers were soiled in oil.  And although the entrees; some kind of butter chicken and a lamb dish were tasty, later on that same night I was sick as a dog.All I hoped for was a decent Indian meal at a place off Devon ave.  I'm too afraid to try again.  Diarrhea with the sweats are the worst!

14.description: This is the best Indian Restaurant in the whole CHICAGO-LAND area! Chicken Tikka Masala EXTRA HOT is divine. The Garlic Naan dipped in the sauce is heavenly. The chicken quality and quantity is appropriate. When I used GrubHub for my fix, they always delivered timely and the food is wrapped in foil which keeps it fresh and warm. The inside of the restaurant is clean and fresh although I only pick up from here.  Now that I do not live in Chicago I commute 2 hours just to pick it up. It's well worth it!

12.description: Terrible customer service and charged me separately for the two items in a combo. I tried to explain my point but he just made up some irrelevant argument. That's the last of that location for me.

3.description: Not only were the employees extremely rude  (I'm looking at you, Helena), but my wife and I received the oddest looking bacon on our sandwiches we have ever seen.  It is unnaturally red and it looks more like BEGGIN STRIPS dog treats than real meat.  (See photo!) We took it off and refused to eat it.  The most disappointing Dunkin experience we have ever had. If I could give 1 star, I would!

1.description: This place has horrible service and they charge you 4 dollars for almond milk !!! Don't go here!

2.description: I worked here but then I quit because the manager (Mary) told me she would kill me...

9.description: So my friend and I decided to go to this Dunkin Donuts because they were empty when we arrived and they recently added free wi-fi. We arrived at 10PM and ordered food and began to study. Then randomly at 1AM the worker told us that he wanted to mop. My friend and I politely told him we were more than willing to move, or to take our bookbags off the floor, but he essentially told us to leave. That is not fair because we are paying customers and we just got kicked out for doing nothing but minding our own business. I would like to put on the record that the store was EMPTY and it was only us there. This is the last time I go to this Dunkin Donuts. Now because this is Yelp, I would like to give my opinion about the food. It's pretty much your standard Dunkin Donuts fare, and at 10PM their donut selection was rather limited and starting to turn stale, as you would expect at that hour. Their coffee is not up to par, and I prefer the coffee at other Dunkin Donuts locations to be honest. The only nice thing about this place is that this location is 24/7 and the addition of free wi-fi.

10.description: Went in on a Tuesday morning. Parking lot and store was PACKED and I swore I wouldn't be outta there in less than 15 minutes. I was wrong. I was in and out in like 4 minutes and I ordered a Mocha Latte. Nice people too so cant complain!

4.description: If I can give this place 0 stars, I would! The young lady that worked the night shift was extremely rude. She was slamming the fridge doors while getting ice cream, disrespectful and rude to one of the customers ahead of me, and had a very nasty attitude. After she made my iced coffee, which tasted watered down, she slammed the cup on the counter! I will not be visiting this location again.

6.description: I went here a few times in the morning. I will never be back. I told them my order, they asked if I wanted to upgrade. No thanks, I said. They asked if I wanted 50 munchkins instead of 25. No thanks. Again they asked if I wanted an extra large coffee instead. NO. How about a large coffee, they then asked. NO!!! How about you just give me what I freakin ordered?! Too much of a headache for me.

0.description: Yeah, I know, they're pretty much everywhere here in Chicago but we don't have them in California so I was sooooo excited to see these. I still hear the jingle from my childhood in my head...Never had the French Crueller before and this was sooooo good!The Chocolate donuts were as good as I remember them!I totally forgot the strawberry. Next time!!!!

5.description: Nasty. Im literally in my car outside this place now. I didnt eat inside because they killed my appetite. The lady did not use any gloves when putting cream cheese on my bagel. I never look at how they do it, but today I wad looking at her and she just grabbed my bagel with her bare hands. I asked her Do you not use gloves? She said yes we do but I didnt this time. Are you kidding me? Whats that mean? Thats disgusting. I told her I dont want it anymore and she made new one with gloves. Never again at this branch.

13.description: will never go here again,the man with the glasses that worked the night shift would not take my 5 dollar bill for hot chocolate because a corner was missing,c'mon are you serious? and on top of that he gave me that look like he was better than me for even offering him that bill,i guess business is that good for you to refuse currency.

11.description: This is an odd branch and this review is based upon nighttime visits for ice cream.  Not sure how they do things during the morning or how the doughnuts are, but here it goes:The ice cream does not seem to be cared for properly and they have pretty crappy presentation.  Last time I was there, it looked like they let the ice cream melt a little bit then froze it back up again as there were flavor drippings all along the sides of the cartons.  We opted for a take home pint that day.This location is often populated with weird old dudes.  Seriously, there were about 10 of them.  They were just hanging out and drinking coffee.  Kind of weirded us out - enough to opt not to eat there.  If you are looking for a quick pint of good ice cream to take home - this place will get the job done.   But don't hang out here unless you enjoy the company of weird old guys.

8.description: It's like a merry go round here.  There are good parts to the ride and then there are it's bad.Morning service is speedy, it's still manned with enough counter associates to get you on your way, quickly.  For this a solid three or three and a half stars is perfect but there are times when the night guy just tries my patience with the worst customer service.  It really comes down to, are you willing to sacrifice service you should receive for half ass service.Late night is slow and mainly because it's the same one dude that works  solo.  Well, not really solo as he's usually got a blue-tooth in his ear and always on.  I wonder sometimes if comedy movies have it right and if this dude is also working a customer service job via his cell phone.  He doesn't speak English into it and I don't think India would outsource those jobs here, so who knows.  This review update is about this dude.  Some Baskin Robbins locations, especially these duo locations tend to have employees that try to discourage you from using corporate sponsored coupons.  They use their remedial English skills to make you think they don't accept them.  Take the other night for instance I am in with a Bo-Go coupon for sundaes.    I just printed it and brought it over.  This dude incessantly raked over the e-mail trying to find any reason to discredit it.  WTF?  He told me a couple times, this is not for this location when it clearly shows a future expire date and that it does work at ALL locations.  He also tried to tell me that it expired the day I brought it in, I showed him that was in fact "todays date" the date the email was printed.In the end, he didn't do as the coupon asked and I was overcharged.  What to do... complaining to corporate about this dude doesn't seem to do anything.  I'm saving myself future headaches and hitting another location.  In the end most of them are probably owned by the same family and there are so many locations, they all can't be the same?

14.description: Open 24 hours. Ahhhh. Hooray for being a fatty at all hours of the night. Honestly this is just an average Dunkin Donuts and Baskin Robbins with a really sweet dude that works the overnight shift. What I need to shine in the spotlight on here is their TIRIMISU ice cream. It's y new favorite ever and it's only found at Baskin Robbins and not hardly any of them either except this one from my experience. TRY IT! You'll like it.

7.description: I usually dont review chains, but this local one right by my residence deserves some support from a local. Now I love me some coffee early in the morning, more particularly in the fall/winter season. And they never get my orders wrong, hell sometimes they know what Im going to ask for right when I walk in the door! Service is always super quick, to the point, and accurate every time. French Vanilla black, reduced fat blueberry muffin. How I start my mornings when runnin on Dunkin'. =D

28.description: I worked in the area for about a year and went here a couple times a week for lunch. It's a really solid lunch spot. Fast, affordable, tasty. You can't go wrong with pretty much anything on the menu, but I usually got the grilled chicken sandwich on a pita with hot peppers. Seriously amazing stuff.It can get crowded around lunch time but if you come around 1:30 or so you should be able to get a table.

1.description: It's a standard burger-gyros joint.  Food was good but priced on the high side for what it is.

9.description: The only thing I look forward to when the season changes is the daily soup selection at Eden's. Everything on the menu is delicious from a hangover cure breakfast to just about the best fries in the city. Large portions and extremely friendly staff, don't pass this place up!

29.description: East of Edens is much better and right down the road. If you are in the area, go to east of Edens. It is a step up from Eden's.

23.description: Ok, this place, awesome. I am going to overlook the fact that they serve everything on plastic... yes plastic. Yet I'm still giving them 5 stars. They gotta be doing something right, don't you think???My mom and I came in for some breakfast. Skirt steak and 3 eggs, hash brown and toast for $11.25. Ordered one of those, coffee and an orange juice. OJ is bottled. My mom loved the coffee (she's super picky). $16 for both of us, not bad.Now on to the food. So glad I ordered one for us to split because there is NO WAY either of us could have eaten that whole plate. The steak was cooked to perfection, medium rare. Potatoes were nicely cooked and eggs over easy just like we like them. I honestly didn't expect such great food. The rest of the menu is very reasonably priced and I look forward to heading back to try something else. Or for another steak and eggs breakfast!!!!

5.description: This place is amazing, just had fried fish sandwich it was delicious. Service is great here and friendly people, parking, everything is fresh. Plus they have amazing breakfast wow!!!

31.description: I work like a block away from this fabulous greasy spoon, so its safe to say that I'm well aquainted with the staff and the food. I feel like I  have a special relationship with their cheese fries, but I dont wanna make the burgers jealous. So shush!  They also make AWESOME breakfast! Their sausage links are huge and juicy and for like $5 you get a delicious medley of eggs, sausage (or bacon), toast and hashbrowns. Now thats a deal! They have a pretty extensive menu aside from the traditional hot dogs and burgers. Their marinated chicken breast is the JAM,  and their gyros and italian beef are not far behind. They also have cold sandwiches and salads, but if you're eating at a greasy spoon I don't think you are here for a salad. The staff is always friendly. Its nice to go to a place where they always remember your name and in my case, my order!Edens is a great little place for breakfast, lunch or dinner; so if you are ever in the neighborhood be sure to check it out.

25.description: IT IS THE KIND OF PLACE THAT I COULD ALMOST AFFORD TO EAT AT EVERY DAY. GUS IS GREAT, I'm not sure if he is an owner or just a cook. Either way, he is a very nice and hardworking guy, who appreciates his customers. I'VE GIVEN THEM A LOT OF BUSINESS because THEIR PORTIONS ARE BIG AND THEIR PRICES ARE REALLY GOOD, your order is ready quickly,  and I like their staff.  I've had just about everything on the menu and my ratings for the food vary. Some items, like their grilled chicken and chicken kabobs, are VERY BIG AND VERY GOOD.  I also like their side of rice pilaf.  Their fish and chips however, are just frozen fish fillets.Their breakfast prices can't be beat.   They obviously focus on portions and prices, so I'm rating them based on that. It's basically a fast food restaurant that's a few steps above your Wendy's and more than a few steps above McDonald's.

12.description: The food varies in quality from acceptable to great. Their onliene menu is wildly outdated on its prices, which severely hampered my most recent visit. $9 for three pieces of fish for a fish n chips order is bullocks.

37.description: I work not far from Eden's, so I came here for the first time with a couple people who already went here for lunch before. The place is almost across the street from the Sauganash area Whole Foods on Cicero. Based on the seemingly endless stream of people coming, looks like a great lunch spot. In the 30 minutes we were there, I saw maybe 15-20 school kids, suit & tie types, and even construction workers with orange vests stop in for food. Eden's has a really small eat-in area consisting of 4 booths and 3 tables in the middle, but it also has an outdoor seating area for nice days. The interior is very clean, the menu board looks new, well-structured and easy to follow. Eden's offers breakfast, lunch and dinner selections.While I chose the half-pound cheeseburger, both my colleagues chose the gyros. From the look of their platters, I should have done the same. My burger was awesome too, don't get me wrong. Even the edges of the patty were seared crisp to my liking. The burger was larger than the bun, and it was loaded with lettuce, tomatoes and pickles. No disappointment at all, but the gyros just looked so hot and fresh that I should have ordered it instead. The food came quickly too. Seemed the gyros only took 2-3 minutes from the time we ordered. My burger took a little longer but very reasonable wait time. They are well-staffed and the orders just keep coming.I will definitely make this a regular lunch place in lieu of Backyard Grill on Devon, since service here is so much better and it's not as expensive.

21.description: Went with my husband and two toddlers using our Groupon - hadn't been there before, even though we live in the neighborhood.  We were the only ones in there (was a cold rainy day).  The guy working there was friendly.  Food was decent - my husband had gyros and I had chicken gyros.  Fries weren't my favorite, but were okay.  As we were leaving, the guy offered my two kids some ice cream on the house to go (I'm assuming since things were so slow) which was really sweet of him and the kids were very excited about.  We'll be back :)

16.description: I am a disappointed regular and will never go back again. I saw old man owner at outside rear door on a smoking break when I was parking my car.  Once inside, I was standing at the counter ordering my food.  The woman owner cashier turned around and asked the newly entered old man owner to make my milk shake.  The disgusting old man didn't even wash his hands after coming in from his smoke break.  Food was good and service was good.  And yet, what I experienced is unforgivable and reflects badly on the restaurant.  Only they know what other bad habits this guy has.

17.description: Ok, this place, awesome. I am going to overlook the fact that they serve everything on plastic... yes plastic. Yet I'm still giving them 5 stars. They gotta be doing something right, don't you think???My mom and I came in for some breakfast. Skirt steak and 3 eggs, hash brown and toast for $11.25. Ordered one of those, coffee and an orange juice. OJ is bottled. My mom loved the coffee (she's super picky). $16 for both of us, not bad.Now on to the food. So glad I ordered one for us to split because there is NO WAY either of us could have eaten that whole plate. The steak was cooked to perfection, medium rare. Potatoes were nicely cooked and eggs over easy just like we like them. I honestly didn't expect such great food. The rest of the menu is very reasonably priced and I look forward to heading back to try something else. Or for another steak and eggs breakfast!!!!

10.description: I have to say their food at Eden's is delicious. We had the chicken breast plate that was  outstanding. The staff is amazing and so nice. Their fries are crisp and yummy. No greasy fries here. Clean oil definitely. If you want delicious food and great people to talk to go there. Next time I'm getting their soup with my meal. It smelled stupendous. I can't wait to go back.

11.description: Friendly, great service, great food and fast! Gyro plate and burgers are the main items I get along with the homemade baklava.This location has better fries and food than the other ones.

26.description: Food is ok here may return again not sure.

27.description: I'm pretty sure I have found my new favorite 'fast food' place that's not a franchise.  The menu here is HUGE!!  The first time I went I had the gyros plate... loved it!  The second time, I had the chicken parmesan sandwich... Yum!  Even the fries are great!  Edens is small with only a few tables, but it's so clean and neat that you can be very comfortable eating there.  I think their only downfall for me is that they are closed on Sundays... bummer.

35.description: You Should: Go If NearbySizzle: Great food, fast.Juice: Get the Chicken Gyros w/extra sauce, the burgers and hot dogs are good too.Check Please: $

8.description: It's a nice, clean, family-owned place.  We wanted to forgo the typical Burger King and Wendy's but needed fast food because my husband had to get to the next call, so we stumbled upon this lovely place.  Food was made to ordered.  I ordered the chicken gyros combo, while my husband ordered the gyros combo.  They were great!  The Greek mom was very nice and personable, and she was also flirting with the police officers!  The atmosphere was very inviting.  I noticed there are several places contained "Eden" in their names, but this one is diagonally across the Whole Food Market.  There seems to be parking on most of restaurants in the Edgebrook neighborhood, so you won't need to struggle finding a spot.

0.description: Had the Greek chicken lunch special. What a find 1/2 a chicken, rice, potato, and soup. Fantastic flavors.

20.description: The best skirt steak sandwich I've ever had in my entire life, thick, juicy, flavorful, very much worth the $11.95 per sandwich. I've had this a couple of times for lunch and ended up not having dinner due to the sandwich being so big.

19.description: I got a Groupon for this place. We got the gyros and chicken gyros-very delicious and huge portions. Also got the pizza puff-probably wouldn't pay full price for that again, but all the food was good.

33.description: I go here for one thing, mainly, and that is their chicken gyros!!! YUM! Something about lamb gyros bothers me mentally, not sure what. I felt I struck gold when I found their chicken gyros! Their fries are great, also! I've heard they do a decent breakfast, one friend of mine likes the strawberry pancakes in particular. They remodeled the place in 08, and it's much cleaner looking and modern. Be careful, it gets packed around lunch hour and hard to find a seat.. Usually after 1pm is when the crowd thins out... Go for the chicken gyros, you'll love it

2.description: Sometimes when I finish my grocery shopping at WFM, I look over and wonder about Eden's.  The place sits there, lonely like, on most days.  Down the street is another gyros joint that usually has cars coming and going.  But Eden's, just sits there, yearning for attention.  On Christmas Eve last year, I decided to grab a quick meal before heading home.  Tons of options in a typical Char restaurant like burgers, dogs, etc Though I opted for a gyros sandwich.  I'd had a pretty decent one in Milwaukee recently and wanted something more "Greek" and Chicago style.The gyros were alright as were the french fries and fried mushrooms.  But these days with many more "fast food" spots offering hand-cut fries, one has to wonder why they don't ditch the frozen kind for the normal kind?  According to a hand written sign, their rice pudding was "homemade."  One has to wonder..  Food was alright, but all stuff I could probably muster from frozen products purchased at a grocery store.When you're too lazy to cook, it's an alright stop.  A single would spend roughly ten dollars or more depending.

34.description: i'm a big fan.  nice staff, good food, chicken sandwich solid, gyros better than east of edens fo shizz, and great shakes.  if they opened for sundays i'd give them 5 stars.

32.description: Mom and I stopped here on a shopping outing today. She had one of the lunch specials ... a bowl of chicken noodle soup and a tuna salad sandwich. Both were pretty good. I had a cheeseburger, fries and a cup of chili. The burger and fries were decent, though I wasn't expecting to get mayo on my burger. The chili, however, was most decidedly from a #10 can. I tossed most of it away.They seem to do a good business there. Lots of people in and out. The prices are decent for what you get. I might stop by some time in the future, but I don't see it as a regular stop.

18.description: i had a realy good lunch  good for all three not sure hours but i do know they open real early and have great breakfast , lunch , and great dinners .

13.description: The best skirt steak sandwich I've ever had in my entire life, thick, juicy, flavorful, very much worth the $11.95 per sandwich. I've had this a couple of times for lunch and ended up not having dinner due to the sandwich being so big.

4.description: The prices on their website and grubhub are misleading. I ordered their grilled chicken on a pita (#6) and was charged $9.15 plus $1 for cheese. I used a coupon for free delivery and my total was $11.22. I didn't think it was fair to take it out on the driver so I still tipped him $3 but I can't get over the fact that I was charged more than the two posted prices. I called in and asked if I was overcharged... I wasn't. The cashier said that they gave me the total when I called in, which they didn't. I'm all for a lunch splurge but $11.22 for a dry chicken breast on a pita, small fries, and a small pepsi is not reasonable. Live and learn.

24.description: I got a Groupon for this place. We got the gyros and chicken gyros-very delicious and huge portions. Also got the pizza puff-probably wouldn't pay full price for that again, but all the food was good.

6.description: Found this place by happenstance, as my wife and I had some time to spare before a wedding at Queen of All Saints. A few quick thoughts:Free parking lot in the rear is a plus. Chicago style hot dog did not disappoint, and it was nice to have a classic since we now reside in the Raleigh area. Fries were crisp.Wife's boneless rib sandwich seemed to be agreeable to her.Other menu options that appealed to me would have been the quarter and half chicken dinners, as well as the gyros.Prices reasonable.Staff friendly.Reminiscent of my undergrad days at DD Dawgs in Evanston.

22.description: Great food, great staff and Gus the owner really takes care of you! Breakfast is the bomb with ham off the bone and huge portions!

15.description: I love this place, especially their breakfast! We ordered potatoes, eggs, pancakes, and skirt steaks. And everything was delicious and I mean everything! It's very hard to find a breakfast place that makes the skirt steak right but this place got the taste and texture right.

7.description: Absolutely love this place.  Fresh food, great service, great location!All the workers are on their game every visit, and my burgers and fries have always been perfect. This place has the freshest soups in Chicago.  You will not be disappointed. Keep it up!

36.description: Exactly what I expected...Greeeeeeeeasy gyros.  Good Fries.  Couple tables outside(need umbrellas, guys!) and they take plastic for payment.

30.description: My stomach is still smiling from my lunch.  The chicken is marinaded in this amazing wonderfulness- and no matter how you order it- it comes juicy and full of flavor.I went with the chicken parm sandwich, and I  could not eat it quick enough.  No joke.  The bread was fresh and soft and I already told you about the chicken...heaven!  The fries were fresh and the staff was friendly.  It is a family owned restaurant- and you can tell.  It is a clean environment.  It's only a little ways a way from my office- and I WILL be returning!

3.description: I called this place about 10 minutes ago not sure who the men was That picked up the phone, I was trying to place an order then he put me on hold to take someone else order and never got back to me, so I called again and he did the same thing put me on hold and never took my order, I called the third time and told the guy u put me on hold 3 times he made up a story how he was on an important call! Really? I will never order from this place again. Go to EAST OF EADENS down the block for better service.

14.description: Yummy greasy spoon. Doesn't try to be more than it is. Staff is friendly and they'll make whatever you want. The breakfast sandwiches are loaded and delicious.

1.description: I come here almost everyday and there customer service haven't been improved. Stop by for a cup of coffee today and they  3 people working and wait time for the coffee is 10 mint or more, better of going to Devon and central they are very nice and fast.

9.description: So I drink my fair share of coffee and have certainly been a many Starbucks! This location I have always found to be quick, and have had great service. In the summer they have outdoor seating, which is there in the winter but not as many seats. They have moved furniture around on the inside a few times but it is cozy and good place to sit and chat in the neighborhood or go and do work if you want a quiet place. The spot itself is in a little lot where parking is free.I live in the neighborhood, so I see the people often and it is nice to have a place that is walking distance and one that I have certainly always had good service and even when I have asked them to do something off menu they were more than happy. In fact most of their staff that have waited on me have been polite and even funny sometimes! They do have great customer service something that I think is very important!

23.description: STAY AWAY FROM THIS STARBUCKS!  This is the WORST Starbucks in the country folks.  If you have hours to kill, want your clothes to reek, feel like driving circles around a strip mall for 30 minutes only to find out you won't be able to exit said strip mall after spending hours TRAPPED in said smelly (in a bad way) Starbucks - sure, venture to the Sauganash Starbucks.  I don't care what time of day I have subjected myself to this place, the service is SO SLOW I could swear that they are literally milking a cow and filtering it to make my non-fat latte.  The place smells HORRIBLE - which is strange b/c most coffee joints smell great - and some of the employees seem to be extremely hard of hearing because they often give me the wrong pastry or forget to give it to me and I have to repeat my order three times (maybe this explains the length of time stuck in this Starbucks and the lack of parking?).  It is nothing but painful and a black eye on the Starbucks chain, and every time I have made the mistake of going here I literally want to punch myself in the eye because I end up missing my train, showing up late for an appointment, missing that chance encounter with now single male model Gabriel Aubry - you get the picture ... Trust me - it is worth driving to another location to avoid this miserable Sbux!  You'll thank me later ...

25.description: My nearest Starbuck's fix is larger than many and has ample indoor seating.  However, its strip mall location is difficult to park in and prevents room for outdoor tables.

12.description: This has to be one of the most unfriendly starbucks that I Have everExperienced. the girls that work in there love to roll their eyes and makeFun of customers. the employees seem to have a low morale and youAre treated like a second class citizen. My wife and I live in SauganashVillage right next door, and literally drive to the Pulaski Lawrence orDevon central store to get our coffee. It is very inconvenient but weAre treated so well by the Managers Angelica and Mark who run suchAn incredible,organized and friendly store. The manager at this shopNamed Brenda seems like she is over it and ready to retire. the drinks,Like the lattes and Americans are always weak in taste and I have hadTo have them remake my drink at least five times. the parking is badAnd they love to stand at the register and grab your gold card...beCareful!,,

21.description: I stop by Sunday mid afternoon and had a good experience. The guy at cashier wasn't the most friendly person. But the barista she totally was so nice & very helpful. I asked about a Pike roast coffee she really nice & so knowledgeable & offer a sample which tasted so good. One thing I would suggest if you coming east down Peterson turn at the light rather than off Peterson. It makes alot easier getting into parking lot since off of Peterson entrance can be very tight. :)

16.description: One of the best Starbucks on the north side of Chicago. Great staff. Friendly and amazing at getting complex orders right. WiFi has reliable speed and doesn't seem to take any performance hits by the number of people logged in. Only thing, remodeled sitting area seems to have shrunken due in part to the communal table in the middle of the area. Otherwise, great place.

17.description: Middle aged white lady who I think is the manager isn't nice. She's mean in fact. Hispanic chubby younger guy with the hipster facial hair actually went off on my for asking for a sugar free drink for my child. Saying 'who would give CHEMICALS' to their child? Glaring at me, huffing and puffing. What? Did he consider my child cannot have sugar for a medical reason?? That we've well researched that the splenda they use in the sugar free drinks (which my child gets like four times a year for a huge treat) metabolizes differently? That is was a big deal to take her for a nice drink when we have to be so careful with diet issues??Who is he to go off like that?We go way out of our way to hit the Starbucks at 6000 N Lincoln to avoid that hot mess. Sad because it's nice to run into people we know there. Raggy manager lady and an underling that doesn't want people to buy starbuck's own products?  Eff that.

10.description: First of all, I'm a complete jackass because I left my wallet here this morning. Get to Milwaukee for Summerfest, go to check in at the hotel--no wallet. Panic mode. Call Starbucks and guess what? There's still good in this world! They had my wallet and it's in a safe until I return. Assuming all is in tact when I go back to get it, these guys deserve some serious good karma! Thank you Starbucks for an iced coffee and keeping my wallet safe! Brenda you're the best!

5.description: Good place for coffee and teas... the only thing make sure they repeat your order because it has been two times where they messed up my order. They need to put more attention and also the girl who took my order has really bad attitude!! Sucks that they dont like their job.

11.description: Great customer service.  Friendly.  Get's the order right.  Based on some of the other reviews we must have stopped in at the right time because we have no complaints.  With the kids who got yummy hot chocolate.  I'm easy.  Coffee, black.  Nothing to complain about.

22.description: This neighborhood Starbucks has been comfy spot to enjoy coffee or tea. Couple of couches to relax and enjoy those premium mochas and frappaccinos.  The staff is always friendly.

0.description: Trust me, the staff here are too nice. You will always get your order right and if you don't, just tell them and they will get right to it. This goes to the staff that works here during the afternoon till closing time as I have never gone their for breakfast. Keep up the good work.

20.description: The people here are top notch! I cannot ask for better baristas, they always get my drink right and in such a short amount of time! Remember to tip your baristas!

19.description: STAY AWAY FROM THIS STARBUCKS!  This is the WORST Starbucks in the country folks.  If you have hours to kill, want your clothes to reek, feel like driving circles around a strip mall for 30 minutes only to find out you won't be able to exit said strip mall after spending hours TRAPPED in said smelly (in a bad way) Starbucks - sure, venture to the Sauganash Starbucks.  I don't care what time of day I have subjected myself to this place, the service is SO SLOW I could swear that they are literally milking a cow and filtering it to make my non-fat latte.  The place smells HORRIBLE - which is strange b/c most coffee joints smell great - and some of the employees seem to be extremely hard of hearing because they often give me the wrong pastry or forget to give it to me and I have to repeat my order three times (maybe this explains the length of time stuck in this Starbucks and the lack of parking?).  It is nothing but painful and a black eye on the Starbucks chain, and every time I have made the mistake of going here I literally want to punch myself in the eye because I end up missing my train, showing up late for an appointment, missing that chance encounter with now single male model Gabriel Aubry - you get the picture ... Trust me - it is worth driving to another location to avoid this miserable Sbux!  You'll thank me later ...

2.description: The plethora of independent coffee shops in Chicago are not evenly or even randomly distributed across the metropolitan area.  Sometimes you just have to go to a national chain.  This Starbucks is usually very busy, the spacing is cramped, the parking lot has almost as much conflict as Colombo street traffic.  A dangerous proportion of automobile drivers in this lot are apparently hunting for bicyclists with homicidal lust. Often the whole store is taken up by a line, it's not a great place to try to get some work done.  But if you've got a coffee jones around here, it's your only port in the proverbial storm.  The workers are skilled and efficient.

18.description: I stop by Sunday mid afternoon and had a good experience. The guy at cashier wasn't the most friendly person. But the barista she totally was so nice & very helpful. I asked about a Pike roast coffee she really nice & so knowledgeable & offer a sample which tasted so good. One thing I would suggest if you coming east down Peterson turn at the light rather than off Peterson. It makes alot easier getting into parking lot since off of Peterson entrance can be very tight. :)

13.description: I love this starbucks! All the employees are fantastic! I highly recommend! I'm going to go there now!

4.description: Great baristas, nice tea selection, but terrible heat. I have been sitting in this Starbucks all day trying to get work done and have seen people hanging out here with their coats on. Unacceptable. The only reason I can't go anywhere else is because my work is time sensitive.

24.description: This Starbucks has wonderful customer service. Generally I only go when an employee named Antony is working because he gets my drinks made the way I want them and he always makes them perfect. I do admit that the parking kind of sucks, but that's why I just walk there!

6.description: I love the employees and location of this Starbucks. They all know my drink and many times its ready before I even order it! Very friendly people. No complaints, only compliments from me!- grande 6 pump chai guy :)

15.description: What can I say? I've been in a Starbucks mood again lately. I just want to reiterate what a great experience I have at this location -especially early mornings. There is rarely a line, staff is friendly and I like that I can pop in and out easily and still get back on Peterson to continue my commute to work.

7.description: This Starbucks is pretty good. Small but I have been in smaller Starbucks before. My only problem that I have for this Starbucks is the parking. It is too small! I was watching my car while sitting in Starbucks when I witness the person next to my car pull out of her parking space and scratched her car with mine when she got out of her spot. The only flaw in this plaza. Other than that horrible experience its a nice place to get your Starbucks.

8.description: The only Starbucks I like to go to honestly. Will is by far the best barista ever. Super nice, always keeping conversation. It gets crowded, but honestly, it's so worth it. I come almost every week to do my work here and I have no complaints.

3.description: The baristas are great and very personable. They know my order and have it ready before I reach the register. The line is always moving quickly and they are very efficient.

14.description: I'm giving one more star because the people who work there are generally friendly. This is the slowest Starbucks on planet earth. I hate coming here but it's on my way home so I usually just come on Sundays when I have time to wait. It's frustrating.

58.description: So I've been coming to Spa Nail City to get my "No Chip" manicure done now for about 2 months.  And, unfortunately, I haven't been able to acheive the same durability with my manicure since my first visit. Meaning - this type of manicure easily runs you $40 & is promoted to last at least 2 weeks.  With the exception of the first visit I haven't been able to get through one week without obvious chipping on my nails and now I am even experiencing the entire nail color peeling of my nail completely on at least one finger within the first week.  It looks terrible.  Not to mention the color selection for the no chip manicure is quite limited at this venue.  And as much as I harp on it to the owners I cannot get them to shape my nails how I like (square).  It always ends up rounded.  I would think I am asking for an impossible shape, however, I have acheived the shape effortlessly from my old nail guys in the burbs.  So I'm deducting two stars from initial 5 star rating.  Now, with that said, the staff here still has OUTSTANDING customer service and EXCELLENT attention to detail.  Their customer service definitely puts them on a different level than any other place hands down.  Its just that the nails I walk out with don't last longer than a week.  Deal breaker. Trust me I am a nail junkie and have had the no chip done at many different places - a square shaped nail with color that last 3 weeks is absoluely possible - just not here for some reason:/

56.description: This place is clean and has consistently good service. The manis and pedis aren't cheap, but I figure if I'm gonna treat myself, I might as well do it right.

29.description: On the recommendation of this site I went out in the pouring rain hoping to find a new nail salon. Went in, explained that I wanted a full fell set. Lynn began to take my polish off (I had the already soaked off my old nails the night before and put temporary polish on myself) I explained that I would like my nails put on flat and not curved.  She gave me an argument that they would not be strong like that and she refused to do them. I explained to her that they would be plenty strong as the acrylic is strong and i had been getting them done that way for 20 years.  She refused to do them and i had to leave there with the polish on one hand half off.   Sooooo if you want to go someplace where the customer's wishes are NOT granted, then this is the place for you.They are only getting one star because I couldn't post this unles I ga e them a star rating.

42.description: I usually go to CnD nails (which has a special on Thursdays for $45 pedicure + no-chip manicure!), which is sort of nearby, but when they couldn't get me in before New Years Eve I decided to try Spa Nail City last Thursday. I wish I'd just left my nails alone and my bank account in tact. I wanted a pedicure and a no-chip manicure. The pedicure was alright while I was there with the exception of the extremely short massage. The no-chip manicure was surprising here - not only did they skip the cuticle care and normal parts of a manicure, they layered the polish on very thinly and I left with what looked like only one coat of nail polish. Although I had chosen the same color for my hands and feet, they don't match at all as the toes are several shades darker due to the thickness.Once I got home, the troubles kept coming. The pedicure was chipped in several places before I even made it to my New Years party. As of yesterday, 7 days after receiving my "NO-CHIP" manicure, it is chipped in two places. I have been getting no-chip manicures every couple weeks for a while now and this has never happened to me before.My grand total for this experience was $75 + tip. I wish I would have just opted for the regular manicure since it's chipped anyway. At least then my cuticles would look nice and I would have gotten a massage out of the deal. Boo.

23.description: I was able to get a walk-in for my mani pedi this morning and this place was absolutely great! Everything was clean and all the staff was polite.Yujin was very gentle with the massage and scrubbing so I loved that (I'm a wimp when it comes to massage). She was also very accommodating with my 3 year old.Angie did my daughter's mani which was absolutely adorable! My daughter picked deep purple nail polish with a white flower on each thumb!I'm definitely coming back here!

47.description: I have gone to spa nail city enough times to almost completely fill the "reward" card.  Pretty good experience up until I got a mani/pedi.the technician did not speak English.  she saw my thumb nail and instantly determined "damaged".   from wearing constant polish my nails are yellowish. seemed reasonable to remove the yellow, figured she knew how.  the technician "buffed" the nails -all of them.  she moved so hard it made my cuticle bleed.  she puts on a little blue stuff and smiles. wow.later in the week 6 of my nails develop nicks, verticle cracks that cause me to have to cut off the area. as the nail grows out  more cracks because the damage caused by the rough buffing is deep in the bed of the nail.I call and get a male on the phone who insists they can do nothing because I waited more than 3 days. he kept going on about the polish.Polish NOT the issue!  the cracks and damage caused by the rough buffing is the problem!   He just did not understand enough English to follow what I was trying to explain.  this is the last time spa city will see me.  a basic understanding of English is needed to conduct business!

8.description: Use to love this place, even though I live on the other side of town.  Even booked all the chairs once for a mani/pedi day with friends.  However my most recent experience has turned me off forever.  Basically,  I was in the area and needed to kill a few hours.  Decided to get a pedi and no chip mani.  Total cost (plus tip), $84. My disappointment:1. Poorly executed manicure2. A no chip that CHIPPED within 72 hoursWhile I was willing to let the first concern slide, I expect my no chip to last two weeks as promised (especially given how much I had paid and the fact that the technician blamed the lack of "manicuring" on the no chip). I had my nails done on a Saturday and flew out of town on Tuesday for work. I called the salon on Friday when I flew back in to town to see what type of resolution could be offered. I was passed along to three different people (technician,  then manager and lastly the owner). At first I was told they would fix the two chipped polishes if I came in by the next day.  I explained that I had just returned from a trip and that I live on the other side of town and asked if there was an alternative resolution if I couldn't make it all the way up to Peterson (I had other commitments on Saturday). They passed the phone along having me tell my story and make the same request each time (even though it was evident they were conversing among each other). It ended with the owner taking no responsibility and telling me  (at 5:30p) that if I didn't come that evening before close that they wouldn't resolve their shoddy work. Bottom line: they've lost a customer.  If I'm going to spend $84 on a mani/pedi, I'm going to Mario Tricoci. They know how to treat customers. Advice: simple resolutions cost you little to nothing yet you gain so much.  How difficult would it have been to tell me to come any time over the weekend and you would fix the two nails OR offer me 20% off my next service OR refund me $15 OR something other than stubbornness. I would love to update the review to something positive, but that all depends on you.  I wish no ill will,  only hope you can glean something from this and improve upon your service.

31.description: Sometimes you just want a polish change.  Often, when you go into a nail salon and ask for one, they give you a little pushback, and urge you to get a manicure instead.There's a reason Spa Nail City doesn't do this.  It's because they know their customers got their last manicures with them, and they know that the cuticles still look fantastic.  And it's true.  You can praise a nail salon all you want for how well your polish stays, but it *really* says something about a nail salon when it's been three weeks, your regular nail polish has chipped off, and you realize that your cuticles still look clean, moisturized, and amazing.    And you can just walk in and ask for a few minutes to apply fresh polish.And by the way, the polish change service at Spa Nail City is honestly better than actual manicures a most nail places.  It even comes with a massage. The quality and service to price ratio of this place is so damn high.  Every single person who works here is skilled, polite, gentle and thorough.  Coming here is always such a positive experience, and they respect your needs and accomodate everything you ask.  Spa Nail City is easily one of my favorites in the city.

34.description: I cannot believe that this salon has been so close to me and I have never been here.I called them at 3:15 for a Gel Mani and regular Pedi appointment. They took me right away when I got there, a man did my nails, and he was amazing, meticulous, just the way I like it! I got my nails done with a Gel OPI called ONYX, and they are incredible looking! and my toes were also amazing!
