I am glad I went here, will be telling my mom about this place!!!Did I mention their customer service is to die for, they know everyone by name!Thanks for doing a great job on my nails!

16.description: Friendly professionals, did a GREAT job on my, and my daughter's, mani-pedi that lasted through a vacation in Cabo, and then some. And no, it wad not the no-chip version. Regular old Essie Polish :) I'll be back!

13.description: I give this place two stars because of the great job the technician had done on polishing my nails. However, that was not the reason why I actually scheduled an appointment to visit this venue. I scheduled an appointment based on the reviews in relations to a Brazilian wax and I had a horrible experience!!! I believe the technician had violated so many health codes and I'm not even so sure after my experience that this place has the license to actually do such a procedure. For instance, she could not remove the hair from my inner lip every time she lifted the paper. As a result, there were wax still stuck to my skin. To remove the wax for my skin, she used acetone, which burn dearly. This is the first time this has ever happened to me. When I went home to take a shower I still had wax in my inner lining. My bikini line still had hair and I was beginning to have a reddish bumps around my bikini line area, which is also a first. Near the end of the procedure, I notice she was waxing me without any gloves on. Finally, when leaving, she removed the white sheet I was laying on, yet, did not remove the red blanket that was underneath, which had a few strains of my hair laying on it. I paid for the service, but I was so done with this place.  The people can polish nails, but waxing is a no go.

11.description: Oh my! Where do I begin to explain my love for this place. I can almost always walk in and get a mani or mani-pedi with no wait or a short one. I do call ahead though now just to be sure. The staff there are amazing and willing to do anything to give the customer what they wanted. I have never been rushed out. I go there regularly, and often while my nails dry they do massage your for a few minutes which got me hooked so now I go and while I dry will get a chair massage. If you want someone to use Cathy and Anna are pretty fabulous! The managers are also great. The place is always clean. If you get a card (stamp card) you can work towards you free mani. Whenever my girlfriends get together we go there because they will always seat us next to each other to continue to chat. In addition, when relatives from out of town take me I always bring them there as I know they will never be disappointed. They do give student discounts. If you go Monday - Wednesday they have a mani-pedi special. In addition, it is a great place to throw a party. I did one over the summer. They accommodated all of my friends and even let us bring alcohol. They were great with me as we will celebrating my birthday that they split who I sat with for my mani and pedi so I got to rotate and talk to everyone. They also massaged everyone for 5 minutes about maybe longer for no extra charge. It was soo much fun.

39.description: I have tried other salons in the area and nothing compares to this place! You feel special everytime you are there. An owner/manager is always there and they get to know you by name and really care about their customers. The girls always do a good job, the place is clean and does not have that "cheap nail salon" vibe. I feel like I am getting a great deal. I enjoy my massage after every nail service and the attention they give. I am glad I discovered this little gem.

37.description: This place is FABULOUS!! I received a service here like no other (and believe me..I've been to the best and worst in Chicago)..even better than the salons on Michigan Ave. Too bad I'm moving to Miami, FL, because I would be at this place every 2 weeks..Lol! The ladies here are VERY attentive. Not sure what nail color to choose? They have a way of figuring that out for you. Ended up with a color I didn't expect..but I love it!  You get free mini massages while getting your mani or pedi and you get another after your finished. The prices are VERY reasonable. When I come visit Chicago..I'm going to Spa Nail City!

0.description: Had a fantastic pedicure with Anna today and when I came in my feet looked rough! She got my feet vacation ready in less than an hour! Massage was good and lengthy.Spa nail city is clean and the technicians are generally good. Today was exceptionally great though! Tip: I only let Eugene do my eyebrows, so I'll be back when she's in!

38.description: Spa Nail City is a little more expensive than the average neighborhood nail salon, but they provide some worthwhile extras.  The pedicurist did a brief massage on my calves during the pedicure as well as my shoulders as my nails dried.  The ambiance and decor is warm and pleasant, not just bare and spartan like than the average nail place.  And there's no chemical odor.  The people who work there are friendly and hospitable.  They also offer a discount for students and a mani/pedi special on Mondays and Tuesdays.  If you're in a big hurry, a cheaper nail place will do, but if you want some relaxation without going to a fancy spa, Spa Nail City is a good compromise.

51.description: After several visits in search for a replacement nail salon (since the owners at Nail Tyme sold and it had been my home for 7 years), I yelped for a place near my home and decided to give Spa Nail City a try.From the first moment Eunice (the owner's wife) was very pleasant and listened to my needs and accommodated what I needed.  When it was time to pay I was expecting to pay at least $20 for repairing my nails, and she charged me $10 and said she hoped I'd come back.  I returned two weeks later and her husband filled my gel nails, and I had a pedicure and it was great.  The prices a bit higher than I'm used to, and it takes a bit longer, but all in all I think Spa Nail City will be my new home.

27.description: I tried this place due to the great reviews... however, ended up rather horrified by the experience.  It was completely unsanitary.  When I sat down, the nail clippers and such appeared to be unclean.  I should have asked for a new set, but decided "I'm sure it is okay."  I was wrong.  Three times I watched as staff returned nail soaking bowls without washing them for another use... pouring the contents into a public sink without even rinsing.  Once one of the soaking tubs was reused without being washed.  And one staff member actually used the same nail clippers and other items on two separate customers without even wiping them down.  Unfortunately, I noticed this after my manicure was to the point of painting my nails.  To top it off, when I mentioned it to the manager, he commented that "we almost always clean everything between customers."  Almost always?  Almost always = disease and infection and just general disgusting service.  I witnessed at least five accounts in my visit where it was not done.  I would not return to this business if it was free... which it certainly was not.  This was the most expensive no-chip I have had in a long time.

32.description: Probably the best nail salon in Chicago. They are experts with making your nails look amazing and they give you massages too! AMAZING! I have now moved away from Chicago and I still compare everyone else to Spa Nail City! I have yet to find another nail salon that is comparable!

54.description: I don't really do the mani-pedi thing but I was going to the Bahamas and thought I'd spoil myself. The place I usually go to is getting cruddier every time I go so I decided to use yelp to help me decide where to go and this place was not too far and accepted walk-ins. It was nice and quiet on a Saturday morning which surprised me. Unlike other yelpers, I don't like when people talk to me and no one here did. I'm a pretty quiet person and I don't enjoy mindless chatter so it was nice to just sit and get my nails done all pretty without feeling obligated to talk. I left there about $60 poorer but damn did I have some petty nails...OH YEAH!! FREE MASSAGE! How could I forget? You get a few minutes of massage. Good stuff.

48.description: terrible overall, massage chairs did not feel good at all and they re painted my toes 3 times because, according to my nail technician, the nail polish was too thick. so they went somewhere and came back with less thicker polish and painted my toes again. ones that they repainted looked lighter than other toes and chipped a day after i got them done. and other ones started to chip 2 days after. they also started doing my manicure at the same time without even asking if that was okay. I wanted to relax and enjoy my pedicure while reading a book but when they started to do it at the same time, it just felt really rushed and couldn't enjoy it at all. and awful manicure. there were little bubbles and holes on my nails. Just like pedicure, they repainted my nails 2 times until they went somewhere again and brought lighter colored one to repaint my nails. of course, my finger nails chipped within a day as well. also two of my fingers was really irritated and became really itchy. it was as if they were infected or something! it made me feel very uncomfortable and their sanitary level was very questionable.

44.description: I seriously love this place! Everyone who works here is so nice, and really good. They have a mon-tues special for $35 which is a great deal. Or for $50 add a 10 min massage or paraffin wax. Every time I've come here I've loved my experience. They are clean and friendly and have a great selection of colors. They also do waxing and my brows always amazing after. They know what they are doing here.My manicures always last a long time and they give great massages while your nails are drying. They also have a 20% off  student discount which is great!They are so nice, they even give holiday gifts! I got some cuticle oil!

24.description: I just wanted to let the Yelp world know that Chris and his team were perfect the day before my wedding. They accommodated my whole bridal party, including the groom, and let us bring snacks. That is the customer service end, on the quality end, my no-chip mani from Kim (the best no-chip technician) is still flawless as are my toes. I can't say enough about Spa Nail City.

7.description: I've been going here for a couple of months now, and I have I never been disappointed. Gina is fantastic! She is easy to talk to, and does a really great job! One time I tried to walk in and request her, and even though she was busy, they somehow found a way to fit me in without rushing any other customer!

49.description: My fiance suprised me by bringing me here my first time for a birthday mani and pedi, due to all the great reviews, and they are definitely well deserved!  I've been back now several time.  The massage chairs are great, as well as the mini shoulder massage they give while your nails dry.  My manicures, which I usually manage to chip within days (even hours) last for a long time here.  They have a frequency card, and a mani/pedi deal on Tuesdays.  I am also really impressed with the man that works there.  He accepts every walk in no matter how busy and makes it work.  Whether it means getting a mani pedi going simultaneously on one person to move things along, or jumping in and working on someone himself, he really takes care of everyone.

40.description: Not impressed...I made an appt here for a no chip mani/regular pedi because of the good reviews on Yelp.The good: The place was clean, they took me right away (I came in early), had a nice color selection, and the shop ran well - no one had to wait very long, and they communicated well with the walk-ins.The meh: My nail shape is just OK. Some are noticibly different than others. I picked the same Opi color gel and polish so my fingers and toes would match. My nails have 4 coats of gel, but my toes only have 2 coats of polish, so I ended up with an obvious color difference. My cutiles were cut back, but they still look rough.The bad:  My tech did not soak my nails to soften my cuticles and ended up cutting me in 4 places.All in all I was disappointed, and out $75 + tip. I didn't think the job here any better than the nail show downstairs from work, and the place downstairs charges less. Next time I'll save myself the trip and some $$.

53.description: Excellent as always.  I've been there many times now and they deserve their high rating as their service is consistantly excellent.

30.description: Love it here.  Everyone's so friendly.

46.description: I've had way better pedicures for much less.  For $35, I expect more than the bare minimum, and that's what I got.

1.description: 3.5. This is a spot I do recommend to others for a couple of reasons. The workers here keep it clean, and are meticulous wtih their work. They always seem to take their time to achieve the best results. The best time to go would be Mon-Tues, since this is their $35 mani/pedi special.  Typically, it is $15 for a mani, $35 for a pedi.They've got massaging chairs that are acceptable, but have some wear. They also do not massage your bottom. Their pedi tubs are clean, although I could have fared with a much higher heat. Color selection feels limited in quantity, but are mostly kept to OPI and Essie (two of my fave brands). You'll find your usual reds and pinks. Some blues, grays, purples, and very few neons, glitters, and other special types.I like that they give you a frequent flier card, and that they also give you an actual massage (although it is only about a minute.)  I don't feel like this spot gives the best ambience for relaxation or a spa day, but you'll definitely get good results.  The driers are also pretty standard, only with fans (no UV light).My only "hmm" factor was that the tech seemed hesitant in applying 3 coats.  One was my own polish, which was a glitter, and shouldn't have been a big deal.  However, the pink I chose was neon, and application was a bit streaky and uneven. Which should be fine for most polishes, but I'd caution others to watch carefully, as I'm sure this is a method they use to conserve their product.  OH! second "hmm" factor: They love paper towels here, which may be nice because it may be more cost-effective than repetitive laundry on hand towels, but feels cheap and takes away from a "luxurious" experience.  (I could paint my nails on a paper towel at home.)I usually do my own mani-pedi's, but it's been a while, and i needed some shaping, cuticle care, callus shaving, and a little massage. For $35 fingers and toes fancying... it'll do =)

55.description: I've made several visits to Nail Spa now and I have continued to have great experiences there. And almost every time I've gone there, there have been other guys there--so I don't feel so lonely!And on Monday and Tuesday they have two for one: mani/pedi, both for $35.

9.description: Love this place! The people are so nice that work here in there is none of that talking and giggling in a different language to make you wonder what's going on.  They give excellent Mani-pedis. They also have a frequent nail card for want of a better word and they stamp it with each manicure and pedicure every 10 you get one on the house.  Take your young one there and they treat them great too. Putting glitter on the nails for that special touch and don't even tack on an extra charge like other places do.  This place is definately a good choice hidden in the back of the mini mall by the Chase bank.  The parking can occasionally get tight but the spots turn over pretty quick with the Starbucks and other fast good there.

26.description: Went on a day when owners weren't there. That was my mistake. The service was rushed to an extreme. There were customers waiting and she was on a mad rush to snag the next customer.- Barely bothered to exfoliate the feet like they usually do.- Cut cuticle because she let my hand soak for only about 20 seconds.- So rough it hurt, I literally said "Ow!" two times- She used a snippers from a little drawer by her side rather than the clean ones on the metal tray. After she used them, she put them right back in her secret little drawer.- No back massage like they are supposed to end service with.- No oil.- Not even a goodbye.- Just a mad dash to rush to the front to snag a waiting customer. - And I stupidly had given a massive tip.

25.description: I live nearby and walk over for manicures and pedicures. They do a nice job and the nail technicians are always friendly. My only complaint is how anxious they are come 7pm (they close at 8pm). When I booked my appointment for later the same day, they put me down for a pedicure at 7:15pm and asked that I come in earlier if possible. I said I'd try. Come 6:45pm they are calling me asking me again to come ASAP. I was already on my way and got there at 7pm, but didn't appreciate how impatient they were about the whole thing.

12.description: I was able to get a walk-in for my mani pedi this morning and this place was absolutely great! Everything was clean and all the staff was polite.Yujin was very gentle with the massage and scrubbing so I loved that (I'm a wimp when it comes to massage). She was also very accommodating with my 3 year old.Angie did my daughter's mani which was absolutely adorable! My daughter picked deep purple nail polish with a white flower on each thumb!I'm definitely coming back here!

59.description: After having a horrible experience at a nail salon that I will not name, I decided to try out Spa Nail City after I read the reviews on Yelp! Let me tell you this is my new favorite nail salon! I have artificial nails and the previous salon I went to made them really uneven and almost every nail had an indent in them, so when I went to Spa Nail City to get them filled they look 100% better! The minute I walked through the door I was greeted by so many friendly people and they even took my coat and hung it up for me (which isn't a big deal, but the little things count for me). Then Chris (manicurist) got to work fixing/filling my nails. He did such a good job that they almost look like my real nails! I even go TWO neck/back massages while I was waiting for my nails to dry (no extra cost)! Every person that works there wants you to have the best experience while your there. They are a little more price (Gel fill = $35 + tip) but I think it is worth every penny for the little extras you get (messages & professionalism)! I'm getting married in two weeks and I already booked my Wedding day Gel fill & pedicure! I recommend this place to anyone and everyone as they also offer 15-1 hour chair messages & waxing of all kind on top of their nail services.PS- You can put the tip on your credit card, which is awesome since most places you need cash for tips (And I never have cash on me)!

21.description: Came here because u was in the area and had time to kill. Decided to do their mani pedi deal for $35. They started me with the pedicure, I sat down they pumped a few pumps of some sort of soap or something. I was hoping I would soak my feet a little more but she started right away. I wished she would work on the cuticles more also. Then I got my manicure and while sitting there I like to observe a lot and noticed a few ladies came in for a pedicure also. They sat them down immediately after me!! Without sanitizing the tub with all my dead skin and all. I was completely disgusted by it and was thinking that I may have been sitting in a tub that wasn't sanitized either. I'm giving 2 stars because they were very friendly. I probably won't be back because they have mani pedi pricing closer to me all the time and they clean every time after each use.

17.description: Spa Nail City is my go to nail salon. Even though I only make it in once or twice a month the owner still knows my name. The staff takes the time to make my nails look great, and they always have a good selection of colors both by Essie and OPI. The price can't be beat considering the time and care taken with each customer!

10.description: Oh no my fellow yelpers have done me wrong. I came in on Sunday while killing time.y grandma was at a near by hospital for a stress test. No one told me it would be a 4 hour wait. What's a girl to do? My nails looked like they could use some love so I looked for a nail salon with good reviews, in the area, and open on sunday. Enter Spa Nail City. Prices were a little higher than the burbs for a no chip, which I figured. What I didn't expect was the extra 5 they charged me to remove my old no chip because I didn't get it from them. I don't know what that 5 was for since the girl didn't even take off all the old polish and it destroyed my new no chip by having an uneven color. I could have done a better job myself. Like someone else mentioned, my nails weren't soaked at all to soften the cuticles. I got cut numerous times.I'm not in this area much so I know I won't be back and this was definitely not a place I would make a special trip for. The only nice thing was the unexpected, included parafin wax treatment I got for my hands. At least something came out of this no chip manicure. Since it wasn't nice looking nails, at least my hands are soft.

5.description: I can't believe that it has been since 2009 that I have been here. Great little place. Truth be told, I'm not super loyal to nail places; I typically just find one close to wherever I'm running errands. This was a nice place and I'm happy I returned. Got a pedicure and it turned out really nice.

3.description: I'm very conscious of the clean factor in salons. I've been known to call out nail techs if they didn't wash their hands before they come to work on my manicure. I've also been known to walk out of salons, feet soaking wet out of the pedicure chair if I've noticed some not-so-clean practices going on. That's why it was so hard for me to find a place for my nails when we moved.  It was so hard not to drive 40 minutes back to where I knew I'd get a good mani/pedi in a clean environment. But I braved it and luckily on my first foray to a new nail spa, I found Spa Nail City. I've been back a few times now because their service is great and the gals are the nicest bunch. It's on the smaller side--only about 5 pedicure stations and maybe 8 manicure stations.But it's all clean and tidy. They accept walk-ins, but as with most places, if you're short on time or don't want to wait long, best to make an appointment. They offer a great mani/pedi deal on Mondays and Tuesdays--$35, can't be beat. They offer manis/pedis,facial waxes, basic massages.  They carry the more popular brands of nail polish and also offer no-chip.  They don't really advertise no-chip, but just ask at the desk. My nails always look great after my visits here. I love the mini shoulder massage you receive when you're sitting at the nail dry station.  And they play the best music piping overhead.  A wonderful relaxing environment.

35.description: Since my beloved Gloria left my favorite nail spa, I've had to search for a new nail technician who gives great massages in the confines of an uber clean environment.  Fear not Yelpers, your Nail Queen has come to the rescue.  Not only is she Queen Yelper, but she's also the Nail Queen....let's give a round of applause to Colleen....Hannah did my nails, but another technician did my pedicure.  Not too sure why they switched off, but maybe business was slow and they were divvying up the work.  Hannah gives excellent hand massages but on another visit, she needs work on the foot massages, which are my favorite part of the experience.  The area is clean, calm, and the owners are really nice.  On Mondays and Tuesdays, manicure/pedicure deals are $10 less, for $35.  I'd recommend to come on these days but make an appointment, as they do get busy with their special.

19.description: On the recommendation of this site I went out in the pouring rain hoping to find a new nail salon. Went in, explained that I wanted a full fell set. Lynn began to take my polish off (I had the already soaked off my old nails the night before and put temporary polish on myself) I explained that I would like my nails put on flat and not curved.  She gave me an argument that they would not be strong like that and she refused to do them. I explained to her that they would be plenty strong as the acrylic is strong and i had been getting them done that way for 20 years.  She refused to do them and i had to leave there with the polish on one hand half off.   Sooooo if you want to go someplace where the customer's wishes are NOT granted, then this is the place for you.They are only getting one star because I couldn't post this unles I ga e them a star rating.

28.description: Love this nail salon!  Took a chance on a rainy Tuesday evening at 7pm that they were (a) open and (b) didn't have a long wait.  They took me right away and were extremely friendly and kind.  I got a no-chip manicure and it's by-far, the best I have ever received.  They use top of the line products, give you a wonderful massage and offer to clean your ring too!Yes they are a little on the pricier sider for this kind of nail salon ($40 for no-chip) but it has been over one week later and my nails look like they were done yesterday.  Plus they have a cool punch card system with a free manicure as a reward.I will for sure go back and try the rest of their services as well.

45.description: Ok, I am down to one star,  after getting stuck with Kim again for a mani pedi. I will keep it short... Crappy service, crappy massage, and the deal breaker foe me..... Blood on her nail buffer. Gross. Unsanitary. Any other girl here is great, if you get Kim run out the door.

33.description: Went here on Monday, after I couldn't get an appt at different salon with my groupon. The place is so nice & clean all the staff is very friendly. They are little more expensive than most salon. But Mon &Tues they have mani/pedi special for 35. I will def go here again.

43.description: I'm never disappointed in this place. Today, Bagie did my pedicure and manicure. I appreciated the time she took to repair my calloused feet. Nails and toes look great. I appreciate this place's cleanliness and the fact they have enough techs on hand to handle walk ins. Special $35 on Tuesdays.

2.description: Honestly, this review would be a solid 4 stars but I made it 5 because some 1 star reviews are positively ridiculous. The racist one comparing the owner to various satire versions of Asian characters in particular. That is an awful review. The owner is really friendly, nice and runs a tight ship. We've been going here for years. still the same people working here, very nice. Here's a list of positives:1. CLEAN. I've gotten my nails here done plenty and waxing done twice. It's spotless. 2. NICE. the workers are really nice. 3. INEXPENSIVE but competitive. 4. GREAT WORK these ladies do impeccable work. I used to work at a very fancy spa at North & Sheffield. These ladies are just as good. Cons:1. The lighting in the waxing room. But I guess they need it so bright 2. Parking lot is full of terrible drivers but not really their fault. That's it. Please disregard the racist and simply ridiculous reviews.

18.description: By far the best mani & padi i've been to! I started looking for a new spot after the previous place ive been to for 7 years got burnt down.. how sad! I was devastated and desperate to find a spot as good as my previous joint. Until i went to this place and man oh man was i impressed! They are super professional, super quick and super friendly.. they make sure you get what you paid for.. and a free massage! Now u cant beat that! I've found my new spot now after months of searching... highly recommended!

41.description: This is my neighborhood nail salon and I wouldn't cheat on them, unless I had no choice. =)The owners are a couple who are on site on a regular basis. They are friendly and  hospitable and make you feel at home.Like other nail salons, this salon DOES NOT have that "nail salon" smell which is a deal breaker for me. It's clean with a neutral ambiance. Mondays and Tuesdays there is a mani/pedi deal for $35. They provide a mini massage while drying nails at the end. There are enough staff members to accommodate walk-ins. The longest I've waited is about 10 minutes, but I had the luxury of sitting at a pedicure chair while reading a magazine getting a chair massage.Try it out and let me know what you think. Hope your experience is/was as great as mine!

52.description: I went to Spa Nail City because of the good ratings it has received here on Yelp.  Overall it was a good experience. I had a pedicure and eyebrow waxing. Mari was my technician for both. I have only one complaint ---the massage chair didn't work!  I know a lot of people don't like them, but I do. This one didn't work at all. I was disappointed, but that's not what I went there for!Mari did a nice job on both toes and eyebrows. Great price, easy to get in, nice facility. I don't like TV's blaring Sex and the City, I like background music and relative quiet.  That's what I got. Quiet conversations and nice music.  I don't like to try to have a conversation with the technician, and she didn't try to have one with me (I pulled out my iPod right away). The price is great too, and parking right in front of the place!I will be back!

50.description: Great salon for manis, pedis, waxing.  The staff is the best and run by a husband and wife team.  They know their regular customers by name and always try to accomodate me when I come in which is usually spur of the moment.  They have competitive prices but do wonderful manis & pedis.  Shop is clean & they have great hours.  Can't say enough good about this spa.

4.description: Nice ladies, decent manicure but I have to wonder what disease I have been exposed to.  I never saw then disinfect the foot bath and I watched multiple customers come and go.  They also lay the clean wet towels on the chairs at night to dry...saves money on a dryer which would help kill germs.The gentleman in the front also spends too much time snapping his fingers at the workers.

6.description: I've been here twice already for a manicure and no chip. They do a really nice job. There price is pretty standard and they are really nice. I really like the cleanliness and newer equipment they use. They have massage chairs as well and I love getting a back, neck and head massage while I wait for my nails to dry. I'm not patient and don't like waiting for my nails to dry, so this is perfect! The best thing is that I've never had to wait either. Michelle did my nails and massage and she's really great. I highly recommend this place. Will go back again.

22.description: Oh my! Where do I begin to explain my love for this place. I can almost always walk in and get a mani or mani-pedi with no wait or a short one. I do call ahead though now just to be sure. The staff there are amazing and willing to do anything to give the customer what they wanted. I have never been rushed out. I go there regularly, and often while my nails dry they do massage your for a few minutes which got me hooked so now I go and while I dry will get a chair massage. If you want someone to use Cathy and Anna are pretty fabulous! The managers are also great. The place is always clean. If you get a card (stamp card) you can work towards you free mani. Whenever my girlfriends get together we go there because they will always seat us next to each other to continue to chat. In addition, when relatives from out of town take me I always bring them there as I know they will never be disappointed. They do give student discounts. If you go Monday - Wednesday they have a mani-pedi special. In addition, it is a great place to throw a party. I did one over the summer. They accommodated all of my friends and even let us bring alcohol. They were great with me as we will celebrating my birthday that they split who I sat with for my mani and pedi so I got to rotate and talk to everyone. They also massaged everyone for 5 minutes about maybe longer for no extra charge. It was soo much fun.

15.description: Infected finger thanks to Baggie's rush job. In pain since Wednesday. Today is Sunday. My profile picture shows what she did.

57.description: I looove this place. This is my go to nail spot!Everyone here is so friendly.  They have massage chairs and a comfortable seat for manicures.  The manicure lasts for a good 4 days and the pedicure lasts forever. Well until your nail grow.The service here is excellent.  They assist you with you jacket, hand you your keys, and the little backrub while your nails are drying is the needed icing on the cake.

20.description: Infected finger thanks to Baggie's rush job. In pain since Wednesday. Today is Sunday. My profile picture shows what she did.

36.description: This is my neighborhood nail place.  They are really fabulous!  I don't think I've ever gotten a bad mani or pedi.  They are beyond friendly.  They remember you/your name.  The place is totally clean.  And they do an awesome job.  The best deal is a Monday or Tuesday if you can swing it.  $35 mani/pedi.  They are also great when I bring my daughter in.  Totally patient and she loves the little flowers and designs they paint on her fingers and toes.  Good magazine selection, massaging chairs for pedicure, no blaring TVs.  And a Starbucks next door.

14.description: I used to go here regularly several years ago for acrylic nails, was back in town and went yesterday for a fill and polish - was so very disappointed in the quality and price.  I have been getting gel over acrylic in California and it works great and is reasonable.  I was told here that it would the cost of the acrylic plus a full cost for gel....crazy expensive.  So I opted for regular - the quality of the fill is bumpy and uneven and looks amateurish - I will not return here again.

0.description: My wedding is this year and Tita Pacita helped me with choosing the right style and fit for my barong and for my groomsmen's barongs. She is very helpful and very courteous. They do have limited hours so I have to send my groomsmen there for measurements and they are accommodating enough to open even on days that they are normally closed.I like the store because you can browse through a physical barong tagalog and actually see what you are getting. But in the same time, they will custom make your barongs to fit your needs.

28.description: I came here not knowing what to expect and i was overwhelmed with the great service and the amazing job they did. Not only are they exceptionally clean, they are very precise and meticulous when it comes to the nails. I loved the back massage they did at the end, which is extremely rare with nail salons. I will definitely go back.

1.description: Found this place via Yelp search as my go-to was closed and I desperately needed a manicure.  Definitely call before you head over.  They may accept walk-ins, but in the morning there are only two techs and you might be told you'd have to wait an hour before they get to you. They carry a nice array of no-chip manicure colors and their space is tidy.   My manicurist was super sweet and fun to talk to. Her no-chip technique was good and her polishing was neat. There was a short shoulder massage afterward--nice surprise and helped with the overall relaxing visit. Two entrances...one on Peterson and the other in the back where their private lot it.

9.description: I've been going here for almost a year now and it's great! I suggest calling in to give Kim a heads up that you need a fill for acrylic nails, since she is the only one who does this at the salon. She is very precise and friendly!

29.description: As others mentioned, clean, new, friendly service, good prices, parking!!  My new go-to nail spot in the neighborhood

23.description: This place is amazing. Ladies are so nice and do great liquid gel and no chip! I get compliments everytime I get a fill. And as others mentioned they give u a neck massage. Highly recommend!

5.description: Great place.

31.description: I heard about this new nail salon from Nextdoor.com. I stopped in the night before I was leaving for a trip around 6:30- they close at 7:30. There was a 'party' of 3 moms and their daughters and friends in there drinking wine and having a manicure party. I felt really bad for the technicians since the kids were running around like maniacs and being super annoying while the moms just sipped their wine and said "Stop that."They took me in and gave me a wonderful pedicure despite the ruckus. When I was finished it was past 7:30 and they were still working on the on the women and one of the kids that came late. I really give them credit for taking me in despite their full house already. It is very clean, the technicians are very friendly, prices are affordable and it is brand new. Also my pedicure is still looking fabulous after walking a ton and getting my feet sandy at the beach. I can't wait to go back again - minus the maniac children!

25.description: Came here after reading reviews on yelp and was very happy!  Got a mani-pedi... average prices and the best part is after the manicure they gave a nice neck message!  Would definitely go back.

12.description: I needed to find a new nail salon since my old place has gone down hill. I'm so glad I found this place on yelp! Fast but excellent job on my manicure! Prices are great, awesome nail color selection, and I even got a little back rub during my mani! What more can you want? Can't wait to come back when I need a pedi!

21.description: The owner and her mom who works with her are so friendly super nice and I've been going here because they are amazing. She dies amazing designs. Free hand. But make sure call ahead sometimes there's only the two of them if you don't want to wait. I love them here they give massages and they do exactly what you want and listen

16.description: HOLY GRAIL! I have been going to this nail place for about a year now. I have been to every "decent" nail salon in Chicago (no exaggeration). This place is a hidden gem. I just recently started suggesting this place to my girlfriends. It is a little ways for most of my girlfriends. However, they say the drive is worth it. This is the BEST nail salon in Chicago. The "no chip" manicure can last up to three weeks, which is perfect, because I travel a lot. The techs take time on your nails and never rush. Kim is absolutely amazing and she has rejuvenated my hands. I only get "no chip" manicures, therefore, my nails would be damaged. This place has somehow made my nails the healthiest they've been with the "no-chip". My pedicures last a long time as well. I try to go once a week (which is a bit excessive, but if you try it out.. you'll totally understand why). This place has gotten a bit busier than last year, therefore going super early helps if you're in a rush. I could go on and on, but believe me when I say this is the best nail salon in Chicago!

17.description: Awesome place. Great attention to detail! Good prices, and a neck/shoulder massage. Can't ask for more!

10.description: I've been here 5 times already did mani, pedi and no chip. They do an excellent job and they are the least expensive from all the other nail shops in the neighborhood. The ladies are all very friendly and sweet. The place is clean and parking is always available behind the nail shop. I highly recommend deluxe nails.

11.description: Found them on Yelp and Looooved this place! We walked in and were taken care of immediately. Went for mani/pedis. They had enough staff that they did both our nails at the same time so neither one of us had to sit around and wait. The pedicure was great,  the foot and leg massage awesome. The manicure was perfect, the hand and arm massage spectacular. They even give you a neck and shoulder massage and finish with a hot towel. I felt pampered,  and ready for a nap afterwards. I will continue going to Deluxe Nails from now on!

26.description: I love that they open early... unlike other shops that open at 10 when my day's half over! So friendly, professional, and clean. The massage chairs are fully-functioning and powerful- which I love! Will now make this my go-to salon... & you should too! These ladies rock!

27.description: I called on a Saturday morning at 11am and they were able to get my daughter and I in right away.  I got a Spa Pedi and a Reg. Mani my daughter was just a polish change but she requested pink nails and white polka dots.  They all did an awesome job, very thorough. The space is very clean and they have really good massage chairs.  While I was waiting for my nails to dry, they gave me a nice massage and ended it with hot towels.  Another pleasant surprise was the Spa pedicure included a hot stone foot/leg massage.  I've usually gone down the street from my house (which is within walking distance) but from now on I will be going to deluxe nails.  You definitely get more for your money, it was cheaper, the people were friendly and made my daughter feel comfortable about her request and kept complimenting her nail color choices. This is the place!

0.description: I am particular about my nails and about sanitation practices, and have had mostly disappointing experiences with nail salons in the city. I am willing to pay and travel for good service and cleanliness. I also want to be able to communicate with the technician who is doing my nails. I was looking to get my nails done before a weekend trip and wanted a place that was closer than my previous go-to suburban salon. I checked Yelp reviews, and chose Deluxe Nails based on the rating and comments. I have been to Deluxe Nails twice now, and had an excellent experience with Jenny both times, it definitely lived up to my expectations!Jenny has given me probably the best no-chip manicures I've had. Many salons charge a lot more than Deluxe Nails and do a "dry" no-chip manicure, which basically involves pushing back your cuticles without any softening, clipping/filing/shaping, applying the polish, and then applying lotion. Not at Deluxe Nails! It is a full-blown manicure - soak, cuticle removal, shaping, an outstanding and careful application of the no-chip polish with ample curing time, topped off with a neck and shoulder massage. I have selected CND Shellac polish both times (my preferred brand) and have had perfect nails with no chips for 3+ weeks. They have quite a few colors and brands of no-chip polish.The pedicure is nice, their spa massage chairs really give you a going over! I need to spend some time checking out the different massage features, the first time I felt a bit manhandled by the chair's default setting, but not in a bad way. They go beyond the basics on the pedicure as well.They sanitize their tools and pedicure bowls well, and use disposable files, buffers, and whatever the little bars are called that they use to exfoliate your feet. Each station has multiple fresh items ready for the technicians to use.The decor is not fancy, more functional, which is fine with me. I appreciate the outstanding service and result for what I consider a very fair price - 40% less than what I was paying at the salon where I have my hair done.Their closing time is earlier than what is listed on the Yelp page - I felt bad because they stayed late to finish for me because I went in assuming they were open until 7:30 but discovered that they close at 7 on weeknights, at least during the winter. Next time I will confirm when I call ahead for an appointment if it's near the end of the day. There are parking spaces in the rear and a back door, or you can park on the street.

20.description: I've been here 5 times already did mani, pedi and no chip. They do an excellent job and they are the least expensive from all the other nail shops in the neighborhood. The ladies are all very friendly and sweet. The place is clean and parking is always available behind the nail shop. I highly recommend deluxe nails.

19.description: I absolutely love this nail shop! I have only gotten pedicures here but they do a great job. It is very clean and the ladies are very attentive to what they are doing. I also like that they open a new package of nail instruments for each client. This stops things such as fungus from  spreading. They also do very nice nail designs. The designs are very intricate and beautiful!

2.description: Got a no chip gel polish manicure and they did an amazing job. My nails looked great and they were very polite, clean, and professional. Am definitely going to return. Make sure you make an appointment so you get in!

32.description: Have visited this salon twice for a mani/pedi and highly recommend it!  I have even brought my mother-in-law along for a special treat (and she loves this shop as well).  What you will find:  Absolute cleanliness, attention to detail, extremely pleasant nail technicians and wonderful pricing.  It's so nice to have a shop that prides itself in personalized attention in the neighborhood.  Definitely worth the trip!

18.description: I heard about this new nail salon from Nextdoor.com. I stopped in the night before I was leaving for a trip around 6:30- they close at 7:30. There was a 'party' of 3 moms and their daughters and friends in there drinking wine and having a manicure party. I felt really bad for the technicians since the kids were running around like maniacs and being super annoying while the moms just sipped their wine and said "Stop that."They took me in and gave me a wonderful pedicure despite the ruckus. When I was finished it was past 7:30 and they were still working on the on the women and one of the kids that came late. I really give them credit for taking me in despite their full house already. It is very clean, the technicians are very friendly, prices are affordable and it is brand new. Also my pedicure is still looking fabulous after walking a ton and getting my feet sandy at the beach. I can't wait to go back again - minus the maniac children!

13.description: The owner and her mom who works with her are so friendly super nice and I've been going here because they are amazing. She dies amazing designs. Free hand. But make sure call ahead sometimes there's only the two of them if you don't want to wait. I love them here they give massages and they do exactly what you want and listen

4.description: I read reviews about Deluxe Nails and was optimistic about going there for the first time. I went to get a gel full set removed and, unlike my usual nail salon, the method was harsh. They used a power drill file on my actual nails and really damaged my nail beds. Then I asked to simply cut 2 hangnails and the lady said I needed a full manicure to do that. She then proceeded to tear off one of the hangnails with the drill file causing me pain and to bleed. Needless to say I will not be going back there ever.

24.description: I have been searching for a nail salon that opens before 10 and I am so glad that I did! This salon was clean and the owner is so nice. She did a great job on my cuticles and the no-chip is the best that I have ever had. I highly recommend this nail salon.

6.description: They did remove my no chip without charging which was great but the manicure was very disappointing.  Thank god I got a regular manicure and didn't pay $30 for a no chip!  Asked for the same shape but shorter. My nails are nubs now and not attractive.  Maybe the language barrier was a problem.The experience itself was odd.  They do back massages but don't tell you until the girl is flipping your hair out of the way which I  asked her to stop.  The hand massage was unnecessary too.  It's not like they're masseuses so it's not a bonus in my book or a reason to go here as a walkin.  Seemed like others in there were regulars though.  If you enjoy getting manicures then go somewhere else. It's not a good experience here.

22.description: Kim is awesome and the customer service, attendtion to detail and fab new polish with ample coices.  Clean and quick!

15.description: I really like this place, I came here based on other yelp reviews. When you first walk in you think "ok another quick in and out nail salon- been there done that" but then surprise... this one is really different. How? The techs are all very friendly and courteous (ever have the feeling techs talk rubbish about?) Yep, you won't ever get that weird feeling here. No rushing the job, ever. I've been here now 5 times and never ever was I rushed. There are no excessive fumes. The chairs are comfortable and the prices are fair. The salon is clean and so are the tools. Oh and EASY parking behind the salon. I will keep coming back here :-)

7.description: I found a new gem! I really can't rave enough about this place-lets start with:1.Parking-plenty of it some pay to park but have private parking in the back and take note that the side streets are not permit so pay to park is really last resort ever!2. Fair/decent/standard prices-they have a no chip manicure and pedi combo for 50.00 which is a STEAL! AND no "no chip" manicure removal fee every time like most places are now trying to implement ex 10.00 to remove and replace no chip each time-doesn't exist here !3. Standard hours but closed on Sunday's which is fine with me!4. Great pedicure chairs and foot tubs-the massage chairs put in work not dinky like some places. Also they even give you w scrub leg rub during the pedi AND a lotion rub after the pedi-hard to come by!5. The best is the manicure-they give you a small back and shoulder rub before painting on the nail coat and before paying WITH a hot towel down the back, neck and shouldersBIBLE. This place is almost too good to be true it's like I've died and found my perfect nail salon. Kim the owner is super nice too! They take walk ins but I would suggest I make an appt a head of time-I got lucky with a walk in and 10 min wait and missed the rush-several people came in after and the longest wait after that was a good 30-45 min-best place!

8.description: Love the staff here. They do a great job at very reasonable prices and they are great at accepting walk ins but they do tend to get busy so try and make an appointment ahead of time. Also cash tips are preferred! Love that there's a parking lot in the back since it's such a busy area.

30.description: Great experience at Deluxe nail salon.  Street parking right in front.  Super friendly technicians.  Fantastic prices.  Clean and new.  Will definitely return.

3.description: JENNY was excellent. Meticulous, paid attention to detail, gentle and has amazing hands. Possibly the best gel manicure I've ever gotten! Gel mani and regular pedi together cost me $50. Very reasonable price for such a great job. Went in on a Friday at 1pm. Parking in the back for free. Call ahead and make an appointment because they are quite busy.

14.description: Are you kidding me?! Walked in for a full set and a pedi. She told me she was busy! Really you have 5 people working and your kicking business out?! Definitely not worth driving over here if they are going to kick you out cause apparently they are to busy! Please don't own a business you can't handle!

1.description: As Mike O's review says, this place is actually called El Pueblito.  In my opinion, this place is just nasty.  The whole establishment stinks like a bathroom - that should have been the first sign to run...but we braved it out.  Big mistake.  The chicken tacos we tried were gross.  The meat was full of gristle.  As starving as we were, we could not finish them.  I will never go back.

2.description: Though the name is Taco City, the actual sign on the awning reads El Pueblito. It is near the corner of Foster & Cicero, near my workplace, so I've come here with people for lunch. To avoid the wait, you can phone ahead and the order will be ready for you to eat in. Service is OK but could be faster. The selection of different meal combos to choose from is mind-boggling huge. The pictures across the menu board are faded and unlit, so it's hard to make out the plates. As usual, I do my steak burrito benchmark test. The steak was a bit stringy and I had a lot in my teeth afterwards, so that costs some points in my review. Rice and beans are good though. The red hot sauce is hot indeed, but very flavorful. My favorite menu item is the combo plate of steak taco, tostada and enchilada. The TV plays the shows in Spanish that have hot Latino women in skimpy attire us guys all love. Parking is next to an auto repair place on the corner, so it's often crowded or non-existent. Good reason to order for pickup, double park and get out of there quickly.

0.description: This place is great for take-out. Go for the chicken enchiladas with green sauce, the guac and chips, or the tacos. I literally order from here about once a week, and I've only had an issue with their food on two occasions. They were hiring a new cook, and apparently were in the process of training him on both occasions. Since then, he's gotten much better, but the food is still better when the older woman cooks it.They tend to put a lot of raw onions on their tacos, but I feel like they balance out the taste of steak and cilantro quite well.I wish I could give El Pueblito 3 and a half stars... It's slightly better than "A-OK" but I can't in good conscience give it 4 stars..

3.description: Best hair designer he is amazing style color cut and make up u name it I love the way he makes me look and he is friendly and the place is very nice

1.description: Ive been going by David for almost 2 years now. He is by far the best colorists I have ever been to. He really is a talented stylists and knows what he's doing. He has always been upfront and honest about what he thinks and what is best for my hair, as quality of hair is extremely important to David. I've been to a handful of colorists in my life and I'm still amazed at how he does it. He has a secret weapon, where he fixes  other colorists mistakes, which is how I met him. He didn't only fix the previous bad job, he truly amazed me with the most beautiful color and the quality of my hair was better than when I came to him. I'm not kidding when I say, he's got a secret. I've also had up do's done for special occasions, cuts and blow-drys. He does what you ask, as long as it won't harm your hair, he's not the guy that does what he wants. Those stylists get on my nerves. David just did my moms hair (up-do) and she loved it! AND she's one picky Mo-Fo! He does beautiful eye makeup (dramatic smoky eyes) as well, which is the only thing I've tried as far as makeup. I know he does full face makeup. If you want to get your eye brows threaded, which is another amazing service they provide and they do a fantastic job. Marlin and Ninwe are two lovely ladies originally from the middle-east which is why they are so skilled at threading. They are both equally great as I've been going to both for over a year now. Last but not least...THIS PLACE IS THE LEAST EXPENSIVE HAIR SALON I HAVE EVER BEEN TO. WHAT A BONUS!!!! Parking is also available in front of the salon. I highly highly highly recommend David and his super talented crew. I will post pictures as well, so you can see there work.

2.description: Initially, walking in the salon is very nice looking.Upon talking to the staff, very rude and stand offish.The girl washed my hair and combed it....very painful &I do have curly hair but she was pulling and tugging to the point where I had to tell her to give me the brush so I can do it myself.David, was my stylist (first time I have ever been here).. very rude!  Did not say hello, how are you?  Just came up to me and asked "How do you want your hair?"  He cut my hair in less than 10 minutes, did not ask if I want it blow dryer and just seemed very uninterested in the customer (me). For a $25 haircut, you can def find a better place that will be thanful and deserving of your business --I just did not feel it here and I would never go back.You can't expect to do well in a salon and treat people in a rude fashion.. where is your customer service?  The whole time I was there he maybe spoke 5 words.  I just dont recommend and with a city as big as Chicago, you'd be crazy to go back!!!

0.description: After David completed the coloring process on my hair,  it was love at first sight with both the color he gave me and his coloring technique. I've been his client for 5 months now and I intend on going ONLY TO HIM FOR COLOR. David is the Mother of All colorists.  He is the Guru, Master, Sage, Teacher, Sheikh, Rabbi, Expert, Wizard, and Leading Light to every professional hair colorists.    David also provided the keratin treatment on my frizzy, coarse curly hair a month ago.  He suggested I needed a treatment and mentioned a few different types that I can choose from. I looked into the keratin treatment & I wanted the one that removes the frizz only so I can keep my curls. He told me directly the treatment would be a great benefit for the quality of my hair and daily styling product usage would be at the bare minimum as for mousse, gel, hair spray, frizz serums, etc. I couldn't be happier with the results.  My hair has not been this soft since I was 7 years old.  David is truly the divine truth for hair & beauty.  This is coming from a girl who looks like "Frizzy Bear" after my hair is brushed.  If my hair can have that soft look then ANYONE CAN.  David has been a true blessing to my hair.  I told him I thank my lucky stars for bringing you in my life & that he was the light at the end of my tunnel :).

3.description: OK, this spot doesn't have the best reviews, but dagnabbit, we liked it. I ordered through GrubHub and I have to say, we pretty much liked everything we got. I had a cheeseburger, which was fine and certainly affordable. The fries were old fashioned fat crinkle cuts but not bad. I also tried their chili. It was meaty, spicy and good. Mom had the wild salmon burger and it was very good and certainly inexpensive. The portion was plentiful. She also had the Italian Wedding Soup and really enjoyed it.Look, I don't care if they buy some of their stuff from Costco or Aldi. I mean, all restaurants buy their supplies from somewhere. They aren't fishing the coast of Alaska for the fish nor riding the range for their beef. It is a friggin' hot dog joint folks.BTW, their Kosher Dogs and Polish come from Romanian Sausage. For sure there can be no complaints about that. AND, they will provide Halal burgers and chicken on request.Well, that's the story. I know we will try more in the future. Updates to follow.

1.description: I've lived down the street from this place for about 3 years and have always wanted to try it. I finally did! I walked in and was taken back by the appearance inside it looked to put it mildly aged. When I say aged I mean like they should probably not even be open. I ordered the hot dog, fries, and a coke against by Better judgement that wanted to run out and never return. As they prepared my order I regretted entering thee establishment more and more by the second. My order was a to go order so I sat on a stool and watched the only other person in this joint prepare it. She finally finished and was getting my drink which I assumed would come from their fountain soda machine. But instead she put ice in the cup and poured soda from a warm 2 liter into the cup as my fountain drink. I went home and debated whether or not I was going to eat what I had just purchased. I decided yes and it wasn't half bad. Minus the soda which was flat and I tossed.   Not quite sure yet....maybe if there is absolutely nothing else and I have a few bucks and want something close and convenient and am feeling adventurous with my life.

2.description: Small little restaurant near Sauganash, amazing Mediterranean food, the owners are really nice people! Check out the grilled chicken!

5.description: Top Dog is in the area of where I work.  It always looked really cute and retro...and then I walked in.  My question is, when was the last time this place was visited by a health inspector?   The owner was as nice as could be.  The falafel was probably the worst, crunchiest, saltiest, over-fried thing I have ever eaten.  The cook used bare hands which also really grossed me out, considering how dirty the rest of the place looked.  I wish I could have given this cute-on-the-outside place a better review.

6.description: I'm really not one for the greasy spoon, but it's like a 2 minute walk for me so used to go there very frequently. Sometimes multiple times in a week and usually once every week. There was even a time where I went 4/7 days a week for a month or so.  The owner is a very kind, warmhearted man. He's usually wearing a baseball cap and is in his late fifties to early sixties, so make sure to strike out a conversation with him. The food is just okay. It's really nothing to rave about. I usually get the Italian beef, the steak tacos, or the french fries. I have literally tried everything on the menu. Usually when I stop by I get an Italian Beef, a large fries, and a drink for fifteen dollars. Yes, fifteen dollars. I like their Italian beef a lot. It's not Al's, but it's good. The fries are really good. The hamburger is not good. It is average, at best. I used to absolutely love their steak tacos, until one experience tainted my taste. I found out recently they very rarely use raw meat. Most of it is packaged frozen food bought in bulk from Costco. My steak tacos consisted of pre-cooked meat that was taken out of a dirty container that seemed like its been there for years. Didn't taste as good that one time either. But I'm sure its a rare experience and it won't happen to you, but I'm not taking my chances. Now, here is a major issue: I found a hair in my steak tacos. My friends that come here often say they find hairs frequently as well.It is also worth noting it has not been inspected recently so I might have been consuming expired food over the past three years.I appreciate the owner coming by every morning and working hard. But it's pretty overpriced, and at least 50 trips there I have seen some weird things, and I'll probably only come back for the fries or Italian beef four times a year.

7.description: This is one of those Mom & Pop places just minus the Mom. Though the owner Gus is an extremely nice and caring man. A good o' boy you mite say. One of those guys that you don't know how he gets up every morning to open the shop. But he has so many regulars (cool people to chat up) that I am sure he opens just for them now.Use to be a regular myself only working a couple blocks away. Food is good cause he makes it right there for you, he charges a little more then what you would expect but that's how he supports the place. He makes the food usually and delivers himself if your in the area.Check it out if you have time to kill.

8.description: Talk about a hole in the wall that can't comfortably seat 10 people but the food is great for a small greasy spoon. BLT, sausage and Italian beef are good. Love the fresh out of the fryer fries and the two guys that run the entire show.

9.description: Excellent burger and fries!!!  Yum!!

0.description: Stopped in on my way to work and was pleasantly surprised.    Big menu from dogs and burgers to Mediterranean and veggie. Decent prices, nice folks. The space is a little run down but the food quality is 4+ star.   Stop in and give them a try. Worth the visit.

4.description: Humble little diner dive, in the Peterson Park meets Sauganash area. Open daily till 8 pm, it serves the typical American favs like hot dogs, burgers, fries etc. It's catch all is in the ownership, so there are far more offerings like salads, soups, Mexican food, seafood, Mediterranean food, pita stir fry, subs, falafels and more! Looking at the size of this tiny place you wouldn't expect that they could prepare that many dishes. It's a small spot as in, tables for about 4 to 6 people and then at the counter, at best, four petite hipsters could sit comfortably. Top dog has been in the hood for quite some time and on occasion I've made my trips over. It's that last minute decision making whilst driving by. I like their all beef hot dogs, it's not just a hot dog out of boiled water, there's heart in its prep and the cook is happy to see new business. I'd even go as far as saying that their dogs are better served than some of the local char houses.

3.description: I come here often. I've always gotten good service. It's a Subway so as long as you eat sandwiches you'll find what you need, lol!

1.description: Just got back from there and bread was bad, I wasn't paying much attention as I realized I should have but didn't think I needed to because I've been a subway customer for a long time and never had to lookout for it and every time I'd ordered it, it came out the way I wanted. I asked for her to toast it and the whole top of the bread was literally crunchy, and the mustard was disgusting. The Italian bread was dark to begin with. And it was just unorganized. Don't plan on going to that subway again. Waste of my time, gas, and money.

2.description: Gross.We walked in, and the person who was supposed to be manning the counter (the owner's son, I believe) wasn't there.  He came walking in after we waited for about 5 minute said "sorry, I was at Dunkin Donuts" like it was no big deal.Thankfully he put gloves on to make our sandwiches, but didn't wash his hands first.We were the only people aside from him, but dined in.  About 2 bites into our sandwiches, his mother walked in (the owner?) stepped behind the counter, started touching the cookies and snacking on them with her bare hands, before taking fresh cookies out of the oven and placing them into the tray with the same hands that were just in her mouth eating cookies.  No gloves, no hand washing from the time she walked in the door.Then, she had her son take out a ladder and start replacing lightbulbs in the ceiling while we were eating.  They were turning the lights on and off while we were sitting there.Obviously they have no care for their patrons.  I get it, this is a Subway and not a fine-dining establishment, but none of our experience was even sanitary.

5.description: It's your average subway. Very small parking lot and can get busy around lunch time. I've read bad reviews but i haven't had any problems there. if i do i'll make sure to update.

6.description: Maybe the worst subway I have been to. I seem to get the older guy when I go. He's real stingy with the toppings...ex: 5 pickles for a footlong. I told myself I wouldn't go back but yesterday I did. I ordered a chicken breast footlong, got home, and he gave me a chicken sandwich with no chicken in it!!! I went back and fixed it but I will never be back to this subway.

7.description: just tried getting a sub from subway and was told i couldnt get extra lettuce/spinach without being charged extra. the only charge for extras on the menu was for extra meat. when i asked the charge for extra veggies, she said i dont know.  i asked the sandwich artist if she ever heard of the better business bureau. she didnt but i said she will soon.

0.description: I'm not sure why this Subway location has so many negative reviews. I've never had a bad experience here and I'm almost always  disappointed with my Subway sandwiches. I  occasionally come to this location on my lunch break  usually between 10 a.m and 1:00 pm. Every time I've eaten here the bread has been soft and fresh and the restaurant is always clean. I have a problem with the Subway by my house because the bread is always hard but that is never the case at this location. Every time I've come here its been a woman who builds my sandwiches so I've never experienced the man who is supposedly "stingy with the toppings" as stated by previous reviewer's. My one & only complaint is the parking lot is awkward and annoying. Otherwise keep up the good work Subway and I will continue coming to this location as long as I work in the neighborhood.

4.description: Worst Subway in the area.  They always try to overcharge even with a coupon.  They are not accommodating or friendly and they use the same gloves to make sandwiches as to take cash.   very unpleasant atmosphere and cheaply prepared SANDWICHES.

3.description: My favorite Chinese place closed after 20 years of my loyalty. I have tried a couple of other area places to fill the void. I think I found it at Yummy House. Wide menu, fair prices, nice owners, and the KIDS LOVE IT. This is based on one visit, with a limited order. Pot stickers (pan fried) and Chicken fried rice---very good. I can see this as a regular for the family.

1.description: Not yummy. Nope.  Just too average.Something about the flavor of the dishes, it just doesn't keep your taste buds. Not very attractive, just bland.Combo's come with chicken fried rice and they pile on the chicken. Of the two dishes we'd ordered, there was an abundance of meat.  General Tso's Chicken & Garlic Sauce combo.  The best was General Tso's Chicken. I'd requested everything spicy, nothing was made spicy. I couldn't taste any trace of spicy.Egg rolls are ok and filling. Crab rangoons just ok. (IF you know what great rangoons are, you may not like these)They've got a great students menu with daily deals and a dollar menu, which is pretty unique for a fast food chinese place.

2.description: First, the positive, the breaded and deep fried (orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken etc.) Chinese food is indeed yummy.  The chicken lo mein is also quite good.  The portions are also very large and definitely splitable.  Their prices are great as well.  This place claims to use healthier cooking methods for their non deep fried foods.  The chicken and broccoli was allright - kind of bland, but I guess that's what you get for healthier Chinese food.  The owner is very friendly and accommodating (and has been known to throw in free food).Now, the not so positive.  This place also claims to serve Thai and Vietnamese food.  While I have not tried the Vietnamese food here, I would definitely not recommend the Thai food.  The Pad See Eww noodles lacked sweetness and the right texture.  The noodles were stuck together and were rather salty instead.

0.description: Its been CLOSED for a year now! It was pretty good tho.

12.description: Great place! it's a hidden gem.  If you know about Image skin care products, you definitely should try this place.  Great peels & facials and my skin glows! Diane is very knowledgeable of the products and isn't a pushy sales person which is a plus for me.  I came across it through Groupon and glad I made the purchase.

3.description: Discovered this place on Groupon but returned without one too.  Most thorough, yet gentle facial I've ever had. There's a little bit of parking in the back accessible through the alley.

1.description: I've received two of the Ultimate Facials here at the Institute of Skin and Body.  Sladja is a soft-spoken, attentive esthetician.  She takes her time to listen to your concerns and addresses any skin issues you might be facing.  I've had my very first microdermabrasion and she told me what she would be doing just in case I had any concerns.  I loved the facial steamer and the high frequency light therapy.  I'm definitely making this my go-to facial spot.  Just be sure to call and book an appointment as they are by appointment only.  PARKING.  There is limited street parking (you can park right out in front by the tree) or in the small lot in the back (I've never had the luck of getting a spot there though).  Just be sure you don't park in any of the zone residential areas.  I don't know about you, but getting a parking ticket on your way out of a relaxing facial would totally ruin my mood.  DECOR. It's a small, but clean facility.  I took off one star because there is no separate receptionist.  On days that all of the workers are with clients, they keep their door locked.  I had an appointment at noon and arrived at 11:40am (I don't run on "Asian Time" and I'm usually early).  I had to wait outside for 20 minutes before they opened the door.

2.description: I've been wanting to check this place out for some time since I've moved into the neighborhood.  I finally made an appt for a general facial.  I was happy they had availability and were flexible with my schedule even when I had to call and change the time.  My facial was with the owner, Diana.  The place is cute, clean and easily accessible. Diana went thru the general questions about my skin type, what products I use and my general routine. The facial was good, the exfoliation seemed thorough and the massage was great as well.  I especially liked that she didn't leave the room and leave me sitting with a mask on like other facials I've had elsewhere.  After coming home, several hours later I've noticed my skin still looks very clean and smooth.  I'm happy with the place and will be back!

9.description: I definitely agree  the reviewers about my experience. Diane is amazing and as a person who has had many facials, hers was among the best I have ever had. I would also  recommend the products that they they sell. They are high quality and reasonably priced as well. I can't believe I have this little gem of a place in my neighborhood. I haven't tried a massage yet  but based on those reviews,that will be next.

10.description: One of the best massage I have gotten in a long time. He relieved the tension in my shoulder, lower back & legs. Very professional with a price no one can beat . They are always on time, which is great.

4.description: I had a fantastic facial, microdermabrasion and image peel by Sladja, who worked tirelessly and happily to make me have the best facial treatment she could provide.  I initially purchased a Groupon in December 2014, but had experienced some personal setbacks from losing my beloved fiancé to a heart attack to undergoing an unexpected colon surgery.  I almost forgot I had purchased a Groupon!   The location is in a good neighborhood near Edgebrook, and I enjoyed first meeting the owner, Diane, who is spunky and easy going.  Diane takes pride and care in the appearance of her business.  I also loved the peacefulness of the Institute.  I thoroughly enjoyed meeting Sladja, who is a skilled Esthetician.  Sladja is very poised and professionally polished in her management of all the skin care techniques.  Sladja was so detailed.  She was concerned that I had blackheads and she worked on extracting them.  She has such gifted hands and fingers.  She gives a stress massage to the neck and upper shoulders and worked on knots in my shoulder muscles.  Sladja provided above and beyond my expectations of care.  She even had me in tears of gratitude.   She also gave me a small sample of skin cleansing to help while I hopefuly can afford to return for more loving professional skin care.   God Bless Diane and Sladja with long life and happiness.  They both are loving gifts of caring human beings.

6.description: Just had a great experience here. Wanted a last-minute facial in the afternoon and after reading the mostly positive reviews here, I thought I'd give them a try. They had time and their prices were very reasonable, so I went in and Sladja went to work on my dry, ruddy skin. I was so relaxed that I fell asleep and when I woke up, my skin was very even and very hydrated. I've paid twice the price in the past for a facial not nearly as good. The products they use are also high quality, smell good and are easy on the skin. I'm definitely going back and I definitely recommend this place to all Northwest Siders, or to anyone for that matter.

0.description: I live nearby, but only found this place through Groupon.  I feel quite lucky that I did.  I just returned from my second facial with Diane.  Again, I left feeling like she really listened to my concerns about my skin.  She personalized my facial and seemed to really understand what my skin needed. For a reasonable price, Diane provided a relaxing, yet beneficial facial. I would really recommend you check this place out.

5.description: 5 out of 5 Stars!!This was such a great spa experience! Sladja, my esthetician, was EXCELLENT! My facial was so relaxing that I almost fell asleep, the redness of my skin dimished greatly immediately after the facial was completed and my skin felt so much softer and looked so much better after Saldja worked her magic. I got a great facial and I will definitely be going back ASAP! Loved it!

13.description: Robin is excellent. The hot stone massage treatment was something new to me. The heat coupled with her expertise allowed for a deeper and more relaxed session. My back feels awesome! Reasonable rates and decent specials on outstanding services.

11.description: Probably the best massage I've ever had! Will definitely be going back when my schedule allows me to.

8.description: I can't believe I actually have to write a negative review for this place.  I bought a Groupon here 2 years ago and came back last year for another message.  I purchased another Groupon this year and the fine print stated new customers or customers that have not used services for within 12 months.  I called to make an appointment and was told the Groupon was for new customers only and to read the fine print on my Groupon.  I tried to explain that the "fine print" said new customers or customers that had not been there within 1 year and the guy argued with me and said no its only for new customers.  They are the ones who need to read the fine print!

14.description: I had my first facial by Diane, the owner of the business.  She was wonderful!  She helped me understand what my skin needed in order to reduce redness, hydrate, and glow.  The products she uses are all natural and really, really work!  I emailed her with follow-up questions about caring for my skin, and she got back to me immediately with answers.  Three days later and my skin continues to look great.

7.description: I will recommend this place to all my friends, absolutely loved the experience, Diane is a great specialist and very passionate about what she does.  I got the groupon but paid for the next visit right after she finished. I got facial, micro and peel. Love it. Facial massage was awesome!  Ive tried several different spas before and some of them I kinda liked but didnt care to go back, this one I will definitely come back many times. BTW I never wrote any reviews but I was so impressed that I decided to do my first review on this wonderful place. PS. Plenty of parking behind the building down a block, no permits needed, didnt have any  trouble finding a spot.

58.description: Simple dog stop menu, decent food.  I'm not a real fan of this kind of place because everytime i think its the front door slamming shut, i realize its another of my arteries.Not worth a special trip, but good food nevertheless.

56.description: If you wana eat without thinking, come to this place, food and prices and every thing is just perfect for every one.

29.description: Ehh.. I tried to really like this place and it's just dissapoints time and time again. I've ordered food here twice and picked it up since it's close to work. I usually don't like to venture out and try "new things" so I stick with ordering the Chicken breast on a pita. And I phone in my order twice and both times I've gone I've yet still had to wait additional time once I am there for it to be done.
