Kinda defeats the purpose of callin my order in ahead of time.. frankly the people on the phone aren't very friendly either .ANYWAY.. the Chicken breast on a pita does not wow me.  It's ok a bit dry and bland and usually a lil too char-broiled for me.  For being a greek place I expected something a lot more juicy! and flavorful.  I am on a sour note with this place since I've ordered not that long ago and got my order deliver and it was completely wrong after waiting an hour to get here they expected to me wait an additonal order to get my food correct?... Not a happy camper!! Really not sure if I say i'll never eat here again but it will be a while before I think about it again!!

42.description: You cannot diss on this place at all...Used to work at a restaurant right down the block (Bennigan's).Of all the short order "greek american" venues, this place's chicken kabob blows everyone away...hate to say it...but even blows west of eden's away for some reason.I can't vouch for much of their manu that ISN'T greek...but everything that is Mediterranean on their menu is badass.

23.description: If you live on the North Shore, there is basically nothing better on your drive to the city on a Saturday night than stopping at East of Edens. It's just a delightful little fast food joint.Now, I see a lot of comments like, "the chicken breast was dry!" and "the fried shrimp were eh".  But this is a GREEK FAST FOOD place, why are you getting a plain chicken breast? Stick to the stuff this place does well, and you won't be disappointed. I am basically obsessed with the spinach and cheese pie. It's flaky, and greasy, and enormous. It's a full dinner for a smaller appetite. The gyro plate is also amazing. So much meat! It seems to be sliced a tiny bit thicker than the traditional gyro, which really helps with the flavor. It's juicy! Actually, those two things are all I've had. And a greek salad! Great greek salad. But they're both DELICIOUS, and a great representation of the place. I will never, ever try the more traditional american stuff, because, WHY. But I feel pretty sure that the rest of the more Greek stuff is going to be amazing, so I guess eventually I'll break away from my favorite and try something else.Also, please make sure to read all the stuff about Harry, who recently died. You can't NOT like a place who loves their 100 yr old + employee as much as this place did. You just can't! Also, great patio.

47.description: I was extremely excited to experience "East of Eden". And to tell you the truth, for the longest time I assume that the name is in reference to east of the Garden of Eden, the biblical paradise. This is something that I clearly over analyzed. The person behind the counter simply stated that they are on the east side of the Eden's expressway. If you ask me, I like my exotic meaning. A taste of paradise, now that sounds awesome!Excited and ready to sink my teeth into their wonderful juicy gyros... hmmmm... While I was waiting I notice that their décor has a very strong appeal and presences to the local neighborhood. The seating area resembles of a 1990ish burger king or something along the lines of fast food. They took a while to make gyros, but whatever... I wouldn't want them to rush perfection. [Long pause]I was truly disappointed... I really don't see what the all the rave is all about? How hard is it to make gyros? The cucumber sauce too watered down. The meat was extremely salty. To tell you the truth, I was thinking how much better McDonald is, as to speed, service, and sad to say -- their food...

8.description: Customer service is friendly but the food isn't good at all. Hot dogs are old and recooked. Great people, terrible food.

31.description: After growing up in Edgebrook and living all over Chicago, my dude and I have found ourselves moving from Ravenswood to Sauganash. Now, we've been used to having Byron's next door and realized tonight that we need to find the nearest gyros so we can get our fix. Solid 3 stars with the possibility of moving on up. The dude got the gyros plate. It was solid, lots of meat. I was needing a plate of deep fried goodness and went for the shrimp. Mediocre. Don't think I'll get it again. The lemon soup is delish though. Maybe next Friday we'll give it another go. The $4.55 chicken leg dinner is calling my name, gotta give it a try.

34.description: In a word - uninspired.I'm not normally one to pick a fight with other posters, but if this is your idea of a "good," or better, Greek place - you need to get out more. East of Edens is cute in that it is certainly a neighborhood joint. You can tell the staff and owners care about the place; it's clean, pleasant and there's a cute shrine to Harry, a beloved 102 year old. This is the place that sponsors your local Little League team - which is all commendable.Just don't eat here and expect to have a great meal.I want to be nice to this place, but the food was terrible. I had the gyro plate which came with a bowl of lemon rice soup, on Saturday, it's the only soup available (and it's their standard soup, available every day).If you were in the hospital and received a bowl of this soup, you would be horribly disappointed. You would think someone designed it to keep you in the hospital longer by depressing you to the point of illness. The texture was like warm wallpaper paste and it coated the spoon. It tasted of lemon bars made by sad people. One taste was too much.I already tire of writing about this place, but I will let you know that the gyro meat was so overcooked that it was like a interpretative take on tree bark. Ugh.

16.description: I picked up some carryout tonight. We had the Greek style chicken that comes with broasted taters and rice. I also got a small Greek salad that Mom and I split.The portions were plentiful, in fact Mom and I shared one chicken meal and shared the small salad and there was still plenty of salad left. The food was pretty good but not great. The rice was fairly average, but the chicken had a nice flavor and the taters were taters.The salad was refreshing. Aside from the usual feta cheese, olives, etc, they also put in one dolmates which was kinda cool. I could live on Greek olives. Wish there had been a few more.We seem to stop here every few years and I always make a mental note to stop again and then I forget about it. This time for sure!!!!!

13.description: Really really Good fast clean and nice place try the,chicken was perfect and the service fast

11.description: If you live on the North Shore, there is basically nothing better on your drive to the city on a Saturday night than stopping at East of Edens. It's just a delightful little fast food joint.Now, I see a lot of comments like, "the chicken breast was dry!" and "the fried shrimp were eh".  But this is a GREEK FAST FOOD place, why are you getting a plain chicken breast? Stick to the stuff this place does well, and you won't be disappointed. I am basically obsessed with the spinach and cheese pie. It's flaky, and greasy, and enormous. It's a full dinner for a smaller appetite. The gyro plate is also amazing. So much meat! It seems to be sliced a tiny bit thicker than the traditional gyro, which really helps with the flavor. It's juicy! Actually, those two things are all I've had. And a greek salad! Great greek salad. But they're both DELICIOUS, and a great representation of the place. I will never, ever try the more traditional american stuff, because, WHY. But I feel pretty sure that the rest of the more Greek stuff is going to be amazing, so I guess eventually I'll break away from my favorite and try something else.Also, please make sure to read all the stuff about Harry, who recently died. You can't NOT like a place who loves their 100 yr old + employee as much as this place did. You just can't! Also, great patio.

39.description: I like this place alot. Good Greek chicken! Fresh Salads.I have eat in, carry-out many times.  I like their Low Carb menu.

37.description: Picked up some gyros and lemon rice soup. The lemon rice soup was a little thicker than home cooking but very delicious. Gyros was fresh and just the way I like it. The tzakiki sauce is not the best out there although tasty, I like mine super think like it would be made with sour cream or something. In any case, I really like this place. The food is always fresh and is served with a smile and the chicken everything is awesome!

0.description: This place been here for a long time they really have good food. Try out the Greek chicken special it's yummy!

38.description: i have been coming to this fine joint for over 10 yrs.  Good hot food served fast.  After a recent remodel this restaurant is always a safe bet.

51.description: We almost always order the Greek chicken special ($4.55, incl two leg/thighs, seasoned rice, potatoes & bread).  Combined with a Greek salad, there's enough for two.  Delicious.

27.description: There are a number of ver good places to hit in the area for this type of "real" fast food: West of Edens, Franks, Papa Chris, that Edens place on Cicero . . . but for me, my two go-to sandwiches are: (1) a polish and (2) a gyro.For my tastes, which obviously differ, East of Edens hits both of these in the right places.  My wife is an Italian Beef afficionado and East of Edens is also her favorite place too.

32.description: we heard god things about this place so we gave it a try...NEVER AGAIN!!! the gyro was the driest Ive ever had. The white gyro sauce was gritty like it had a powder base! The fries were dry as hell and cold. I really wanted to love this place but it was horrible....

54.description: Great Food! Cops are always there, so you know it has to be great food and a great deal. I've been going for the last 18 years. Family Business that has been serving up gyros and one of the  best hot dogs in the Chicago Area. Say hi to Gus, the owner, when you go in. They are really involved in the Sauganash-Edgebrook community. East of Edens is  truly a Sauganash staple.

48.description: I've tried this place twice (didn't want to give a bad review after one try), but I am not at all impressed.  I tried the chicken kabob sandwich once and the grilled chicken wrap another time, and both were EXTREMELY light on the meat.  The chicken wrap was really a lettuce wrap with maybe 1/4 of a breast of chicken.  Neither were very flavorful.  And the food is expensive, especially for the portions.  There are enough quality fast food and Greek diners in this town -- you can skip this one.

44.description: 4 words - Oven Baked Chicken Special - $4.95. C'mon son! No brainer.

24.description: Ehhhh I expected more from this greek fast food place. I ordered a burger that was over charred and flavorless.my husband ordered the fish sandwich, it was bland along with the non seasoned spinach pie. The only thing that was good was the cole slaw!Bland, bland food. I won't return.

7.description: Came here expecting to get some great fast food, but what we got was tired old reheated crap. We ordered the half Greek chicken and the Gyros plate and a side order of fries. Let's start with the Gyros the meat tasted sour like it was soaking in lemon juice and the cheap frozen fries were cold and inedible. The chicken which was supposed to be Greek but it was just dried out grilled chicken with some nasty lemon juice/sauce poured over the top of it, the bread that came with it was soggy and gross and the roasted potatoes tasted like reheated day old shit. The only redeeming quality of this meal is that oh wait there were no redeeming qualities it just sucked.

49.description: Excellent Greek-y spoon fast food; don't expect any creative grub. Slowish service but that was OK since the food was well prepared. You can find some good healthy choices here, too, including a nice grilled chicken breast on a pita with varied vegetables plus a side of rice. Their tzatziki sauce (Greek cucumber yogurt sauce) was just OK, nothing like The Works in Niles but again, everything else was really tasty and freshly prepared.  I will definitely be back when I have a taste for this kind of fast food.

40.description: These are the 5 words I say when I am ordering at the counter.  Oven Baked Chicken Legs Dinner, okay well maybe a few more words but this dish right here is my meal of choice.  It comes with 2 pieces of chicken legs (if i am lucky they might even have a straggler in there so ill end up with 3), potatoes, rice and a roll of bread.  But here is my trick that I love to do and I love how they can do it for me.  I replace the roll of bread with garlic bread, replace the potatoes with french fries and turn the chicken into BBQ chicken.  All for the same price of $4.95!  Add a water and you have got a perfect meal for anyone's budget!Sometimes I'd be full off half the meal and I could get a box to go and take the rest to go. The outdoor patio is perfect when summer/spring is here.  The same nice staff ever since I have been going here.

53.description: Part hot dog/hamburger joint with a big heaping side of Greek stuff. The specialties are their Greek style baked chicken, a true bargain. However, my favorite is the egg lemon soup and spinach pie, make sure you get some lemon wedges to drizzle on it.Hot dogs are pretty standard, the burgers are charred so they're a cut above most places like this and the fries are lightly seasoned.Overall, it's a three star place with an extra star for being open on Saturday until 9 and also Sunday I believe also till around 8 or 9, which in this neck of the woods is pretty rare, so it does deserve that extra star.

30.description: Very good tasty Ribs and lemon rice!

46.description: This place serves its purpose as the decent Greek place to go to in the area. I think Hubbs is better, but I could not wait any longer for Greek potatoes and rice. Opa.

1.description: This place has another location in the Skokie area (West of Edens) - you typically get to see some of the Skokie's/Niles' finest there, grubbing during lunch.  At this location, it is more of a cab driving crowd. The menu offers sandwiches (such as gyros sandwiches, chicken kabob, hamburgers, etc.), whole-roasted chicken, ribs, salads, Vienna Beef dogs (chili, jumbo, Polish, etc.), Italian Beef, Italian sausages, and even desserts.  I thought their gyros were pretty solid (kind of salty, well-cooked, generous with the tzatziki sauce); they have a small shared lot with the other businesses in the plaza, and it's right off of Cicero (Skokie Blvd turns into Cicero).  The service is great, efficient, and a lot of people do carry-outs.+salty gyros+generous tzatziki sauce

55.description: A pretty good Greek hotdog/gyro/etc type of place.  I would stop back if I was in the neighborhood, or hungry as I was going by on the Edens, but probably wouldn't go too far out of my way for it.

9.description: Chicago is full of Greek owned fast food restaurants and this might be my favorite of them all. I live about 10 minutes away and there's plenty of fast food options, between home and East of Edens, but I always skip the closer options and go to East of Edens. This isn't your staple burger and hot dog fast food joint. You come here for their chicken special, which is a great deal and a damn good meal as well. You come here for the gyros, one of the best in the city. You come here for fast food that is a little "nicer" than your usual fast food spots. It's the type of place that has cops from multiple CPD districts and suburban cops coming to for lunch and dinner. That is always a great sign of consistent quality food at a good value.

26.description: I picked up some carryout tonight. We had the Greek style chicken that comes with broasted taters and rice. I also got a small Greek salad that Mom and I split.The portions were plentiful, in fact Mom and I shared one chicken meal and shared the small salad and there was still plenty of salad left. The food was pretty good but not great. The rice was fairly average, but the chicken had a nice flavor and the taters were taters.The salad was refreshing. Aside from the usual feta cheese, olives, etc, they also put in one dolmates which was kinda cool. I could live on Greek olives. Wish there had been a few more.We seem to stop here every few years and I always make a mental note to stop again and then I forget about it. This time for sure!!!!!

25.description: Been coming here for years and its only because of the oven baked chicken special.  Everything else is extremely mediocre at best.  Oven baked chicken special runs you under 5.50 and its a good amount of food.  Rice and potatoes that accompany it are pretty good, but nothing to write home about.  The chicken is always good though.  I've had the gyro and its not very big or good.  Same goes with the burger.  If your getting a hot dog it's same Vienna you can get anywhere.  Your a rube if you don't  make the trip down Devon to Superdawg for your hot dog needs.  Shakes are decent.  As an overall it's been in business forever because of a pretty strong local following and its location at Devon and Cicero.  Parking stinks if your coming from any direction except East on Devon. The fries are awful so try to get another side with any dinner.  The fries are comically bad.   As a fast food spot your fries should always be solid and these just suck.  Worst Greek fast food in neighborhood in comparison with Backyard Grill, Dear Franks, Edens Fast Food and Papa Chris.  West of Edens is the exact same thing.  They do not have fountain drinks.  Decently cheap with good oven baked chicken are the only ups for the spot.Dusty

12.description: Oh yes.  I'm happy to say that East of Eden STILL has the best Greek chicken!  For $12, you'll get an entire chicken, rice, potato, soup/salad/or coleslaw and garlic bread.  It's a steal.  And deliciousThe spinach/feta pie and chicken pita are also some of my favorites here.  Walk down memory lane every time I come back here.  Love this place!

59.description: There is only one reason I go here...  The Greek Baked Chicken meal.  Grilled just right.  The skin of a grilled chicken is always the tastiest, but not here.  You can taste the flavor throughout the meat of the chicken.  Not too salty and not too oily. Fast and Great service.  If you need something quick, something healthy, something tasty...  Go here.  During the spring and summer time, you can take advantage of the outside seating and bask in the sun while eating a great meal.

21.description: My husband an I went out for lunch, we decided to  get burgers and fries. Both were good until we put ketchup on the fries. Don't use the bottled ketchup. Sour smelling. Ask for packets of ketchup.

17.description: Good food, decent value, and always a solid choice.I've been going for years and always come back for more. I've never had a bad experience there.  It's not fancy food but it's delicious and well worth the money!  My default choice for take out.

10.description: Delectable Oven Baked Chicken Legs Dinner.   Friendly Helpful Service.   Near Evanston.

5.description: Have lived down the street from here for 15 years, always loved their gyros. Got some carry-out today. WTH??? What have they done to their gyros sauce??? It's suppose to be yogurt & herbs, I have no clue what this was, other than HORRIBLE!! Time to go across the street...to bad...

3.description: My son and I just stopped here for a late lunch.  Great menu, excellent prices, and they made free garlic bread for my son.

35.description: Love the chicken kabob plate...with extra tzaztiki sauce on side.  Greek potatoes and rice...yum.  It's so good i go there every Monday to visit Niko who is the manager.  He's really sweet and will get you whatever you need.  BTW - their tzaztiki is made with yogurt so it's closer to the real thing, (like my ex's mom handmakes) not sour cream which is a cheaper way to make it - just sayin.  Nonetheless i love it.  I've had their gyros and chicken..all hot and fresh.  YUM...

19.description: Ehh.. I tried to really like this place and it's just dissapoints time and time again. I've ordered food here twice and picked it up since it's close to work. I usually don't like to venture out and try "new things" so I stick with ordering the Chicken breast on a pita. And I phone in my order twice and both times I've gone I've yet still had to wait additional time once I am there for it to be done. Kinda defeats the purpose of callin my order in ahead of time.. frankly the people on the phone aren't very friendly either .ANYWAY.. the Chicken breast on a pita does not wow me.  It's ok a bit dry and bland and usually a lil too char-broiled for me.  For being a greek place I expected something a lot more juicy! and flavorful.  I am on a sour note with this place since I've ordered not that long ago and got my order deliver and it was completely wrong after waiting an hour to get here they expected to me wait an additonal order to get my food correct?... Not a happy camper!! Really not sure if I say i'll never eat here again but it will be a while before I think about it again!!

45.description: East of Edens is my local go to place when I'm hungry and can't think of where else to go.  While that may sound like faint praise, East of Edens is actually pretty good.I can highly recommend the "Chicken Leg Special" plate.  I usually like chicken white meat instead of dark meat, but this plate is really good.  The chicken is cooked Greek style and is delicious.  They serve it with bread, roasted potatoes, and simmered rice.  If that is starch overload for you, you can sub steamed veggies for the rice or potatoes.Service is polite, if not friendly, and parking can always be found in the either the east lot or the bigger west lot.

33.description: I've been going to East of Edens for the last 15 year as I live near there.  At the end of the day, this place has a large menu for any type of customer.  The food is good and they always get my order right, which is awesome because I always have special orders.  This is my go to stop when I have no real desire to pick a place to eat but I am really hungry.

43.description: Not the best... but it's okay...

2.description: One of the best place around Chicago area! I tried gyros plate with salads and it was perfect. Good job guys!

18.description: Love love the chicken breast plate. The gyros are superb too. Prices are budget friendly.

41.description: Overall good and I have been coming here since they opened. Good hot dogs and steak sandwiches. My only complaint is that they have shrunk the size of the steak in the sandwiches. They also cut their chicken too thin where it is about the same thickness as a pita. i tried a chicken wrap which was about 90% lettuce with barely any meat. The food tastes good, I just wish they would get back to their old portions for meat. Maybe when the economy improves?

52.description: Good stuff, a nice place to sit down and eat.

50.description: Holy spinach Pie!!! This place is a Must if you're hungry for chicken or lemon rice soup.... Look I'm going to be very straight forward with you, everything else here is mediocre at best. Its Menu is no different than any of the other greek/hot dog joints on any other corner of any other Chicago neighborhood. Hot dogs... cant really screw those up Burgers ... they have the char grilled flavor you either like or you don't Gyros .... i wouldn't know a good one from a bad one. and the list goes on and on BUT!~!! They have the most incredible Special that gets over looked constantly by the average eater. The Chicken Special!! its 5 bucks... and you get two huge pieces of chicken, an overly generous portion of rice, three large Greek style potato slices and garlic bread!! Its the Pocket busting Price of the century (please note this is an extreme exaggeration, yet it really is a great deal)!! Moneys tight these days and you gotta eat, and if you're willing to make the drive over I highly recommend it because there just aren't many specials like this in the city, and when you find one, you have to hop on it!

4.description: We stopped here for an early dinner on our way out of town on a Thursday afternoon, and were able to deftly grab the last parking spot in the front lot.  Yay!  Note: despite the "carry-outs" at the end of the name, there's plenty of seating inside.Very old-world fast food Greek; the decor is a bit dated (the photo of the 102-year-old posing with Rahm Emanuel is pretty fun), but the food is everything I'd hoped for: saucy, tasty, Greek.    I had the chicken kabob platter and the chicken was CRAZY delicious.  Every bite was perfectly seasoned and juicy.  And as far as I'm concerned, when in Greece, eat the baklava.  So I did.  And I liked it.

6.description: New to the neighborhood snd looking for our go to spot  we were disappointed that although the food was ok the manager could not have cared less that we killed a roach on the wall right next to where we were sitting.   We won't go back there or to the sister store  West of Edens.

22.description: Oh yes.  I'm happy to say that East of Eden STILL has the best Greek chicken!  For $12, you'll get an entire chicken, rice, potato, soup/salad/or coleslaw and garlic bread.  It's a steal.  And deliciousThe spinach/feta pie and chicken pita are also some of my favorites here.  Walk down memory lane every time I come back here.  Love this place!

15.description: Order chicken special.Love their food, and the amount of the food that you get for the price is a great deal.

57.description: Umm... I've been going to East of Edens every once in a while for about four years. FUNNY STORY that happened to me today.. I managed to leave my keys where the people who are waiting for thier food sit. My friend and I go to our table for about 2 hours to talk and eat. As we were leaving I noticed the keys to my car/house were missing. As we looked around, they were nowhere to be found. I go to the counter to ask the man in his possible 70s and ask if he has seen a set of keys anywhere. He quickly responded "No." and walked away. Not very helpful... Didn't even seem to give a flying crap. Anyway, there were 3 staff members on thier break eating. As my friend and I search the place top to bottom, these guys keep glancing over at us and laughing... okay? Whatever, I didn't think much of it. As I see one of them get up and start speaking spanish to one a woman working the cash register with the old man. I see her look at us and take something from the man under the counter. My friend runs up there asking again did you find a set of car keys? And the old man answers again, "No, I told you before..." and as he was saying that my friend sees the black lanyard that was connected to my keys halfway shown from under the register. My friend grabs them and gives them to me.The ENTIRE staff knew they were my keys. I was making a huge scene about it the entire time, asking everyone if they have seen them. You may think, oh maybe they didnt know the keys were yours. They all knew they were, EVERYONE even the customers knew they were. The customers were 10 million times more helpful than the staff. I would never go there again. Unless they had an entirely new staff, or was under new management. Everyone can still go there, just dont leave your shit around because the assholes there are sketchy as fuhk.

20.description: I used to live near here, so it was a frequent stop on my way home from shopping at the mall at Touhy & Central. Just a slight detour required.  I only ever ordered the gyros, greek potatoes and avgolemono soup. Frequently they were out of the soup - it is pretty good. The gyros were good and very filling. The staff is friendly and fast.  What looks like it might be a long wait seldom is.  I wish I had a place like this close to where I now live.  Alas, my new neighborhood is a vast wasteland for food. I should have looked into that before moving!

36.description: I love you Greeks for giving us East of Edens. The food here is great, and the staff is always very friendly. I think you can order pretty much anything off the menu and you won't be disappointed. Gyros, french fries, hot dogs (Vienna's of course), chicken and rice, pitas, kabobs, you name it, it's all good.For the great quality of food the prices are very fair.It's a great place to bring kids and families, they have a really great clean atmosphere going on.

14.description: Amazing owners & all around an amazing hidden gem, with great food! The chicken gyro is to die for!

0.description: My experience with Wireless toyz is limited to accessories purchases.  I needed a battery for a Motorola phone which U.S. Cellular no longer carries, but! they still offer the phone.  Isn't that retarded! I know.  Well, I found the battery on the Internet for $60 dollars plus shipping.  I was able to find an aftermarket alternative here for $40 dollars and no shipping.  Great.I've also been able to pick up some other accessories like after market ear pieces and phone covers (aesthetically pleasing covers) for not alot of money.  I.E buying at a retail authorized store could cost you full price and the products wear and tear are about the same.  There is alot of product to look through.  Ask if you need help, I know the staff may look young, but typically in these types of stores the associate will be knowledgeable enough.  I also like that they are so young and not shark salesman like, that they allow you to look around on your own without much bother.

12.description: The neighborhood Dunkin Donuts is always a good thing.  Dunkin Donuts has these specials especially breakfast items.  The hash browns are tasty. I wish this Dunkin Donuts has a variety of donuts like the other locations.  I am happy with the speedy service, as is other yelpers I see.

3.description: This place is disgusting. Normally I wouldn't bother to write a review about a DD but this place was so bad I had to.  I stopped on my way home because I had a taste for a sunday. I ordered a hot fudge Sunday. The guy serving me didn't say they were out of hot fudge. Instead he just covered it in whipped cream and it wasn't until I took a bit that I realized there was no hot fudge.The other issue is that the place is absolutely filthy. I was going to sit down but every table was either covered in crumbs or dried coffee rings. There was also crumbs all over the floor. In the meantime, the three employees, one of whom turned out to be the owner, sat down in the corner and proceeded to have a very loud conversation about scheduling and setting hours. How about cleaning the place up? I will not come in here again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, even just for coffee.

1.description: I come here when the struggle can be real no longer. I need carbs, chocolate, and high fat content, stat. Which begs the question: How can you call them empty calories when they are in fact everything that calories should be? I also want to know why the world can feel like it is split into two categories when it comes to on-the-go coffee drinkers. It's Starbucks vs. Dunkin' Donuts out there, and I can feel it growing more vicious by the minute. Personally, I just find it hard to say no to the doughnuts. I like the coffee here just the same. My only thing with any DD location is how hot they serve their coffee. I usually eat my doughnuts in the privacy of my apartment, so I use the rest of the space in my coffee cup and fill it with cold milk from my fridge. Otherwise I feel like it will take 45 minutes to cool down. I like to drink coffee with my carbs! What's important is that the world would not be the same without Dunkin' Donuts. Drink on, my coffee drinkers! Indulge, my secret society of fitness freaks for carb binging!

2.description: This location is horrible. The service is horrible, they always over charge when they can and act as if your off when you call them on it and the topper was when they charged me $1.20 for cream cheese on a $1.29 bagel! If you order a sausage egg and cheese on a croissant watch for the hash brown up charge they include without asking you if you want it (4 pieces ) for buck extra.   They stopped honoring the $1.00 refills if you purchase the DD coffee cup. That was the reason for purchasing the thremo-mug that doesn't keep its contents warm for very long, for $9.99. It was part of the deal!  LolAfter dealing with this for a while I have decided to write about it here and move to another location!

9.description: I ordered an Iced Latte and the guy gave me iced coffee. I told him I ordered an Iced Latte and he took my iced coffee and put whipped cream on it and gave it back to me. On a different day, I ordered a coffee coolata and they gave me vanilla bean. I told the guy and he added something in it that made it darker but tasted nothing like a coffee coolata.

10.description: Slow staff, whom always ask for your order, and then later ask you to repeat it another one to two times.  Pay attention, son!!!Convenient in that it's on the way to school.  No drive thru, and the staff annoys me. Tiny parking lot.Only when I'm desperate for Joe will I stop.

4.description: As far as neighborhood Dunkin Donuts go this place is at the bottom of the ladder. Out of the yogurt that's necessary to make smoothies. Out of long straws for my large iced coffee. Out of half the flavor a of donuts (understandable at this point of the day) I feel bad for the employees who had to tell every customer who ordered something that what they wanted wasn't available. Guess they just expect people to order coffee.

6.description: Terrible, ordered hot chocolate and it was disgusting. I noticed the worker making hot chocolate with hot water and powder like you would do at home, I asked her what's up with the machine and she stated that it was out of order but it would taste the same. When I got to work and tasted it it was terrible. I ordered 3,what a waste of $8. Never again will I go here.

15.description: I particularly like this D&D because it's one of the honest ones that doesn't water down the coffee.  My test to coffee honesty is the whether or not you can see the bottom of the coffee cup.  If you see the bottom, you have weak coffee.  The staff got my order correct. They have 2 lines.  An order line and a pick-up line.  I wish other D&Ds would catch on to this user friendly method of food distribution.

0.description: No drive-through so I went into the store to get my wakeup coffee. The staff who took my order was fast and friendly while there was another girl making my coffee. Good and fast service.

5.description: I like this location okay. It gets kind of busy in the mornings but they seem to be able to take the order, give the customers their coffee and get them out the door pretty quickly. I've never been in their line long enough to start looking at my watch, irritated and worried I'll be late for work, so that is a plus. Also, they make my lattes just the way I like them, strong and not too milky. This Dunkin' Donuts is also conveniently located 1 block from my job, making it very easy to stop for my hot cup of joe every morning. The one awkward thing about this location is the parking lot. It is angled very strangely and pretty difficult to get in and out of. Otherwise perfectly good service and a clean Dunkin' Donuts.

13.description: The only reason this Dunkin' Donuts/Baskin - Robbins  is always busy is the location.  Tons of city/construction workers since it's right on the corner of Elston and Cicero.  Honestly I only go when my Mom is visiting from Iowa because she's so excited there's a Baskin Robbins close to my house! The popularity is definitely not due to the friendliness of the employees.  I have seen them ignore customers who were being nothing but polite and patient. The workers definitely gave me the feeling that they were doing me a favor.  Adding to the problem is the parking lot.  The corner parking lot is horrible, hard to park/back out and full of potholes. 2 stars for location, recent remodeling and cleanliness.

11.description: quick n easy. parking lot is lil but so close to the highway so that alone give it 4 stars

8.description: Fun & friendly staff.

14.description: The staff is lighting fast with my order every time I go there. They are quick and efficient. The only down fall is they are constantly up selling. If you ask for a coffee and donut, they come back with okay large coffee? And you want two donuts?

7.description: The owner was real nice but I think he needs to keep an eye on that Hispanic woman working for him.  I was behind her two sons and she was scooping a milkshake for them and she put in an excessive amt of ice cream.  The one son asked for extra extra bacon on his sandwich.  I hope the owner figures out she's ripping him off so he doesn't have to raise his prices.

3.description: First time visit today. It's very clean and I absolutely loved it. My pedicure is great. Tammy was very nice and professional. I will definitely be returning.

1.description: I rarely get mani/pedi's but as the warm weather approaches, I decided now was a good time to get one done. The only time I had available was on a holiday Good Friday and knowing that these places get busy especially around holidays, I decided to call and make an appointment. One would think if you do this - you will be guaranteed a spot. Well apparently not here. I made an appointment for 2:00 pm as I was getting out of work early and had plans later that evening. On my way there, traffic was beginning to get backed up so I called to let them know that I MAY be a few minutes late (I wasn't) The person that answered the phone said.."No, Problem, we're here waiting for you." When I arrived, I saw a disproportionate number of nail technicians vs. customers. There was only one person doing a mani and 3 others were working on manicures (which by the looks of it - looked like they had just gotten started) They seemed to know I was the 2 o'clock appointment because they asked If I had made the appointment- I said yes and they asked me to pick a color. After ten minutes of waiting and no more acknowledgement, I had to speak up to remind them that I HAD made an appointment - one of the ladies said it will be 15 more minutes..(on top of the 10 I had already waited)- I could understand if I was a walk-in and had to wait..but that is why I had called ahead to schedule an appointment. I had things to do and really couldn't afford to wait. Not to mention that IF they were running behind, she could've told me over the phone when I called but instead she made it seem as though they were ready for me for when I arrived.  Not sure why they would choose to neglect someone's scheduled appointment being that  nail salons are a dime a dozen in this city and I walked out and found one on Peterson Ave that could accommodate me right away.

2.description: New owners after C n D Nails. Very young, owner not on site. Limited staff available. Technician needed to get home because family was waiting for him for dinner. He turned off the lights, met his wife in their car, locked up and told me to come back the next day and he would finish. I was sent home with no polish! I called before I went in to see how late they'd be open. They said to come in now, please. They said they'd be open until 3:00 (Thanksgiving) but shut the doors at 2:00.I will never go back again. Three or four other nail salons in neighborhood, some cheaper. Not nearly the only game in town.

0.description: I came in for a mani with the boyfriend's mom and was pleasantly surprised with the results. They have a good selection of colors and worked quickly and professionally. They even throw in a shoulder and neck massage, which is always quite lovely. We were there first thing in the morning so they weren't super busy, but I'd love to come back later in the day so I can double up and stop in to East of Edens next door.

4.description: my girlfriend and I went to Chicago for a weekend to attend a wedding.  she needed her nails done, but since we do not know the area too well, a good friend recommended Paradise Nails and so our journey begins.  I was just to drive her there and wait until she is done, but she talked me into getting a Pedicure and Manicure with her.  to be honest this is my first time getting something like this done so really did not know what to expect.  the person who did my Pedicure and Manicure's name was Trang.  she was really nice and very professional.  I really like the fact that this Salon prizes themselves on cleanliness. before she started my Pedicure she brought over a bag of utensils/equipment (not sure what's it called) in a sealed sanitized bag. I thought that what she was going to do might hurt but it was the total opposite.  the feeling of getting your cuticle cut was surprisingly relaxing.  And the massages (the best part)!  I did not know that the services you are paying for comes with a foot, hand and shoulder massages.  the people who gave us the massages had really strong arms and did a really great job.  my girlfriend and I was definitely satisfied and would come back when visiting Chicago.  It's too bad that we are from st. Louis and will not be able to come often but still wanted to share our wonderful experience with everyone.

3.description: My newborn son was having difficulty breastfeeding. He had a lip and tongue tie that we had taken care of by a pediatric dentist but still didn't seem to get it quite right. One session of crania sacral therapy and it made a HUGE difference. I've been taking him ever since... fantastic and comprehensive chiropractic care, wonderful massage, and a helpful staff that takes time to get to know you and serve you the best way possible. My family loves Sauganash Wellness Center!

1.description: I can't praise this place enough!  Dr. D and her staff are always ready to care of my aches and pains - which happens often!  I try to avoid meds as much as possible, and I've tried many of their holistic approaches: massage, acupuncture, graxton, rolfing, cupping, etc.  Each therapist is accommodating, and they listen intently to your needs to make sure you're taken care of.

2.description: I went in to see Rachel for a pre natal massage. I'd been struggling with neck pain and sciatic pain for two trimesters.....and nothing was relieving my pain. I was able to get in on a Saturday, quickly! I can not begin to describe how wonderful she was. This was my first pre natal massage and she walked me through all the details. She was smart, funny, professional and very resourceful. I am pleased to say I have not had any additional pain since my massage and I'm in to my third trimester. If I ever have the need (or just want a great massage) I will definetly be back to see her!!!

9.description: I was looking for a new chiropractor in my area, and I was sold on the glowing reviews already on Yelp enough to give them a try, (and also they accept my insurance.)  Everyone I've encountered so far has been totally professional yet super friendly and caring.  Dr. D is gentle yet thorough, and I found both her and Rob very personable.  I just had my first professional massage from Rob, and it was so relaxing, I joked that I should've brought a designated driver!  Seriously, I was slurring my speech a little afterward.  I imagine that whether you're a newbie like me or a seasoned massage client, you'll find the services more than satisfying.  Ok, gonna go nap now!

10.description: I love love LOVE this place!I could write a song about it...if I was a songwriter. But since I'm not, I will do the next best thing. I will tell the world about the awesomeness of this place!Like a lot of people, I work in front of a computer from 9-5, which lead me to have some crazy back problems. So I looked for the closest chiropractor in my area that accepted my insurance, and that's how I came to find the Sauganash Wellness Center. And what a find it was!!!They provide a wide array of services but I personally go for the massage therapy & chiropractic adjustments. Initially, I was always skeptical about getting massaged... something about having a stranger see and touch me while I lay half naked on a table kinda gave me the creeps. Not here!!! This place has a great vibe, it's kinda like I'm visiting an old friend. No akward silences or judgments here! Although the whole staff is great,  I usually go to Rachel or Rob for my massages. Not for nothing but they are the shiet! Seriously. This is no frou-frou massage spot. They go deep down and find the root of the problem, then attack it head on.  I also find them to be quite entertaining! Then after my muscles are relaxed Dr. D (the coolest chiropractor in the world) sets everything back into place. I won't lie, I'm usually super sore the day after. But in truth this place has made a HUGE difference for me. I always feel great afterwards and they really do make my pain go away. Aside from their excellent services and know-how, I have to say my favorite thing about this place is the people. EVERYONE is super nice and friendly. Always with a smile, a joke and a story. It's a really inviting atmosphere and it seems to me that they really love what they do. You have to experience it for yourself to see what I'm saying!Magic hands all around!!!

4.description: I am an idiot and injure myself in amazingly ridiculous ways. My latest injury is an angry calf muscle caused by getting wrapped up in my sheets and falling out of bed. Yup. I knew after it wasn't healed after a few weeks that I'd need to reach out and get some medical attention. As I didn't want drugs to mask the pain and wasn't quite sure if I was up to physical therapy yet, I sought out someone I knew would help me on the way to healing. Enter Sauganash Wellness Center and its incredible staff to the rescue (again). Deanna looked me over, confirmed that I was an idiot (actually she just laughed with me), gave me an amazing Chiropractic adjustment and then sent me off for a massage to help my poor sore muscles. After my half- painful, half- wonderful massage, she created art on my calf with some Kineseo Tape. I left feeling sore in a good way, versus the aching sore I'd been feeling for weeks. The tape has been helping a lot today and I look forward to our next session in a few days. I know she'll have me at least back to 70% by the time of Riot Fest. My rock n' roll savior.

6.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  They actually CARE about the people in pain.  It's refreshing to see that atmosphere- as opposed to the places that only care about taking on extra services so they can up the bill.I feel amazing each and every time I come here and HIGHLY recommend it to anyone who can get out this way.  My suggestion is an adjustment with Dr. D and then a full hour massage.  You will thank me for suggesting it.

12.description: I am so glad I found this place during my pregnancy! And I still go for regular adjustments.  Dr. D is the best! And Rachel is the best massage therapist I've ever had. I went weekly during my last trimester and it was heaven. They have those beds with the cutout for the belly (which I hesistated at first) but they are amazing!!! I highly recommend this place.

5.description: I've noticed recently that my bad posture and habits have caused my back to be sore and stiff.  Being a stressful person doesn't help either :|Anyways, I procrastinated for a long time to find a place that would work on my sore muscles and get me aligned.Using this fabulous app, I was able to find this place.  I feel fantastic so far! They really work you over with deep tissue and trigger point work.  So far I've seen Rachel, and boy is she a tough cookie! Love it!!! Dr. D is a fantastic adjuster as well. She is quick and gentle.  I noticed that she is certified in a lot of other things so I'm excited for any future issues or ailments!!

11.description: I went to the Sauganash Wellness Center to get a prenatal massage.  The massage was good but not the best I've had.  The Massage therapist was polite, attentive and had the right amount of pressure so I would give her 5 stars if I could separate that from the environment.  The office is very clinical, which makes sense because they do more than just massages.  However, it wasn't very relaxing.  I could also hear people talking in the halls while I was getting my massage.  The area was a bit cramped which isn't terribly relaxing.  I arrived at 5 for my massage and, by the time I went to the bathroom (which is essential for a prenatal massage!), filled out the forms, was led to the room and undressed, I had cut about 10-15 minutes off of my hour massage.  The therapist stopped just shy of 6 which made my hour massage about 40-45 minutes.  I'm surprised that they didn't tell me to get there early and/or account for that time somehow (like other places do).  So, while it was overall a good massage, I probably won't go there again.  The prices were the same as much better places.  I do have to say that the actual massage was great.  It's a shame that everything else detracted from the whole experience.

8.description: I have been going here for over a year, and I LOVE this place!  I found them after I moved to Sauganash.  I had a few-months-old baby at the time and my neck/back was paying for it!  Hours of carrying him around and bending over were causing me to have all sorts of aches and pains.  I always go for the 'combo plan', when you go in and get all loosened up and relaxed by a powerful massage (I usually see Rob, but have seen 2 other massage therapists there, and they're all great!).  Once your muscles have been de-knotted, I go see Dr. D, the chiro, to perform the adjustment.  Now let me say, going in I was soo nervous about the adjustment part, because, I dunno, just because.  So I told Dr. D that it made me nervous, specifically the neck-crack-part.  She still remembers and is very gentle and has never made me feel like my head is going to make a complete 360.  The adjustment is so wonderful, it honestly feels like your whole body/spine/skeleton just 'fits' better than it did before you walked in the door.As much as we all like a massage and a relaxed back, it can be pretty pricey to take care of it.  Unless you have insurance and Sauganash Wellness Center accepts it, like they do mine.  This is the only reason I can continue to go regularly.  So nice!!Definitely try this place.  You will be so so happy you did!

0.description: Best part of the office that attracted me here was the tables for pre natal massage. They offer a cut out for your belly so you can lie face down which is the most amazing thing when you're pregnant. I have been seeing Kevin for my pre-natal massages and his work compares to no other massage I've had before. It's very clinical but at the same time he provides a very calming and relaxing atmosphere. I've had plenty of massages at different places and it almost always just feels like a routine massage, which can be relaxing but you walk out feeling the same. Kevin provides a lot of detail and care to areas of concern and he was very educated on pre natal massage just over all anatomy. I bought the series of 5 and received a 6th free which is a great offer. The woman at the front desk is also very friendly, makes is easy to book appointments!

7.description: I saw Janet yesterday for a prenatal massage and she was awesome!!! Would for recommend her and this facility to anyone!!!

28.description: For 5 dollar lunch, you get soup, egg roll or HOMEMADE crab rangoon, a can of pop and chicken, pork or SHRIMP fried rice along with your entree. I highly recommend the Mongolian Beef or Garlic Chicken. This is one of the best Chinese stops around.

1.description: First day was awesome, second time was rough around the edges.Seems all their beef combos are good, but their sesame, and General tsao chicken have an odd flavor unlike any other Chinese place I've been too. I would never order either of them again, but that's just my taste buds saying no. Their crab rangoons were great first time, second time didn't taste as good, the sweet and sour chicken were very hard, not edible, but we called and they were nice to give us credit for the next time we visit. Next to try the sweet and sour wings that look good. I'll update a review on the 3rd try. Again, as far as the sesame and tsao, it could be an acquired taste others like. However, that was also over cooked on my second visit making it difficult to eat.

9.description: i work in the area and have ordered from here regularly over the years. i have never once been disappointed. chinese food tends to get a bad rap, but this place really sets the standards. ive had a wide variety from here, but my favorite is the mongolian beef and any of the egg foo young. they are sensational - great flavor, lots of beef and vegetables, fried rice is good too, the egg foo young is a hearty portion with gravy that is to die for. they have great lunch specials too, all of which include choice of soups or rolls, come with soda, and fried rice, all for about $5/$6. and in addition to all this, the delivery is always very quick and on time.

29.description: Okay so my favorite neighborhood (Linn's Garden) Chinese Take-Out closed, so a friend recommended this place..."HUNAN SPRING"Now there will NEVER be a place that has better eggrolls than Linn's, but this place gets the job done when I'm too tired to cook, don't want pizza (my husband could eat it every night, ugh) and craving some good ole' Chinese.Prices are very reasonable. We only get delivery-and it is FAST!!Our usuals are: Beef Fried Rice, Cashew Chicken, Beef Egg Foo Young, and they have an excellent (and healthy) Steamed Chicken & Veggies (no gravy please!). Pretty good Hot & Spicy Soup, also.I do miss Linn's Garden but Hunan Spring has done well as a close second.

23.description: this place used to be great.  but last night we ordered the usual items and they were awful.  this place has 'jumped the shark'. egg rolls were 85% celery.  shrimp w black bean sauce was mostly onions.  this means they are substituting good quality for just cheap ingredients.  so buyer beware.

5.description: This is not amazing Chinese. I would not take a trip just to get this food. However, if you're looking for some Fast Food Chinese, this place fits the bill perfectly. The food is cheap, fast, and not bad. It's nothing to write home about, but good in a pinch. If you live in the area, it's worth checking out.

31.description: Super cheap, and always high quality.  Hunan Spring has great weekday lunch specials crammed with food.  Favorites include Buddhist Delight, Cashew Chicken, Curry Chicken, and egg roles.

25.description: Pretty good for the price. I've always had delivery only. We order there pretty often and it's cheap with lots of fresh ingredients.My new fav. is the General Tso Tofu (greasy good but in tofu form, :p)They do not have any fish or Chinese vegetable, but overall, the food is decent.

12.description: Best Chinese food ever!!! love the chicken and string beans, the crab rangoon and the shrimp fried rice!The delivery times are fast and the food arrives HOT!I order from here every week, the food is consistent and the prices are reasonable.

21.description: I agree the Vegetable Dumplings here are delicious. Spring Rolls are deep fried. Not what I had mind. Good neighborhood place for delivery or pick up.

16.description: I've finally found THE best in Chinese food! Their steamed pot stickers are heaven! They are made with a ground pork that has been seasoned well and mildly spicy..not just just some bland lump of ground pork. The Mongolian chicken has a perfect amount of heat and VERY flavorful. Their meat entrees actually have meat and NOT just loaded up with veggies! Even though the veggies are a perfect crisp tender texture. The egg foo young is separate from the gravy..so it stays tasty as oppose to soggy.  Everything is super FRESH and oh so delicious! I do not like their egg and spring rolls..but a LOT of their dishes are very delicious! I will definitely be a regular customer. I'm addicted!

17.description: I used tolive very close and could stop in here right from the train. I had a taste one night for just fried rice and egg foo young - things I seldom ever order, but it was one of those times I craved it. The counter person was VERY rude saying "the chefs do not like cooking this because it is such a cheap meal, they will nto be happy with this order." Well, #1, i was a prety regular customer there, and my regular bill was never "cheap". #2 I did not know I was supposed to make the chefs happy - I thought I was supposed to order what I wanted to eat. #3 if they don't like cooking it - be one of the only places that don't have it on the menu. I stopped going there after that. The food was not bad, not great - standars, average chinese take-out.

10.description: It changed management about 5 or 6 years ago so the taste for my favs have changed. However, I do make my specific requests to the kitchen and they always deliver. The Crab Rangoon is just a bit on the sweeter side but that's what makes it delicious, gotta have! The sesame noodle appetizer is a must for us, as well as Green Beans in garlic white sauce(off the menu). I also ask for Sesame Tofu instead of Chicken. The veg. fried rice is good, the Flat Noodle stir fry a bit oily but still yum.

11.description: As a Chinese , I know what americanized Chinese food is, but this is probably the worst I ever had, the only thing they can cook is rice.

26.description: Hunan Spring is an all right place for Chinese food.  Wife and I just moved in the neighborhood recently, and have been ordering from different Chinese Restaurants to find a good, decent, close one.  And this one fits the bill.  It's close, food is okay, delivery to the house was pretty fast, and prices were pretty reasonable.  One dish that we liked from our recent orders was the Chow Mei Fun (sp?), which I believe you can order with beef, chicken, etc.  The noodles had a nice smoky, wok fired taste.  Overall, good food (for what's around), okay service, okay prices.

27.description: We love this place.  We probably order from there about once a month - either pickup or delivery.  There's really not a dine-in option as they only have a few chairs.The food is tasty, and theirs a wide variety on the menu - thou we usually stick to the following items:The sweet and sour chicken, schezwan chicken, & orange beef.  The portions are big enough that we almost always have enough for a second meal from the leftovers.It's our favorite local Chinese take-out food.

0.description: Pleasantly surprised by the delicious fixings this tiny restaurant served up; it doesn't exactly exude the kind of ambiance that says "our food tastes great", but it did.As a *mostly* vegetarian, I started drooling at the sight of orange tofu on their menu, and it more than lived up to my expectations. Add to that some delicious green beans and spicy/garlic eggplant, and I was a happy camper.Entrees were all $6.95, and they even threw in a little container of steamed broccoli. What more could you ask for?

20.description: My wife and I ordered delivery last night. The crab rangoons looked like they were under a heat lamp all day, they weren't crunchy at all. There wasn't much crab in them either, it was mostly all an odd, liquidy cream cheese. My moo shu pork was 95% cabbage and they forgot the plum sauce. My wife liked her mapo tofu well enough, though.We probably won't order from there again. Is there a good Chinese or Thai place in Jefferson Park?

19.description: Pretty good for the price. I've always had delivery only. We order there pretty often and it's cheap with lots of fresh ingredients.My new fav. is the General Tso Tofu (greasy good but in tofu form, :p)They do not have any fish or Chinese vegetable, but overall, the food is decent.

2.description: If you're looking for a great, affordable Chinese take out go-to I would definitely give Hunan Spring a try! My family and I have been ordering from here for over 12 years now and we have yet to be disappointed. We were ordering so often at one point that they began to notice when I changed my hairstyle, so sufficed to say we have been dedicated customers. Prices have gone up over the years but not by much, and regardless of what other reviews say I can vouch for the taste and quality of the food. Personal favorites include Crab Rangoon, Chicken Lo Mein, Chicken with Broccoli, Egg Rolls,... basically everything we order :)

13.description: Have been looking for a Chinese place in the area. This is a wonderful hole in the wall. When we walked in the the smells were amazing and only made me more hungry. The crab Rangoon was wonderful. Portions were great and the price was right on. Can't wait to go back.

4.description: If Panda Express had a larger menu, I think you could easily compare it to Hunan Spring. This is clearly Chinese Fast Food. If you were ordering from here to expect something authentic, then it would come as no surprise to me that you were let down. I believe I am a food addict. I try not to discriminate. Hunan Spring leaves me with mixed feelings.First of all, The restaurant seems family owned. Anyone who feels like they have received bad service from this place is right to do so. To be empathetic, I would say that the employees you see working the register or delivering your food are probably not paid what they're worth. I could expand here, but at the risk of anyone thinking that I am forming stereotypes, I am going to leave it alone. The rest of the reviews on here pretty much back up my observations anyway.Aside from what anyone else says, it's decent food. I even think their egg rolls are decent. I've had the following: Shrimp in lobster sauce, sesame chicken, chicken wings, fried squid, Cashew Chicken, and crab rangoon. All of it is decent except for the sesame chicken. It's practically all breading, and it tastes like the orange chicken from Panda Express. The chicken wings, which I had hoped would arrive in a spicy sauce, were just friend chicken wings. Don't bother. The fried squid is my favorite. I think most people might find it gross though. If you have it delivered, then you need to take it out of the box right away. Leaving it in the container will allow it to get soggy. Seriously, open it up as soon as you close the door on the delivery guy/girl. The squid comes with this awesome sweet and spicy sauce that rivals any sweet and sour sauce. I'd almost make the clerks give you a container of that for your egg rolls. If you pick up your order of squid from the restaurant right as it comes out of the kitchen, and you rush it home, it's even crispier.I am pretty relaxed when it comes to these things, but I have to keep it real: One time I did find a thick black hair in my food. I really think the guys in the kitchen are way too comfortable because they are working for family and they don't have to worry about losing their jobs; which probably makes up for the lack of pay. I've even seen the cooks working the kitchen with their street jackets on because there was obviously no heat turned on in the restaurant. Seriously though, they need to keep their hair out of the food. I have gone back since then. I do inspect my food before eating it. I'd advise you to do the same.

24.description: So after a night at the circus and my 7 year old niece bouncing off the walls due to a high amount of cotton candy intake I decided we needed to eat something that was 99% sugar. My niece wanted Chinese food which, not my first choice but who is to argue with a girl coming down from a serious sugar high. Being late and confused from the time change we landed at Hunan Spring. I wanted some thing a little lighter and healthier then the typical Chinese fair so I opted for a spring roll and broccoli in garlic sauce. My niece being a 7 year old likes meat on a stick, egg rolls and white rice. I know very healthy but at this point what does it matter. Spring Roll was fried and not very good. My niece only took two bites of her egg roll but devoured the teriyaki chicken. I also had one and although it is fried it was good just a little greasy. The broccoli was perfect just enough sauce and it wasn't to heavy. My niece now sits a little calmer since she has a belly full of white rice and chicken making me one very happy aunt.

6.description: We have been ordering from here for several years.   The food is excellent and the service is terrific.   Delivery is fast and the food comes hot.  The egg rolls are my favorite.

22.description: This is a pretty good little spot we work with in walking distance and I will be frequenting this establishment often. This is more of a take out spot, but if It is not busy there are 2-3 tables where you can sit and enjoy some food. I had Mongolian chicken which was very good I suggest you try this instead of the beef.

15.description: My wife and I ordered delivery last night. The crab rangoons looked like they were under a heat lamp all day, they weren't crunchy at all. There wasn't much crab in them either, it was mostly all an odd, liquidy cream cheese. My moo shu pork was 95% cabbage and they forgot the plum sauce. My wife liked her mapo tofu well enough, though.We probably won't order from there again. Is there a good Chinese or Thai place in Jefferson Park?

7.description: Sesame chicken was too spicy. Fried rice and egg roll were just okay. Bill seemed high.  Just one table but that didn't bother me.

8.description: Great Chinese place, its cheap, staff is friendly and they have outstanding food! I usually get a small kung pao chicken spicy and it sure was plus I ordered an appetizer of fried squid but they called me back saying they were sold out : ( It's my favorite dish there but at least the called right away to tell me. So I substituted the squid for their house crab Rangoon and asked if I can get the dipping sauce for the squid and they obliged. Sometimes the orders take a while because its a small place so you just have to have some patience. 4.5 starts I give it

30.description: I had lunch today.  I ordered the Orange Chicken.  It was ok.  I also received a egg roll with the lunch.  I didn't care for the egg roll, it didn't contain much meat(shrimp or otherwise).I may go back to try a different dish.

3.description: Absolutely NO!  Every time i order from here the chicken taste more like tofu than actual meat. I used to live one block from this place and decided to walk there instead or ordering delivery.   Its very small and they have a huge fan blowing in the restaurant, i can only imagine whats being blown into the food. My daughter broke out from the sesame chicken and she is NOT allergic to anything.  My Mongolian beef was ok except order it without onions since that is what they fill it with. The chicken fried rice i threw out. once again.... tofu. I would rather spend $10 in delivery fee and tip then order from here agian.

14.description: Love this place for cheap, last minute meals in the neighborhood, especially for lunch.   They cook fast and everything is good!  My 2 yr old loves the beef lo mein noodles and I like the kung pao.Typical customer service for these types of small Chinese spots.

58.description: What a PLEASANT surprise. I hadn't been to the place in over 20 years. Wasn't sure what to expect. It was 100% incredible. There was a piano player all night. Often joined by an opera singer. The food was GREAT and affordable! Each entree also came with soup or salad which I think is a super swell touch. The wine was great and also affordable. Did I mention they have a PARKING LOT!

56.description: Solid, old-fashioned Italian food. The owners sing happy birthday to the guest of honor if requested and they are very good and do it elegantly since they sing it in opera version.  The risotto is consistently good, sticky not watery and flavorful with the right amount of cheese. The lemon chicken was great but it needed some sides to go with it. I have never been here for private events so I can attest to the bad reviews for the food in functions.  I usually do Maggiano's for parties larger than 10 so everyone can enjoy the family style menu and the tasty food. The desserts are ok but nothing out of the ordinary except for the cheese cake. Even the family recipe carrot cake is just ok.

42.description: My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night to cash in a Groupon.  With full-blooded Sicilian heritage, I was excited to try the place.  Unfortunately, the experience was very hit-or-miss. The pros: Ambiance - interesting, Sicilian-related wall hangings and art in the dining room, a live piano player and opera singers, old family photos in the lobby. It was a little strange that there were very few 2-seater tables.  With a reservation, we got put in the back of the room right next to the kitchen (which could be due to using a Groupon, but probably more to the fact that they seem to cater to families and groups) There were no more than 3 happy birthday opera sing-alongs in the dining room.  Of the food, I can give high ratings to the warm loaf of bread they bring to the table, the mini arancini appetizer, and my entree, a spinach and ricotta ravioli with meat sauce, which the restaurant host insisted the chefs were frantically preparing from scratch earlier in the day.  My boyfriend's minestrone soup was good as well.  The red sauce was decent, although nothing to write home about.The cons: Our server made a couple of major faux pas - bringing our entree while completely forgetting to bring out our soup and salad, and bringing me the wrong entree.  (To be fair, she claimed to be new, but still). When we did get our apps, the salad lettuce was wilted and had brown spots on it (the kind that appear when the lettuce sits in the bag too long without using it) -it definitely was not fresh.   My boyfriend liked his chicken saltimbocca but it was too salty for my taste.    The "hard" breadsticks on the table were weird.  They were tough and I wasn't sure what their purpose was.  We left stuffed, so obviously we ate well.  They definitely do a few things well, but I get the sense they put more of their attention into the "experience" of dining there, and less toward the details of the actual food.

23.description: This is truly a great dining experience; from the live music being played during dinner to the exceptional waiting staff, Monastero's is hands down one of best Italian restaurants in the State.Everything was prepared to perfection...reminded me of my time spent in Italy years ago and how unforgettable the food was anywhere I went throughout the country.  The chicken risotto is to die for...so many great dishes to choose from...and all the ones I sampled that evening were off the charts.I can't wait to return and dine again.  Kudos to Maria and her family!

47.description: My now husband and I had our wedding here 6/17/12 and let me tell you all the wedding has been over for a week and I am STILL receiving compliments. People told my parents this was the best wedding they had been to in a while. People were asking me if they did other types of parties (THEY DO!) and to give them info on the venue because they just loved it all! The food was great service was great and Maria the owner and my coordinator was AMAZING!! She is one of the most genuinely nicest people I have had the honor of meeting. She honestly made everything LESS stressful. Everything went so smoothly. Roberto Monastero did our music and had all the guests dancing. He got people on the dance floor that NEVER dance. We would not have changed a thing. We had our ceremony and reception in the garden room and it was so beautiful. The prices were amazing too! They even did our cake which was a to die for tiramissou that had people asking where we had it made. (Made in house!) Could not have chosen a better place. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

8.description: What can I say about Monastero's?  A LOT!Monastero's is a wonderful place that has been around for quite a long time and it should. They have the best attentive service from the parking attendants, to the servers, the best bartender Paulo (sp?) and the owners. This place is amazing! The restaurant itself is beautiful (and has been family owned since 1962)While I have been here for a banquet, wedding reception and class reunion, I have nerver sat in their dining room. I usually sat at the bar for dinner because our great friend Paulo bartends and serves us. I can never make up my mind on what to order because everything sounds so delicious. My favorite is the 'Pasta Rustica' with salmon. It is out of this world. And let me tell you they are quite generous with the salmon. I just love the food and the service. After dinner, he recommends an expresso with Sambuca. Yum!A short time ago I was teher and lost a silver earring that had sentimental value to me. I was 100% sure that it was there. I called and a very nice lady spoke to me and assured that it would be found. I asked her name and it was none other than Mrs. Martha Monastero. She knew who I was and indicated what a pleasure it was to have us dining there. Here she was complimenting me when they are the ones to compliment. So here it is to Monastero's ... Thank you!

31.description: Great Sicilian style restaurant. Excellent service and very clean.  Minestrone was solid.

34.description: I went for a wedding ceremony and reception and it was yummy! Definitely want to go back to eat at the restaurant!! Maybe for Father's day?! we'll see....

16.description: This neighborhood Italian restaurant used to be an interesting "oldie but goodie" which sometimes held special events like live opera singers and wine-making celebrations. Over the years they offered standard Italian fare which was unremarkable but tasty enough. The oldie ambience was nice and the service was fine. ... Until this week. Recently Montastaros started offering $10.00 Tuesday Pasta nights, when customers could order pasta off the regular menu for $10.00 (for a  $16.00-$20.00 pasta dish). Six of us friends went together and most of us ordered pasta dishes from the regular menu, for the discounted price of $10.00. When the food arrived, two of us, who had ordered the same dish, found it to be tasteless and overcooked. The waitress called the manager to our table when we told her we were not happy with our food. The manager informed us that she was the owner's wife and said, "What can you expect for $10.00???!!!! "I will get you something else." One of us said to remove the food and said that he did not want anything else. I said that I did not like the food but I would eat it anyway. (I was not willing to wait another 20 minutes for a new dish.) Lo and behold-15 minutes later a freshly cooked preparation of the same dish was brought to my friend although he had not asked for it. But he was hungry, and decided to eat it anyway. It was nicely prepared and tasted nothing like the first one brought to us. IN ADDITION - Two people ordered lamb chops from the regular, non discounted menu and after waiting a long time the waitress told us they just ran out of the last 2 lamb chops. When we questioned the Owners Wife about why they ran out of food at 6:00pm when there were only 3 tables of people in the restaurant she told us they had run out the day before. WHY was the staff not informed so they could tell their customers at the time they tried to order?  WHY did the Owners Wife charge my friend for the dish he said he did not want? (Yes, he ate it, but that is not the point.  That dish should have been "comped").  But the damage was done due to the Extreme Rudness on the part of the Owner's Wife who implied that customers should expectlesser quality food if they take advantage of Monostaros promotions.To Owner's Wife- A RecipeIngredients1 Apology1 question about what can be done for the customer2 fresh dishes, comped3 waitstaff with knowledge of what the kitchen is out of1 smileDirectionsCombine ingredients. Stir with appreciation for customers who have dined with you  for many, many yearsCheck back to determine if all is well

13.description: Our first visit to Monastero's was for Valentine's Day.   After an hour and a half we left when we still had not received our main courses.  The waitress kept insisting that the kitchen was backed up, but while we waited, we watched the table next to us, who were seated after us, receive and finish their entire meal.  Based on the appetizer they did manage to serve, I'm not sure we were missing much.  We ordered the arancine.  They were under seasoned and textureless.  Their closest living relative would be nursing home food.If you are planning a special occasion, I would strongly recommend you do not chose this restaurant. It certainly added a bitter taste to our Valentine's Day.  There are plenty of better alternatives in the area...Olive Garden for one.

11.description: We recently enjoyed a beautiful 25 person dinner in the Garden room for my father's birthday. Maria took such good care of us, helping plan every detail of the menu, room, and other arrangements. The food, presentation, and service was fantastic.A visit from Martha, Joe, and a beautiful performance of Puccini (and Happy Birthday) made the evening perfectly memorable.We're looking forward to hosting more family gatherings at Monastero's in the future.

39.description: Went on a Friday night to cash in a groupon. Had frequently wondered how this place was , since i lived relatively close and drove by it often.  This place was very old school, and fulfilled the stereotype of an old school Italian eatery.  Fridays sat and sun their is live music, a piano player with a singer...very very enjoyable, they mainly played ragtime type music which made the place even better. You wouldn't get that at Olive garden nor Maggianos. I ordered chicken Marsala and my guest ordered the lasagna, both were delightful and full of freshly made pasta.  the calamari was perfectly tender, salads were cold and crisp, and the bread freshly baked and warm.  Excellent place for a date night, busy enough that its not a dead empty room, dimly lit, and ambient enough that you can keep your convo private. they were very helpful in seating us, given we didn't make reservations( you should!).  The service was delightful and very family-esque, save for our servers brain fart...she forgot to put in our order ( hence the 4 stars and not 5).  Would i return? Absolutely. old school, Italian owned , live music,classic fresh dishes at reasonable prices...you cant go wrong.

37.description: I think my third time to eat here and the food is mediocre.

0.description: We used Monastero's to cater our wedding, and we were blown away by the quality of their food. Italian sausage, pasta, chicken breast, salad; It was all delicious. It was actually the part of our reception that got the most compliments out of anything. Everybody loved it. Penny, the head of the restaurant, was a joy to work with. She was extremely down to earth and helpful. The only real drawback to working with them was the fact that they don'tdo delivery. We had to pick up the food ourselves, but it also made it much cheaper. So we can't really complain much. In fact, they were FAR more reasonable price-wise than any other place we got quotes from. Dealing with Caterers is usually highway robbery, so it's refreshing to find a place that is reasonable. I really can't recommend them enough for catering any event that requires excellent food.

38.description: Monastero's has been a restaurant that my family loves going to for family dinners when we all convene in Chicago.
