This place oozes of OG (original gangster), from the outside facade to the spotless service. The menu at Monastero's is torturous to me, so many things sound so amazing that it makes my decision feel like i'm missing out, only because I can't eat everything on the menu in one sitting. Lucky for me, my family loves to eat and they always manage to order every appetizer on the menu for all of us to share. I can't pick a favorite, they were all amazing.... oh and we ordered a cheese pizza to accompany the appetizers which was also perfectly crunchy, cheesy and just the right amount of deliciously seasoned red sauce. mmmmm.Their food is always exceptionally fresh and the flavor combinations send my taste buds into a welcomed foodgasm. My recent favorite: Pumpkin ravioli al gorgonzola. Oh my. The sweetness of the pumpkin filling paired with the creamy gorgonzola sauce and topped with chopped walnuts is a perfect combination of flavors and textures. I tried my best friend's pumpkin ravioli abbronzato, which was the pumpkin ravioli but in a sage burnt butter sauce topped with parmigiano was also a winner. Totally different flavor profile just by changing the sauce. There always seems to be a wedding reception in progress in the banquet room, so the people in the restaurant are always jovial and the music is very cheerful. This place oozes old world Italian, and gets my vote not only for authentic deliciously prepared Italian food, this place is the whole package: ambiance, food, service.

51.description: Oh so close to giving 5 stars, but I usually reserve that for uber amazing dining.  But for this type of old school, classic NW side Chicago Italian place, they DO provide a 5-star experience.  Food:  Got the manicotti which was divine.  I rarely notice the actual pasta in a dish like this but it was buttery soft and amazing - not overly thick but yet held together nicely.  Cheese & sauce were also excellent.  Seriously, I think it is hard to really mess up a fairly simple dish like this (I make it myself) but also hard to really set yourself apart.  This was goooood.  My friends also liked their entrees and one of them commented on the soup being especially good.Drink:  Wine at $25/bottle for a decent (tho not stunning) D'avolo was a good deal.  From the wines I saw on the menu, a short but decent variety and the markups were not crazy high.  Saw martinis on the menu for $7.50-8, which seems quite cheap for Chicago.Service:  AMAZING.  Waiter was fantastic.  He had no problem splitting the single kids meal we ordered for our two little guys.  A kids meal comes with a chocolate "sundae" and they gave one to each kid - nice touch.  Several folks checked on us (including the owner, I believe, lovely lady), but was just the right balance of being left alone to chat and meeting any need we might have.Family friendly:  The opera singing was a little loud for the kids when we first got there, but then it was piano most of the rest of the time we were there.  So everything was loud enough that it drowned out the Angry Birds-playing 5 year old but not so loud that we couldn't still converse with our friends.  We went because an Amazon local deal but we'll be back!!

27.description: Monastero's is a true testament to quality service and even better food! I hosted a group of 13 people for my graduation dinner and I could not be more impressed and satisfied with the experience!I booked the table a few weeks in advance and I was able to work with Maria, who was wonderful in helping me plan my menu! They were extremely flexible with the different options and assisted me in creating the perfect reduced menu for a group of people with different food needs! The menus were pre-printed on the cutest paper and Maria even printed my name and event on the top! It was totally unexpected and such a beautiful and thoughtful touch. Maria also suggested that I bring place cards and a seating chart which was perfectly arranged when I arrived the next day!I dropped everything off the day before the event and when my guests came in the appetizers were already being cooked in the kitchen! My guests loved the selection and the flavor, but most importantly the taste! We had the mussels, the calamari, the fried eggplant, and the "aranciatas" (friend risotto with ground beef made to look like a mini orange). Some of my guests have pretty high expectations and were all impressed and really enjoyed the food! In fact, I have some party animal friends who even found that the drinks were too strong! (You know a place is great if their drinks are too strong!)My friends especially loved the minestrone soup, the fried eggplant as well as the pumpkin ravioli! The ambiance was classy and we dined to the sounds of live piano music and the sights of flickering candles! Finally, at the end of the meal, several waitresses came out with a beautiful custom cake made from real strawberries and real creme (a la mode)! It was such a hit that one of my friends wanted to take the box home! All in all it was a wonderful experience! The waitresses and staff was perfect in that they made sure that we had everything and that the empty plates were immediately taken away. Maria and her wonderful staff have been planning events forever and Monastero's truly captures the warmth and genuine home-style quality of an Italian restaurant! Il cibo è delizioso!

32.description: Very nice waitress, but a bit slow. Good: spinach lasagna, which was 13 layers of very thin pasta and a fine ricotta cheese and a well ssauce, and no heavy mozzarella cheese. Bad: seafood risotto, which was heavy, with a LOT of butter. Gross and made me feel a bit ill. Don't think I'll return.

54.description: Bread was good.  Split pea soup was very good.  My bracciole was good but my bf's lasagna was probably the worst lasagna I've ever tasted in my life--completely bland.  Literally tasted like nothing.  Even the tomato sauce was tasteless, which is strange, I didn't think that was possible.  I kept trying to convince him to send it back and order something else, but he didn't want to.  They had a live piano player, who was playing occasionally, which was a charming touch.  Service was pretty bad.  Wait, I take that back, the service from the bus boys who kept coming around to refill our water was excellent.  The service from our SERVER was bad.  First of all, after we were seated, the bus boys came and gave us bread and water.  We then had to wait about 10 min before our server introduced herself and asked if we wanted any olive oil for our bread.  We asked for another minute to look over the menu and she dissappeared for about 10.  We were waiting around for about 10 min eating the bread with our menu's closed (the usual cue that we've made our selections) before she came back to take our order.  She came across as cold and unfriendly.  Never refilled our waters (the bus boys did) and only checked on us once during the entire meal.  My bf ordered his salad with the dressing on the side and she put it in the salad.I could hear two female servers bickering and fighting across the room.  One in particular was louder than the other.  Neither of them were shouting, but they were talking loud enough that I could clearly hear what they were saying and to hear the tone of voice.  At least pretend to get along around customers.  The whole bad-servers situation was really off-putting.  Overall, this restaurant is just O.K.  The food is decent but the servers are careless.  I get that this place is supposed to be a family-owned Italian restaurant, but I think maybe the servers are a little bit TOO close, or too comfortable and don't really act professional in their interactions with each other.  My server was not friendly, and the two arguing servers made me feel kind of uncomfortable, like I was walking in on a family fight that you have to try to pretend to ignore, but can feel the tension in the air.  I doubt I will come back here again.

48.description: First off, this review is of the banquet for a wedding not the restaurant. Second, this is not an opinion of the wedding in general because it was fun. This only referes to the amenities.So here we go. I didn't dine in the restaurant, wish I did because the food looked and smelled delicious. The banquet room side smelled like a combinatoin of wet carpet and shower mildew. Passed appetizers were arincini which were hard and filling-chippers. Chicken and pineapple skewers were garbage.Beef entree was decent but most likely I was starving. The chicken entreee was basically the chicken skewer served whole. The entree's definitely seemd like they've been sitting out. The twick cooked potatoe just peeled off cuz it was so stale it formed a hard shell.Last comment, for the bartender working the bar...you know who you are...try to crack a friggin' smile at least once and a "thank you" now and again would be appropriate. This is a wedding, people are in good moods and you are a cranky, sour-faced downer wearing your hatred for your miserable life on your face. I saw your tip jar and my friends were more than generous. The other servers were quick and helpful.I'll go back for the restaurant. The place looked nice and the food looked good and based on other reviews. Now why don't you just serve the same food on the banquet side. It's a $45 per plate minium...you cold do better.

44.description: First, I had my Wedding at Monastero's, It was the last banquet I had went to & I was starting to loose hope on finding one because I had my wedding on December 30th, 2011. everything was booked!!Maria, the owner welcomed me & offered the best food & service all for the price I had in budget. I could not ask for more for my wedding, If I have to re do it I'll be going back there for sure!Finally, it was last Sunday that I dined in the restaurant section and they did not disappoint me at all, great food, great service & great environment!!Defiantly would be my regular restaurant :)

24.description: Absolutely perfect!!  We go regularly for dinner and love it.  We just had our daughters bat mitzvah here.  It was wonderful.  We had a hundred people for a very special event in our lives.  We had the best time ever.  The meals were perfect. Soup hot and hearty, risotto yummy creamy and buttery tasting.  We had chicken and it was scrumptious.  Tender and flavorful. Not the rubber chicken you usually get at banquets.  We had a couple of requests for kosher meals and they accommodated us. The service was lovely. Everyone and I mean everyone made us feel like family. The monasteros family runs a first class restaurant.  We will be having more events there in the future.

7.description: Love love love this place! Service was great! Food was even better! Started with special $5 martins (on Fridays) and baked shrimp scampi which was soooooo good!! Then had minestrone soup which is to die for and I had the veal parmigiana...OMG good!My friend had the split pea soup to start and that was delicious too! His entree was the stuffed peppers and they were really delicious! Bottle of nice Chianti and we were good to go! You gotta eat here!

49.description: If you are looking for great Sicilian food, this is the best! My friend says their meatballs are the closest to his Sicilian mother's he has ever found. I love the minestrone soup and the bread. The tiramisu cake is out of this world. The family that owns the restaurant is so friendly and accommodating every time we are there. Prices are very reasonable for all the yummy food that you get. Whenever we have friends visit, we always take them here.

40.description: The food was good and lots of it.  The place is kind of out of the way for us and we were the youngest people there.  We used our Groupon.  Going back.

53.description: Went to Monastero's for the first time ever for lunch.  The restaurant itself attracts an older crowd and serves traditional Italian food.  The atmosphere is old-school, but the food is fabulous.  That's right, fabulous.They provided warm bread and little breadsticks with a basket of butter while you wait for your meal.  Don't worry all you hardcore Italian folk - they also had poured olive oil and a carafe of parmesan.  Yum!I ordered the stuffed pepper on the specials menu and my Italian BF ordered the chicken marsala.  Then our entrees arrived.  Everything was cooked just right.  Lots of flavor and depth.  The marinara on my stuffed pepper tastes just like my BF's grandmother's sauce, so it's definitely homemade the real Italian way.  And the marsala sauce was one of the best I've ever had.This is definitely a neighborhood gem and we will be returning.  :)

30.description: Worst New Year's cooking in 2010. Everything was warmed over and the restaurant had only senior citizens, (nothing wrong with that) but food was abismal.  Someone is well past their singing prime, but the soprano was enjoyable.  It would have been honest to NOT serve rather than warm up potato chunks that were dark brown.  We were puzzled at how bad the food was, so we drank our drinks and headed for another place.Who knows, maybe now they have a new chef or same one with more training.  This place has lost the younger crowd and has a reputation as a place for seniors.

46.description: We had a five star experience at our son's wedding reception. Every detail was perfect, food, service, music, and venue. The appetizers of arincini, meatballs, and margherita pizza were delicious. The dinner of minestrone soup (best I've ever had), salad, entrée of either chicken parmesan or spinach lasagna to lemon ice were served on time, the perfect temperature and serving size. The wedding cake was light and creamy and the sweet table was ten feet long and absolutely delicious. The DJ, Berto, offered something for every age as well as great dinner music. With very short notice he put together a video montage for us that really helped start the evening off well. He had all of us dancing until the very end. We've had friends calling us to say what a wonderful time and what delicious food they had and we concur. Talk to Maria at Monastero's to plan your next event, she helped us through it all with grace and style.

1.description: We had a wonderful dinner last night at Montastero's. The calamari were fresh , my gnocchi were little pillows of heaven & the pasta melted in your mouth.

55.description: Great traditional Italian fare.  Great value, great atmosphere, and great service.  I recommend!

9.description: Monastero's is a true testament to quality service and even better food! I hosted a group of 13 people for my graduation dinner and I could not be more impressed and satisfied with the experience!I booked the table a few weeks in advance and I was able to work with Maria, who was wonderful in helping me plan my menu! They were extremely flexible with the different options and assisted me in creating the perfect reduced menu for a group of people with different food needs! The menus were pre-printed on the cutest paper and Maria even printed my name and event on the top! It was totally unexpected and such a beautiful and thoughtful touch. Maria also suggested that I bring place cards and a seating chart which was perfectly arranged when I arrived the next day!I dropped everything off the day before the event and when my guests came in the appetizers were already being cooked in the kitchen! My guests loved the selection and the flavor, but most importantly the taste! We had the mussels, the calamari, the fried eggplant, and the "aranciatas" (friend risotto with ground beef made to look like a mini orange). Some of my guests have pretty high expectations and were all impressed and really enjoyed the food! In fact, I have some party animal friends who even found that the drinks were too strong! (You know a place is great if their drinks are too strong!)My friends especially loved the minestrone soup, the fried eggplant as well as the pumpkin ravioli! The ambiance was classy and we dined to the sounds of live piano music and the sights of flickering candles! Finally, at the end of the meal, several waitresses came out with a beautiful custom cake made from real strawberries and real creme (a la mode)! It was such a hit that one of my friends wanted to take the box home! All in all it was a wonderful experience! The waitresses and staff was perfect in that they made sure that we had everything and that the empty plates were immediately taken away. Maria and her wonderful staff have been planning events forever and Monastero's truly captures the warmth and genuine home-style quality of an Italian restaurant! Il cibo è delizioso!

26.description: If you've ever been to Sicily and miss the food, then get in here NOW! This is the closest you can to a dining experience in Palermo. U sacciu. Try everything. Ho la pancia quina adesso.

25.description: Having attended several dinners and  luncheons at Monasteros, it seemed a natural for my son's wedding. Everything was perfect! The food, the pricing, the room and ambience, the wait staff, and most of all, Maria, who personality made sure the evening was as promised. My son and daughter-in-law greatly enjoyed their wedding. I have one more child to marry off, and we'll happily choose Monestaros again. It's also an excellent place for pizza!Susan V.

12.description: We booked Monastero's for our wedding venue.  We liked the idea of having our wedding at a restaurant and the price was cheap.  Unfortunately, we found that we got what we paid for.  Their website advertised that they had a hall that could hold 300 people.  We needed a large space since we both come from very large families.  At our first appointment, I met with Penny.  Penny is hands down the nicest person, however our wedding seemed to be a bit much for her.  The first problem occurred when Penny told me that in fact, the space could only hold 250 people.  I agreed since I liked the space.  At our meeting, she took all of our other relevant information and we agreed the wedding would start at 5:00 and end at midnight.  We also agreed that we'd have the service and reception in the same space with a cocktail hour to be held in a common hall.All seemed to be copasetic until my florist happened to call to set up the logistics of the evening.  I received a call that day from Maria at Monastero's saying there was a problem since the florist wanted an hour to turn the room.  I told her I didn't see any problem with that since we had the cocktail hour.  She told me that we didn't have an hour since the cocktail space wouldn't hold 150 comfortably.  I informed her we had 250 people and she said "that's not what Penny wrote down".  She told me she'd call me back with solutions to this problem.Her solutions included having a wedding early in the afternoon, inviting people to the reception but not the service or having the service in the same room as the reception with it set for the reception where people may or may not be able to see.  We finally compromised on having an earlier ceremony in a different room and then moving to the Botticelli Room for the cocktail hour/reception.  I always to try to be easy to work with, but we now had to move up our wedding an hour, be set firmly on time (as another wedding would be in the room later that evening) and hope it didn't rain as the two rooms were in two different buildings. In the weeks leading up to the wedding, Maria took over from Penny.  She worked with our planner well.  However, she is very stern and unwilling to compromise on issues.  It turns out that 250 people don't even comfortably fit in the room if you want something crazy like a band and Maria wouldn't help work around any of the band or seating requirements.On the day of the wedding, there was a terrible accident on the highway so many of our guests were late.  But due to the fact that we had to cater to the other wedding, Maria would not let us delay the service.  We had a good portion of our guests late or absent from our wedding.  Overall, our experience with both Penny and Maria were not positive.  On the plus side, the package is, as noted, affordable.  You get an open bar, restaurant quality food, cake, chair covers and napkins, etc. in the package.  If you do end up booking here, just make sure all of your ducks are in a row.

59.description: My hubby and I had our bridal shower in the Garden Room. The room is beautiful, the food was delicious, and the service is wonderful.  I worked mostly with Maria, she was always attentive to our questions and accommodating to our requests. It was relieving to work with such a great venue. I would recommend Monastero's to anyone who likes good quality service.

evening) and hope it didn't rain as the two rooms were in two different buildings. 17.description: Monastero's is such an amazing restaurant that makes you feel like family. I recently worked with Maria Monastero with the planning of my wedding reception. Generally speaking planning a wedding is said to be a stressful endeavor but that wasn't the case for us. Maria and her staff went above and beyond with every aspect of our special day. The food was exceptional and the wedding cake was heavenly. Every detail was painstakingly prepared and we couldn't be happier. Thank you so much for giving us a truly magical celebration.

10.description: I've been coming here for more than 28 years.   My wedding rehearsal dinner and my mother's 70th birthday party were celebrated here.   Monastero's ALWAYS exceeds my expectations.  Wonderful atmosphere, excellent waitstaff but most importantly the delicious menu.   Options for all tastes.  I have never been disappointed.  Every employee makes you feel special.  I highly recommend Monastero's.  Mary Ellen

5.description: On a scale of 1-10....I give it a 100!!!!!!  I had my wedding there almost two weeks ago and I'm stillll pretending that the night didn't end! From the set up/decor to the exceptional & detailed service....and the food?  Oh god the food was simply delicious!!!! They were able to accomodate food allergies which was huge cause my husband can't have any dairy or egg.  I could go on and on about this place Monastero's by far beat out the swanky downtown hotels- they made my fairy tale wedding come true. I highly recommend them for any event or simply just a beautiful dinner in the restaurant!

3.description: While the restaurant part of monasteros looked very cozy and inviting with live piano and a romantic vibe. This review focuses more on the banquet service as I didn't get to eat in the restaurant. Based on the food and service I received at the banquet I would not go back. We started with the minestrone soup which was about the only good thing I was served. Next came the salad which was really bad. Old stale lettuce with a few slices of tomato and cucumber. I was literally embarrassed for them. Finally came the entree. The steak was covered in some type of gravy and it tasted like dog food. The chicken was nice and tender but very salty just tasted bad. The entree did come with vegetables which had a nice flavor to them. The service was slow and everybody was starving by the time they finally brought the soup out and started the meal service. After that experience I would never choose to host an event there. There are far too many more places in the area that put a little more effort into the food and service. I do however want to stop in and check out the restaurant as it the plates I saw looked and smelled delicious and the atmosphere was great.

35.description: please ignore my last review. apparently we signed up for program which allows groupon to be notified when we use our credit card at various merchants, my bad.. good food and owner was very kind in explaining the privacy issue.

19.description: There are some fantastic people at Monastero's!Monastero's hosted our wedding reception last week and they were a dream to work with. Maria helped us plan the event, offered great ideas for the evening and took care of so many details that we never would have thought of on our own. We couldn't have been happier with how everything turned out! Most of all, we really enjoyed working with people who were so enthusiastic (instead of going through the motions - something we experienced at other potential reception venues). We felt like the event was as important to them as it was to us.On top of that, the food is pretty amazing as well!We definitely recommend Monastero's to anyone looking for a wedding reception venue in Chicago!

28.description: I really had a wonderful time here. Live piano playing and a singer that knocked my socks off. Delicious bruschetta, uhmazing lasagna and the atmosphere was just wonderful. The servers were right on top of everything. Impressive all the way around.

45.description: We had our wedding & reception at Monastero's a couple of weeks ago.  My husband came across this place during our planning, and we never looked back.  The restaurant is family owned, and everyone was super helpful.  We dined here before we booked our contract, and the food, atmosphere, and staff were all incredibly helpful.  During the planning process, Maria was super helpful and answered all of our questions.  We were able to have the ceremony and reception in different rooms, and everything turned out just fabulous.  Monastero's was very flexible with respect to getting things set up, courteous to our other vendors that day, and just plain nice people.  Our reception was originally scheduled to be in Gina's room, but we were bumped up to the Botticelli room due to a conflict - the bigger room fit our ~120 guests very comfortably, and the atmosphere led to most of our guests letting us know that this was the most fun they've ever had at a wedding.  Thanks, Monastero's!

33.description: I'm sorry I hate to do this but the two stars is actually a compliment.  The owner and the waitresses are very nice. And I've tried to come here a few more times hoping that the food would get better but it never has. The first time I had the pasta with meat sauce. The meat sauce was terrible. The second time we came here I ordered the filet and I know I shouldn't order my filets well done but that's how I like them. Needless to say, the first time they served to me, it was rare. I sent it back and it came back medium.  The party I was with had all eaten so I now had to take a different order home with me. And now the third and final time of trying this place, I ordered the bbq ribs and they were terrible. No flavor, no nothing. They need to hire new cooks. The restaurant is very pleasant and like I said the owners and staff are so nice.  I hope the owners see this and do something with the cooks. Sorry we won't be back.

43.description: Very nice.  I can't believe that I've lived in this area for years and not known about the place.  Good, solid Sicilian cuisine and a sauce that my Grandma Carmela would approve of  - served over and around wild boar ravioli.  Just yummy.My husband had the braciole and was pleased as well.  We shared a bottle of I think a Stemmari Pinot Noir? and enjoyed it.Terrific, attentive service, too and it was nice to hear piano while we ate.  All in all, I'd go back when I feel the urge for some deep, rich, flaverful meat ragu over al dente pasta like grandma used to make.

2.description: We loved Monastero's! Superb Italian classics perfectly prepared. From the minute we walked in with our two kids, the service was top notch. Great experience, delicious food, friendly and professional service, charming space. There's a reason it's been here for 50+ years - this family knows hospitality!

18.description: Had a wonderful dinner at Monastero's . Great selection between the menu and daily specials. The food was delicious. The restaurant has a comfortable old world decor and the wait staff is friendly and attentive. Will return again soon.

41.description: This establishment is about as old school as you can get. I am thinking that is one of the reasons why I like it so much. I think the decor is the same that is was when it first opened.  The other BIG factor was the service. Our server did a great job and everyone was very transparent as if they were not even there. They did not get in the way of our enjoyment of the meal. Oh, I forgot to mention that  food here is pretty darn good also!.I love Italian food and this place really did it for me. From the soup and bread to the pasta and the dessert, Everything was outstanding. There was not a weak spot in the entire meal. Everything kept on getting better and better. This is going to be one of my top Italian restaurants in Chicago!

52.description: Great food and service.  Amallia is a great and attentive server.  Very authentic tasting and fairly reasonable.  Older setting and crowd but food more than compensates.  Get some great deals during their anniversary year!

50.description: While I'm a fan of the food, which is authentic Italian, this place could use a little bit of a makeover to attract some younger diners.  We were the youngest group there on a Saturday night.  Also, they need to tone down the Opera Music. Yes, they are talented but we had to switch tables because they were literally next to us and screaming.. I loved our server by the way - I wish I remembered her name, but she seemed so happy to see a group under the age of 65 there and she joked around with us.  I'd definitely bring my dad there...

4.description: Revised. My family is visiting Chicago and was looking for an authentic family Italian restaurant. FOUND IT. The food was fresh, well prepared, nicely presented and best of all absolutely delicious. The service was perfectly timed, friendly and engaging. Even got to meet Martha the owner who was a gracious hostess and just fun to talk to.Went back for a second night and loved the pizza too. Crazy if you don't try try this place.

6.description: Great food, good environment. A little expensive. Owner was there and talking with people. Live music!Great date niggt

22.description: My husband I looked into Monastero's for our wedding venue and thought that it was a wonderful banquet option. We worked with Penny who offered exceptional service from start to finish. Monastero's offers great prices and delicious food. We visited the restaurant one night to try out all of the dishes we would want to offer our guests and loved all of them. Ultimately, we went for another venue simply because we wanted a non-banquet option, but had we decided to go the banquet route, this definitely would have been the place we would have chosen. And we will definitely be back to enjoy the restaurant!

15.description: This is truly a great dining experience; from the live music being played during dinner to the exceptional waiting staff, Monastero's is hands down one of best Italian restaurants in the State.Everything was prepared to perfection...reminded me of my time spent in Italy years ago and how unforgettable the food was anywhere I went throughout the country.  The chicken risotto is to die for...so many great dishes to choose from...and all the ones I sampled that evening were off the charts.I can't wait to return and dine again.  Kudos to Maria and her family!

57.description: I just recently had my wedding here and all I have to say is Monastero's is the best!!! The staff is so helpful and personable. Maria and Penny will help you with your every need. If you are looking for a classic beautiful wedding venue this is it. Also, of course, the food is amazing!!! You can pick from a variety of dinner menu options that will fit a range of wedding budgets. Food, serves, and setting are just great...what more could you ask for in a wedding venue/caterer!

20.description: Monastero's is such an amazing restaurant that makes you feel like family. I recently worked with Maria Monastero with the planning of my wedding reception. Generally speaking planning a wedding is said to be a stressful endeavor but that wasn't the case for us. Maria and her staff went above and beyond with every aspect of our special day. The food was exceptional and the wedding cake was heavenly. Every detail was painstakingly prepared and we couldn't be happier. Thank you so much for giving us a truly magical celebration.

36.description: i dont review often, but i had to mention this little gem. I have lived within 2 miles of this place my entire life, and have never gone here. I cashed in a groupon, and i was very suprised at how great this place was. I ordered the chicken parm, and loved it. My wife ordered  Chicken pasta dish that she also loved. The Portions are huge, the bread is made fresh, and the best part is the SERVICE! They are all so nice and friendly, know their food, and always checked up on us to make sure we were treated great. i loved this place and will go back in the future.

14.description: This is a really great Italian restaurant. When I walked in, I really had a sense I had entered a family owned business that was an institution in the area. This was reflected by a staff that was extremely friendly and warm. They have a live pianist, which sets the mood. The restaurant also has cool decorations such as puppets that adorned our table and looked like the three musketeers. The eggplant parmesan was perfect. The eggplant was very tender and moist. The cheese was baked golden. The butternut squash pasta was also good but wasn't amazing.

58.description: The food here is really good. But what makes this a five star place is that the salads are delicious, fresh, huge, and made to order. This is something that you don't see in a lot of fast food places. I recommend the shrimp. Cute decor also.

56.description: Oh dear.  Guess I'm not the only one who noticed that the counter guy is miserable and rude.  Don't work in customer service if you hate life!  Other personnel not much better.  Had to beg for the correct silverware.  Ultimately ended up with food poisoning from bad shrimp.  I used to like this place.  What happened?

29.description: I have been coming here for many years now, and I will continue to do so. The food is amazing, and the staff is so friendly, and funny. Nice place to bring your family, great atmosphere!

42.description: Your ordinary nice restaurant with great salads and burgers

23.description: Receipt ticket #........699 or 999 tonight.  I stopped in on my way home.  I learned of this place during a visit to Foremost on Lincoln & Peterson a couple months ago.  The wings smelled so good, I had to ask where they were bought.  Finally today was the day.  Full of anticipation, that I might have a new place when I need a wing fix.  I got the 1/2 lb cheeseburger and the 12 piece wings (HOT!!!!!).  I was sorely disappointed.    The celery was old, and I swear it looked like booger had been smeared on the foil the celery had been wrapped in.  The wings that were suppose to be HOT!!!! had no flavor.  I could almost swear the wings had been rinsed off.  They were bad.  I wish I was exaggerating this experience but it is true.  The wings did not even seem to have been warmed up, but they were supposedly fried and made fresh.  Not as far as I could tell.  They were room temperature, BUT I WAITED THE FULL TIME AS THOUGH THEY HAD BEEN MADE TO ORDER.  The burger was alright.  However, seeing my dissatisfaction with the main reason for stopping in the restaurant (FOR THE FIRST TIME), I just ate the burger cause it was dinner.  The meal was shared, I advised the other person the wings were HORRIBLE, they needed to be put in the oven and had no taste.  Needless to say, this was the first and last time BYB will see me.

47.description: I am not a salad kind of guy but their Chopped Chicken Salad is incredible. I work in the area and everytime i have ordered food from this place i have been extremely satisfied. I order here at least 2 times a week. The employees are friendly, the food comes out fast and delicious. Its hard to complain about anything here. Great restaurant

8.description: The food is amazing.  We get salads from there all the time. Love them.  They also have great wraps.  I keep going back for the food, but I always wonder, why is the help always such Debbie Downers.  Never a smile, you're lucky if you get a thank you out of them, like they could care less that you're even there and I'm pretty sure at least one, if not two of the guys are the owners.  You'd think they would be a little friendlier to their customers.

31.description: Backyard Grill has the best roasted chicken I have ever tasted in a place like this.  Always moist, tender and flavorful, it comes with a generous portion of rice and oven brown potatoes.  I also like the salads here a lot and the housemade soups.  The burgers here have always been good but they recently improved them with fresh meat, nicer buns and leaf lettuce instead of chopped and now they're even better!  With plenty of clean, comfortable seating, endlessly refillable sodas, reasonable prices, and free wi-fi, it's one of my favorite places to eat.

34.description: I got turned on to this place by my boss, we loved the Barbecued Chicken dinner. Out of this world garlic mashed. We order all the time now. And I've tried different things on the menu, filet kabobs are great! chicken kabobs are fantastic. I highly recommend this resterant.

16.description: Food wise, this place is awesome! Never had a bad meal here. My favorites include the Ceasar wrap, Oriental Chicken wrap and the french fries. Salads look great too! I've heard good things about their frozen yogurt too. Other than that, parking is OK and the lines at lunch are a bit long.

13.description: I have eaten at backyard grill many times and I have to say they are pretty consistent. I have had everything from salads to burgers.  I also am a huge fan of their onion rings and chicken caesar  wrap.  My only dislike would be they are a little more pricey so I can't stop there as often as I would like.

11.description: Service was friendly and fun but when the food came and had to eat it...awful. Beef was greasy and nasty that led into the soup with a layer of grease and serious heartburn. I really wanted this place to be good because some wonderful personality dishing out beef and plates but the food was super sub-standered. I hoped I caught it on a bad day but 2nd chance got me nasty attitudes and same poor tasting food. How do you have a "beef stand" and not be good more than just a one time go? No reason EVER for me to go back...like it was my fault their food sucked. And the service staff some how blamed me? Don't go!

39.description: Customer service can be improved. They have great chilli and that works for me. The four stars is for the chilli.

37.description: Love the chicken kabob plate...the chicken was so juicy and tender. Customer service has improved significantly from my other reviews as well. The young woman at the counter was so sweet!

0.description: Excellent food!  We have tried several menu items and have yet to find any item we don't love.  Fresh and delicious salads, my favorite is the Greek salad with chicken. This place surprisingly has the best ribs!  The meat falls right off the bone, they are really fantastic. I have used these guys for catering as well and everyone always loves it! I highly recommend Backyard Grill.

38.description: Always fresh lettuce and veg. Great for a Greek plate (gyros, spinach pie, kabobs, grilled chicken)They even make me feta lemon fries. YumSelf serve popthe parking is a total drag for a car that's not a compact. ..skinniest spots I've ever seen.

51.description: Hits the spot!Was driving by - was hungry - stopped in - ordered a cheese burger with everything - and fries.Service was good and wow was that cheese burger tasty!Recommended!

27.description: O STARS!Terrible customer service.  I should call the cops and report this restaurant.

32.description: I've given this place 3 chances now and not one good experience. The cashiers rush you wether it's busy or slow and they're never friendly or helpful. I'm a huge fan of gyros and their gyros was terrible, their chicken was average at best. My friend had their new style cheese burger since they recently changed their burgers and said it was good. I will not be going back.

54.description: First and last time I'll ever go there. Ordered a Gyro but got something that looked like jerky cause it was so overcooked with no flavor. Never knew a gyro could taste like a frozen hamburger. After looking at some of the reviews, these guys are probably slipping cause the guy who took the order had a huge chip on his shoulder...Can't even finish it, the worst I've ever had in Chicago for more than thirty years

48.description: Honestly, It's a joke reading a bad review about this Restaurant. The food here is beyond amazing, the workers are extremely nice (especially the cashier guy ), the atmosphere and layout is great, the restrooms are clean... what else can a valued customer want? The Chicken Sandwiches are number #1 in town, I've tried chicken sandwiches from Portillos to Chilies, and nothing can be compared to Backyard Grill. 5-stars!

44.description: Always have and always will order the Steak sandwich here.  One of the better ones I've had at a local restaurant.  Prices on all menu items are def. fair.  Big Guy at register is flat out weird.  One day he is extra chill and cool and the next he is grouchy and just unpleasant to deal with.  He's the reason for the 4 stars and not the five...

24.description: I pretty much go here once or two a week when i do not bring my lunch to work. My favorite is grilled chicken salad,turkey sub,sweet potato fries,also their chicken sandwiches are good. If you are dining in or pick up call ahead it can get really crazy up in there. I know some of you mention the staff is rude, i haven't experience that , i been there in the past year over 50+ times and they always been nice to me.

7.description: I always get the chicken breast plate with potatoes and rice as the sides and it is always amazing  worth the $10 or whatever it costs

49.description: I envisioned this place like the old Nicks that once stood.  I was horribly mistaken.  My first impression started with a greaseball cashier who had a tattoo of betty boop on his arm.  He refused to look at me while i made my order.  The menu was just a giant cluster f$&* of food that goes out faster than Usain Bolt.  The overdone crepe bar is just a sorry excuse for another dumb@$$ gimmick.  The gyros i ordered probably came from the 4 day old gyros that was half eaten by the busboy.  It did not settle well at ALL.  And whatever you do, NEVER order the $25 family dinner - ive made better decisions in the middle of Dothan, Alabama with $4 in my pocket.

40.description: We've been going to Backyard Grill for a few years now. It's a favorite we return to over and over. For myself, it's the array of salads with actually fresh mixed greens that I go for. Imagine, a reasonably priced place that has something beyond iceberg lettuce. The rest of my family prefers the sandwiches and dinner plates. We love the large quantity (great for leftovers) but ti's the tasty food that keeps us coming back.

53.description: I work close to here and often call in with multiple orders.  The orders are always correct, very fast service, fresh food, and great customer service.  They have a great selection of salads when you're looking for healthy food as well as an excellent selection of grilled meats and sandwiches.  This place has something for everyone!

30.description: The food is really good one of my favorites in the area.  They give you enough for two meals at least.  My favorite is the chicken salad and the bakalava is always a treat.  But that dude at the front register (the short fat guy) is a arse.  He could use a bit of understanding on how ambience and service are a part of the experience even in a $ restaurant.  Kick him out or adjust his attitude.

46.description: The food is ok, but the service is on the rude side. Not a greeting by the guy in front of the door, not even a fake smile to greet the customer, floors are dirty tables are not clean. Whoever is in charge of cleaning is behind the counter talking too each other, just take it to go!

1.description: I used to go here so many times in the past when we lived around the area and I did recall liking most of the food we ordered here...However, we ordered a bunch of food-gyro basket(lots of meat), philly cheesesteak(i wasnt too impressed by), rib and chicken combo(ribs were tough to chew, chicken was alright), cheeseburger(nothing special). I have to say the best thing you can get here is the chicken carbonara which had some bacon bits! Service was quick and seating options abundant and spacious.

55.description: Had the chopped chicken salad after a week long bender which required some roughage. While I am not a salad guy this thing was great, packed with bacon, avocado, onion, tomato, feta, etc. I have heard a lot about the grumpy guy behind the counter from yelpers.....who cares. He took my order, got it right and I moved on with my life. If I wanted to spend time at an establishment where the employees thought I was awesome I would have eaten at a strip club. Get over it.

9.description: I usually come here to eat once in a while because its close to my house and most of the time the food here is great. I know the people who work here very well as I have been coming here since I was young. But I do have only one problem with this place. Although I know some people here, I think there is a new rookie in the back because when I order what I usually do (Italian Beef w/Fries and a Drink) The fries were not tasting pleasant as usual at all. I think he may have fried it along with something or maybe they weren't cooked right because it was terrible but it was only once that this happened to me. Anyway, if your a newcomer here, I would recommend an Italian Beef w/Fries or a Double Cheese Burger w/Fries and hopefully the fries will be better :) I will change my review next time I come here.

26.description: The food is ok. But the staff. The staff if horrible. SO rude. I would give zero stars if I could, because of their terrible staff. Such a shame.

25.description: Shouldn't the place that calls itself backyard grill have outside seating?  Just sayin'...For some reason my coworkers love this place for its salads, but the portions are usually so huge and the protein so oily...that it probably defeats the purpose of having a salad.  I tried the hamburger last time around and it was just a-ok...not sure why they ask if you want it done medium when they can only make them well done.  Too many things on the menu, which backyard grill has = not being able to do anything that well.   This simple law definitely holds true at this place!

12.description: First visit here today. Good burger, and the bun was great. Had some of the best onion rings I've had in while.I'll be going back for sure.

59.description: It was fine.  My chicken kabob was tasty and not dried out.  Overall a good experience.  I'd go back if it was convenient.  LOTS of choices on the menu.

21.description: I've been going here for a while. I really like their subs! There have been a lot of posts about the rude service. I must admit that they used to have some stand-offish people working there.  They must have gotten the message because they've been really nice lately. I'm addicted to their turkey sub.

17.description: The gyros plate is amazing! Their sauce is the reason why I love the gyros! Huge portions, and I have yet to have a complaint about their food. Their seating area is cool like a backyard party on a deck. Worth it!

10.description: They give you a great portion, which makes up for the expensive menu. I like the fries and everyone behind the counter is very nice. Overall, a good stop for lunch.

5.description: A little bit overpriced but the taste of the food makes up for it. I guess you get what you pay for  and definitely worth the money !!!  It's been few years since I've been here for lunch and the good thing I see here is the same people still working here with a big smile and great attitude  which goes to tell me that they enjoy their job and don't treat it like a job , it's more than that. Thank you guys and please don't change anything.  This place is perfect the way it is!!!

3.description: Have been here a few times because a friend and her daughter really love it.  The food is not bad but the last time we went I ordered the children's chicken meal and the chicken was horrible.  It looked like it had been cooked for a week! I broke it open and there was absolutely nothing you could salvage and it was cold to boot!  It looked and I imagine tasted like rubber. Very nicely I took it to the counter and they were very nice and replaced it with chicken that was properly cooked.  I received my meal at the same time, the spinach pie which I really, really do enjoy.  It has a great taste. But this time the spinach pie and the rice was cold I don't mean even lukewarm I mean cold! Bit my tongue on that one it tasted good and I certainly didn't need to return a second meal and get it back with  spit in it. So I guess it's a hit or miss here.  And I agree with other reviews, the guy usually running the register is quite unfriendly.

35.description: Don't let the lack of curb appeal fool you... the food is very good. Especially the chicken kabobs with rice, gyro, greek salad and lots more. The interior layout is in desperate need of a makeover. The two tier dining room is unnecessary and somewhat strange. If they EVER remodel like Dengeo's did in Skokie, they'd have huge business. (Sometimes you have to spend money to make money...) Aside from that, the food is great.

19.description: Shouldn't the place that calls itself backyard grill have outside seating?  Just sayin'...For some reason my coworkers love this place for its salads, but the portions are usually so huge and the protein so oily...that it probably defeats the purpose of having a salad.  I tried the hamburger last time around and it was just a-ok...not sure why they ask if you want it done medium when they can only make them well done.  Too many things on the menu, which backyard grill has = not being able to do anything that well.   This simple law definitely holds true at this place!

28.description: Greek? Sure, it has Greek food, but a whole bunch of other stuff.This is a staple of lunch hours for our work staff, so this review is a bit biased.My coworkers always get salads and sausages and chicken sandwiches, but the burgers, IMO are good. Really good for quick service. Gourmet? Nope. As good as what you make in your backyard - yeah probably.The staff isn't rude - they just don't care about you as a person. They want you to order, give them money, and they give you food. Don't expect them to bend over backwards - this is a no nonsense place.If you want to make your life easy, call ahead and order. The food is always ready within 10 minutes.

45.description: For what I had.. this was solid.  I went in with a mixed set of expectations and was pleasantly surprised.  Basically a "no frills" operation with a broad grill-type menu.  I ordered the Chicken Philly and a drink.  A tad expensive in the $8.25 range for that, so I thought.  However, after seeing the produced sandwich, I think I got the value and was glad I didn't order a side with it... that would have been too much.  Nice juicy chunks of seasoned chicken, onions and peppers with a generous amount of tasty cheese.My only complaint, and it's a small one, was that it seemed to take a long time to produce it.  But upon consuming it, I'll wait for it again.

33.description: Ordered the 1/2 burger combo. I loved the burger. Fries were ok. Great interior. Food took a little longer than most places. Prolly cause i ordered a well done cheese burger. Thats ok though since the burger itself was awesome. Decent amount of parking.

43.description: It's ok wouldn't go back since I have had better.  Ordered the shrimp appetizer and along came a mini fish bone.  The carcass was small so I wasn't sure what type offish was included in the shrimp appetizers.  It was weird, they brought us a new one but still charged us which I thought was not the best thing for customer service.  I won't be back not because of this but it wasn't all that!

2.description: When walking in don't bother saying "hi" or "hello" just give them your order rude owners who have poor customer appreciation and yea they got greasy cheeseburgers

18.description: Been coming here since I was young . I love this place as well as the owners are very nice . Awesome food . You can never go wrong with anything on the Menu .

41.description: Food wise, this place is awesome! Never had a bad meal here. My favorites include the Ceasar wrap, Oriental Chicken wrap and the french fries. Salads look great too! I've heard good things about their frozen yogurt too. Other than that, parking is OK and the lines at lunch are a bit long.

52.description: Cool owner/manager onsite most of the time, he doesn't smile much but he's a good guy and he'll chat you up while you are waiting for your food. They also have great food and fair pricing. Given the huge portions, I think they could charge more if they chose to do so. The salads are all great! All the produce appears to be super fresh, never brown, saggy or soft, always crisp, I love it! One time I got stuck in the place while riding my bike when a thunderstorm broke out, I kept ordering stuff. Been a fan ever since!

50.description: I agree with the other Yelpers that say the one man who works the cashier sometimes seems to be in a bad mood quite frequently and acts like he is annoyed by everything,  but you only have to deal with him for less than a minute so not a big deal to me.  The young girls that work there are always smiling and sweet and they have a great grilled cheese sandwich, they give you soo much cheese and the bread is Delicious!

4.description: Backyard grill is near my work, so I've been there many times. Everything I've had has been delicious.! They have a pretty diverse menu, so I feel like I'm being challenged to find something that I don't like on there. Nothing fancy, but the food is excellent with very big portions. I typically can only eat half of the meal, so then I take the rest home and get two meals for the price of one;) I definitely recommend checking them out.

6.description: Have been back here several times. Close to home and I like the place now period same owners but they have new people working the counter. Those people are awesome their food is very good the prices are reasonable.

22.description: I love their gyros and pitas.  We always order a few extra pitas on the side because the kids love them and I like 2 smaller gyros better than one big one.  Their kebabs are good, my daughter likes the chicken strips.  Everybody talks about the cashier.  He's so funny, yeah a big crab but he's trying harder now and he's actually smiled at us and asks how we're doing.  People are so critical these days, trying to get back at these mom and pop places because they've been slighted. Who cares?  What counter type restaurant gives unbelievable service?  I notice it more when someone is nice than not anymore.  I like the place, I like the guy.

15.description: Burgers were good. Sort of greasy but hey without the grease it wouldn't be a burger but too much grease just didn't taste right. Got fries with the burgers. Fries are hand cut or machine cut at the restaurant. They got my order mixed up. Ordered 1/2lb burger and 1/3lb cheeseburger. Burgers got reversed, got 1/2lb cheeseburger and 1/3lb burger. Order was input right but the cooks got it mixed up. Whatever!!! Also, ordered a turkey sub, mediocre at best. I thought I would get real turkey carvings or shavings like the turkey just got cooked and it's ready for carving or shavings but nope just got regular turkey slices that looks like it came out of a store packaging. Maybe some melted swiss cheese would of help the sub get more of a apealing taste and look, but it wasn't offered to me. Oh well.  The restaurant was clean for restaurant standards. Table and chairs were greasy and looks like the place overall needed a good scrubbing down.Overall, place was busy and got busier when we sat to eat. But, I always get a feeling when I come into a restaurant it is not as busy but after I order or walk into a place people start coming in. My wife calls it a blessing and I am blessing the restaurant making money for them.However, I want to come back to place and try their chicken wings (jumbo) and gyros plate. Not sure if they have chicken gyros. Hopefully they do but I didn't ask. Would give this place 3.5 stars but not an option. Food: 3 starsStaff Friendliness: 5 starsRestaurant Cleaniness: 2.5 stars

57.description: I really like this place I've had them cater my children's parties, I really enjoy their Greek chicken potatoes and rice my biggest problem is their service. I'm placing huge orders! Please smile at me a little gratitude goes a long way.

20.description: I ordered  a chicken wrap. The lettuce was brown and wilted . Gross. . This was not the first time that this has happened. I had ordered Greek salad, hamburgers and wraps before and for some reason they all had wilted brown lettuce. Not coming back anymore.

36.description: Got the Mediterranean style chicken dinner and the BBQ ribs. The food was ok, nothing memorable.

14.description: Excellent skirt steak and Greek salad and great friendly staff every time!! Highly recommend!!!
